Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Has clic aquí para Español


At Sunu we believe that human willpower is capable of overcoming any limitation, so we boost it using the best of technology and design. Our first product, the Sunu Band, is an inclusive smart-bracelet along with an object tracker that empowers mobility and independence for the visually impaired.

Sunu band is the first smart band using ultrasonic technology to sense the user’s surroundings and deliver haptic feedback on his wrist to indicate proximity. Sunu band can also give you the time with its discrete vibrational watch feature and can help you find your missing objects with the Sunu Tag; a tiny beacon like device that can be clipped to any personal object (Sunu Tag can also be tracked from your smartphone in case you don’t have the band).

Our campaign’s mission is to generate impact in the lives of people living with impaired vision. Every time a contributor gets a perk, all the extra funding received will go towards our donation policy; For every $99 dollars collected from contributions, we will donate a Sunu Band to a child (in our organization partners list) living in a developing country. Thanks to our partnership with Sinec Technologies (Manufacturing partner), we are capable of delivering your Perk Rewards regardless if we reach our goal.  

School for blind children in Guadalajara, Mexico

Sunu in the Press

You can find our story published on various outlets in the US and Latin America. Recent interviews include CNN Latino, Ocho TV and the MIT Technology Review. Sunu Band has been featured on the Perkins and the National Federation of the Blind technology blogs.


Why use Sunu Band

With Sunu band you will own your environments. You can detect and locate obstacles up to 13 feet away, find thresholds or openings to walk through, follow or avoid people around you with precision and feel what's around you without physical contact. With Sunu you navigate in a simple, smooth and secure way.

Sunu band is optimized with two different operation modes, for indoor and outdoor scenarios. The Indoor mode has a shorter range (8 feet) and is enhanced to detect openings and thresholds, like aisles in a supermarket, exits in a building, spaces between people and so on. The outdoor mode has a longer range (13 feet) and covers a wider area allowing you to detect obstacles above the knees up to head level, like trash cans, phone box, hanging tree branches, etc.

Thanks to its ergonomic design, the Sunu Band can be pointed with minimal movements from your hand, enabling you to feel your surroundings in a very discreet and quick manner. Sunu Band doesn’t interfere with the other senses because it provides vibration feedback, and it's non-obtrusive as you still maintain free use of your hand.


Sunu Band is truly augmentative as it can be used alongside other mobility aids, like the white cane or with a guide dog. Its sonar transducer emits at a frequency that is safe around dogs and other pets. Besides, getting started is very easy, thanks to our skills-based guides, developed in partnership with Orientation and Mobility specialists.



More features

  • Gesture Control - Allows you to quickly manipulate all the band functions with one hand using simple hand gestures.

  • Vibration Clock - Keep track of time with Sunu's haptic clock. Vibrations discreetly tell you the time with a simple abacus like system.

  • Sunu Tag - Find your personal articles with this tiny tracker. Vibrations on the band or your smartphone indicate the Tag’s proximity while an alarm on the Tag helps you to find it quickly.

  • Smartphone connectivity - customize the settings on the band, set up alarms and sync the time with the connected Sunu App.


What do Testers say?

Sunu We have try the device with over a 100 users, modify its design and features over 10 different times and after all this hard work we are very proud of the product we have come up to. Check out some of the testimonies from our testers.


How does Sunu Band work?

Sunu Band uses an ultrasound transducer as a proximity sensor. The ultrasonic wave emitted from the transducer bounces back from objects that are within the sensor's path and direction. The resulting 'echo' is detected by the same sensor, and then is processed and converted into vibrations pulses. This pulses become more frequent as the obstacle gets closer.

Sunu band also has an embedded 3 axis accelerometer that is sensing inclination to modulate the emitting ultrasonic wave. This allows the device to automatically adjust the range while pointing upwards, so it doesn’t detect obstacles way above head level (like ceiling lamps, fans or the ceiling itself) and only detect obstacles that can be a thread to the user.


How does the Sunu Tag work?

Sunu Tag is a low-power 'beacon' that can be clipped to any personal belonging such as keys, backpacks, luggage, to keep track of it and locate it in case it gets lost. Sunu Tags can be activated via Bluetooth from the Sunu Band or your smartphone within a 30 feet range of the tagged article. When activated, the phone or the band increasing pulses indicate the Tag’s proximity and the Sunu Tag 'chirps'  allowing the user to readily find the item.

Mobile Enabled - Sunu Tags can be 'paired up' with either a Sunu Band or your smartphone. The Sunu App works for Android and iOS (Soon for Android) and doesn’t need the Sunu Band to work.


Technical Specs

The Sunu Band technical specifications are:

  • Weight: 40 grams.
  • Inputs: two (2) buttons or gestures.
  • Modes: two (2) - indoor and outdoor.
  • Range & Resolution (Outdoor): approx. 4.5 meters (14.5 ft.) / 2cm.
  • Range & Sensitivity (Indoor): approx. 2.0 meters (6.5 ft.) / 2 cm.
  • Sampling Rate: 30fps.
  • Sensor Output Power / Sensitivity: 117 dB / -65 db
  • Battery: 240mAh, rechargeable (1-2 h.), compatible with wireless QI charger.
  • Battery Life: 14 hours of regular use

The Sunu Tag technical specifications are:

  • Weight: 10 grams.
  • Range: approx. ~10 meters (30 ft).
  • Output Power: approx. 93 dB @ 10 cm.
  • Battery Life: 44 days (sleep mode), 7 hours (continuous use), avg. 35 days.
  • Battery: 65mAh, rechargeable (1-2 h), compatible with wireless QI charger. 


Who is Sunu Band for?

Sunu Band is for anyone living with impaired vision or partially sighted who wants to improve their mobility. The smart-bracelet is augmentative, and can work alongside other aids (like the white cane or the guide dog). Sunu Band is recommended for children above the age of six (6), teens and adults. Sunu Band can help people who are: totally blind, have low vision or are partially sighted and experiencing vision loss, due to Macular Degeneration (AMD), Glaucoma, Cataracts, Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP) or by anyone who wnts to improve their awareness.


List of Partner Organizations

Escuela para Niños Ciegos

Instituto Helen Keller de Guadalajara

Massachusetts Association of Parents of the Visually Impaired - MAPVI



Your contribution will help bring Sunu Band and Sunu Tag to the public. With your support we will be able to use the funds raised to achieve the following milestones:

Certifications & Insurance: We will carrying out the necessary laboratory testing to certify Sunu Band and Sunu Tag with the FCC, CE and file the necessary documentation with the FDA. The FDA classifies devices like Sunu Band as a Class I medical device. Though not highly regulated like other device, the FDA requires a simple filing which will be done through legal counsel. The use of funds will be 21%.
Manufacturing & Assembly: We're partnered with Sinec Technologies, a contract manufacturer based in Guadalajara Mexico, where we have a lab and office onsite since the beginning of the project. A portion of the funds raised will allows us to cover the raw materials, tooling and production costs for 500 units. The use of funds will be 43%.
Packaging & Shipping: Will cover the necessary costs of shipping from the manufacturer to our distribution center in Boston. The use of funds will be 11%.
User Guide Materials: Will allow us to include the necessary inserts and materials as part of our user guide. The use of funds will be 12%.
Finally, the campaign service fees will correspond to 13%.



'Move Freely' - is more than just a tagline. It represents our mission to empower independence - to deliver Sunu Band to people living with impaired sight, whether they can afford it, need a little extra help or are living with limited resources. We're partnering with rural schools for blind children and other institutions serving the visually impaired in the developing world . This is where our story began, and for $99, you can gift a Sunu to a  to an organization in our list like the School for Blind Children in Guadalajara, Mexico.


There are various ways in which you can join our mission for as little as $5 to $10. We're excited to offer unique perks at various contribution levels, and we are proudly partnering with Art Lifting - a Boston based startup that empowers disabled and homeless artists through the celebration and sale of their artwork. 

We aim to celebrate inspiring lives and accomplishments from people living with impaired vision. We are very proud to partner with olympic athlete Marla Runyan - world-class American track and field athlete and marathon runner, who is legally blind. From an early age, Marla had Stargardts disease, a macular degeneration that leads to progressive vision loss. Her vision never prevented Marla from pursuing her dreams. Marla won 5 gold medals in the 1992 and 1996 Paralympic games and joined the US Olympic Team in 2000. Now's your chance to connect with US Olympian Marla Runyan. We will be offering special prizes throughout our campaign.

Together, we're helping people move freely. Here is how you can show your support:

Our mission is to empower mobility and independence for the visually impaired. We envision creating wearable technology that employs the best in design, and enables and augments the senses in a way that is discreet and intuitive.

Sunu started out as a community service project at a Helen Keller School for blind children in Guadalajara, Mexico. Children at the school rarely played in the schoolyard and only went out one a week for their mobility lessons. Both inventors, Marco Trujillo and Cuauhtli Padilla brought the first Sunu prototype as a way promote play with the children and something almost magical happened. The first group of kids using the sonar-bracelet began solving makeshift mazes and playing a variety of games. The parents, kids and teachers inspired Marco and Cuauhtli to take this early prototype to the next level. 


Special thanks to 

All along our company journey we have received help from beleivers that have been key to get this far and to offer this amazing product we feel very proud about. This special gratitude goes to our early Beta testers, Institutions and folks that helped with their talent:

Jorge Leal – Housing product design

Liliane Tovar, Alejandra Sevilla & Debora Moloeznik – Graphic design and communication strategy

Wonderbaby – Sunu ambassador

NFB – Beta testing and ambassador

Perkins – Beta testing and ambassador


Award-winning Technology 

Sunu has won various awards for it's technology:

  • Gold Award - 2014 MassChallenge, Boston, MA.
  • 2014 Perkins Assistive Technology Award, Boston MA.
  • 2014 Retos Zapopan, Guadalajara Mexico.
  • 2015 LATAM Concordia-Xcala Award.

Though every project has its challenges, our team combines experience and expertise to minimize risk. We've been partnered with our OEM manufacturer, Sinec Technologies since early 2013, where they have provide us with a lab and office on site. We have been developing for manufacturability since early on in the project, and have optimized and validated our manufacturing and QA process.

These are some of the milestones we've achieved and the timeline we propose to deliver a quality product to you. We estimate to begin delivery of our first 100 units in mid May 2016. Delivery will continue throughout the month of June-August 2016.

Frequently Asked questions:

1. When will I receive my Sunu Band?

We expect to begin delivery of the first batch of Sunu Bands by May 15th 2016. 

2. What is your warranty and return policy? 

Sunu offers a one (1)-year manufacturer's warranty on its products. Sunu also offers a 15-day satisfaction guarantee. If Sunu band does not work for you or you are not satisfied, simply return the product with 15-days to receive a full refund. Our warranty and satisfaction guarantee will be available on our website soon.

3. Will tutorials or a user guide be available?

Yes, a complete video and spoken tutorial will be available online. The tutorials will consist of short videos covering the important orientation and mobility skills needed to effectively use the Sunu Band smart-bracelet. Our guides will also cover the basic device operation and care. Sunu will also offer online customer support and our team will be available to assist you on the web, through video conference or on the phone. 

4. Do you currently have manufacturing in place?

Yes, our team has been working with Sinec Technologies, a OEM manufacturer based in Guadalajara Mexico since February of 2013. Our team has maintained our development and testing lab and an office space at this location since. This unique arrangement allows Sunu to develop and validate its products for manufacturability. Sinec Technologies is an ISO compliant manufacturer and is an experienced producer of various technology products sold in the USA and worldwide.

5. How long will your Indiegogo campaign run?

Our Indiegogo campaign will run for 30 days. 

6. Where is Sunu based and how can I reach you?

Sunu, Inc is a Delaware C Corp. with base of operations located in Boston Massachusetts. You can reach Sunu at:

Sunu, Inc.

21 Drydock Ave. 6th 

Boston, MA 02210

via email: hello@sunu.io



Español

En Sunu creemos que la fuerza de voluntad es capaz de superar cualquier limitación, es por esto que buscamos impulsarla utilizando lo mejor de la tecnología y el diseño. Nuestro primer producto, Sunu Band, es una pulsera inteligente inclusiva que junto con un localizador de objetos buscan empoderar la movilidad e independencia de las personas con discapacidad visual.

Sunu Band es la primer pulsera inteligente que utiliza tecnología ultrasónica para sensar los alrededores del usuario y entregar retroalimentación háptica en su muñeca para indicar la proximidad. También, puede indicar la hora con su discreto reloj vibratorio y puede ayudar a encontrar objetos perdidos con el Sunu Tag; un pequeño accesorio localizador que puede ser adherido a cualquier objeto personal (El Sunu Tag también puede ser activado desde cualquier celular en el caso de que no se tenga la Sunu Band).

La misión de nuestra campaña es generar un impacto en la vida de personas que viven con discapacidad visual. Cada vez que un una persona hace una contribución, todos los fondos adicionales recibidos se destinarán a nuestra política de donación; Por cada $99 dólares recolectados de las contribuciones, nosotros donaremos una Sunu Band a un niño (de nuestra lista de instituciones asociadas) viviendo en un país en vías de desarrollo. Gracias a nuestra asociación con Sinec Technologies (socio de manufactura), somos capaces de entregar todas las recompensas de las contribuciones sin importar si llegamos a la meta o no.

Escuela para Niños Ceigos de Guadalajara, México


Sunu en la Prensa

Puedes encontrar nuestra historia publicada en diferentes medios de Estados Unidos y Latino América; entrevistas recientes en CNN Latino, Ocho TV y el MIT Technology Review. Sunu Band ha sido destacado y publicado en los blogs de tecnología de Perkins y el National Federation of the Blind.

 ¿Por qué usar Sunu band?

Con Sunu Band serás dueño de tu entorno. Puedes detectar y localizar obstáculos con hasta casi 5 metros de distancia, encontrar aberturas o caminos despejados, seguir o evitar con precisión a la gente que te rodea, y sentir lo que hay a tus alrededores sin tener un contacto físico. Con Sunu puedes navegar de una manera simple, fluida y segura.

Sunu Band está optimizado con dos modos de operación, para escenarios interiores y exteriores. El modo de interiores tiene un rango corto de detección (2.5 mts) y está mejorado para detectar aberturas y huecos, como pasillos en supermercados, salidas en un edificio, espacio entre las personas, entre otras cosas. El modo de exteriores tiene un mayor rango de detección (4.5 metros) y cubre un área más amplia, permitiéndote detectar obstáculos desde el nivel de las rodillas hasta el nivel de la cabeza, como botes de basura, casetas de teléfono, ramas de árboles, etcétera.


Gracias a su diseño ergonómico, Sunu Band puede ser direccionado con mínimos movimientos de tu muñeca, permitiendote sentir tu entorno de una forma muy discreta y rápida. Sunu Band no interfiere con tus otros sentidos ya que provee una retroalimentación en forma de vibración, y no es invasivo ya que sigues manteniendo libre uso de tu mano.


Sunu Band simplemente incrementa, ya que puede ser utilizado con otros dispositivos para la movilidad, como el bastón o un perro guía. Su sensor sonar emite sonido a una frecuencia que es segura para los perros u otras mascotas. Además, comenzar a utilizarlo es muy sencillo gracias a nuestros manuales de uso desarrollados con el apoyo de especialistas en Orientación y Movilidad.



Más Características

  • Interfaz de una sola mano - te permite manipular rápidamente todas las funciones de la pulsera con movimientos simples y discretos de tu mano.

  • Reloj discreto - conoce la hora con el reloj vibratorio de Sunu por medio de sistema de pulsos parecidos al sistema del ábaco.

  • Sunu Tag - Encuentra tus objetos personales con este pequeño localizador. Vibraciones en la pulsera o en tu smartphone te indican la proximidad del Tag, mientras que una alarma del Tag te ayuda a encontrarlo fácilmente.

  • Conectividad con tu Celular - personaliza la configuración de la pulsera, programa alarmas y sincroniza la hora con la conexión a la Sunu App.


¿Cómo funciona Sunu band?

Sunu Band usa un transductor de ultrasonido como sensor de proximidad. La onda de ultrasonido emitida desde el transductor rebota de regreso en los objetos que se encuentran en el camino y dirección del sensor. El “eco” generado es detectado por el mismo sensor, y luego procesado y convertido en vibraciones. Estas vibraciones aumentan su frecuencia mientras más cerca esté el obstáculo.

Sunu band también tiene integrado un acelerómetro de 3 ejes que permite sensar la inclinación de la pulsera y así modular, de forma automática, la onda de ultrasonido. Esto permite que se reduzca el rango automáticamente cuando se apunta hacia arriba para solo detectar obstáculos que puedan ser una amenaza a la cabeza y no obstáculos que estén muy arriba para ser una amenaza (Como lámparas, el techo, etc).


¿Cómo funciona Sunu Tag?

El Sunu Tag es un “localizador” de larga duración que puede ser enganchado a cualquier objeto personal como las llaves, mochilas o  maletas, para localizarlas en caso de que se pierdan. Los Sunu Tags pueden ser activados vía Bluetooth desde la Sunu Band o desde tu celular en un rango de 10 metros. Cuando es activado, el teléfono o la pulsera aumentarán sus vibraciones indicando la proximidad al Tag y el Tag a su vez emitirá una alarma, para encontrarlo fácilmente.

Compatible con Celulares - Los Sunu Tags pueden ser “sincronizados” con la Sunu Band o con tu Celular. La Sunu App funciona para iOS (próximamente en Android) y no necesita de la Sunu Band para funcionar.


Especificaciones Técnicas 

Las especificaciones técnicas de la Sunu Band son:

  • Peso: 40 gramos

  • Interface: dos (2) - botones y gestos

  • Modos: dos (2) - interiores y exteriores

  • Rango y Resolución (Exteriores): Aprox. 4.5 metros (14.5 pies)/  2 cm

  • Rango y Sensibilidad (Exteriores): Aprox. 2.0 metros (6.5 pies)/  2 cm

  • Frecuencia de muestreo: 30 fps

  • Potencia de salida del sensor / sensibilidad: 117 dB / -65 db

  • Batería: 240 mAH, recargable (1-2 h), compatible con cargadores inalámbricos QI

  • Vida de la batería: 14 horas de uso promedio


Las especificaciones técnicas del Sunu Tag son:

  • Peso: 10 gramos

  • Rango: aprox. ~10 metros (30 pies)

  • Potencia de salida: aprox. 93 dB @ 10cm

  • Vida de la batería: 44 días (modo hibernación), 7 horas (uso continuo), promedio 35 días

  • Batería: 65 mAH, recargable (1-2 hr), compatible con cargador inalámbrico QI


¿Para quién es Sunu band?


Sunu Band es para cualquier persona que viva con discapacidad visual que quiera mejorar su movilidad. La pulsera puede trabajar junto con otros dispositivos de movilidad (como el bastón o perro guía). Sunu Band es recomendada para niños arriba de seis (6) años, adolescentes y adultos. Sunu Band puede ayudar a las personas que son: totalmente ciegas, tienen baja visión o tienen visión parcial y experimentan pérdida de visión por Degeneración Macular (AMD), Glaucoma, Cataratas, Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), o para cualquier persona que quiera amplificar su percepción del entorno.


Lista de Organizaciones Afiliadas

Escuela para Niños Ciegos

Instituto Helen Keller de Guadalajara

Massachusetts Association of Parents of the Visually Impaired - MAPVI


Con tu apoyo

Tu contribución ayudará a que Sunu Band salga al mercado. Con tu apoyo seremos capaces de utilizar los fondos obtenidos para lograr las siguientes metas:

Certificaciones y Seguros: Seremos capaces de hacer todos los estudios y pruebas necesarias para certificar a Sunu Band y el Sunu Tag con los requerimientos de la FCC, CE y FDA. La FDA clasifica el dispositivo como dispositivo médico clase I, y aunque no es altamente regulado como otros productos, la FDA requiere que llenemos un formato que será soportado por el consejo legal de un experto. El uso de fondos será de 21%

Ensamblaje y manufactura: Estamos aliados con Sinec Technologies, una empresa de manufactura ubicada en Guadalajara, México, donde además tenemos nuestro laboratorio y oficinas desde el inicio del proyecto. Una porción de los fondos obtenidos nos permitirá cubrir la materia prima, maquinado y costos de producción de 500 unidades. El uso de fondos será del 43%

Empaque y envíos: Cubrirá los costos necesarios de envío desde las instalaciones de manufactura hasta nuestro centro de distribución en Boston y de ahí a los diferentes destinos de los patrocinadores. El uso de fondos será de 11%

Materiales del manual de usuario: Nos permitirá incluir los materiales y acciones necesarias como parte de nuestro manual de usuario. El uso de fondos será del 12%

Finalmente, la cuota de los servicios por la campaña corresponderán al 13%.


Recompensas

“Muévete libremente” - es más que un eslogan, representa nuestra misión de empoderar la independencia - de entregar Sunu Band a personas que viven con discapacidad visual, independientemente si pueden comprarla, si necesitan un poco de ayuda o si están viviendo con recursos limitados. Estamos aliándonos con escuelas rurales para niños ciegos y otras instituciones que sirven a los discapacitados visuales en países en desarrollo. Aquí es donde nuestra historia comienza, y por solo $99 dólares puedes regalar una Sunu Band a organizaciones en nuestra lista como La Escuela Para Niños Ciegos en Guadalajara, méxico.

Hay varias maneras en que puedes unirte a nuestra misión por tan poco como $5 o $10. Estamos entusiasmados de ofrecer regalos únicos por cada nivel de contribución, y orgullosamente estamos aliados con Art Lifting - una startup ubicada en Boston que empodera a artistas discapacitados y sin hogar a través de la celebración y venta de su arte.


Buscamos celebrar con vidas inspiradoras y con los logros de personas que viven con discapacidad visual. Estamos muy orgullosos de aliarnos con la atleta olímpica Marla Runyan (quien es legalmente ciega) - americana reconocida mundialmente por ser una corredora de pista y maratones. Desde temprana edad, Marla tuvo la enfermedad de Stargardt, una degeneración macular que lleva a la pérdida de visión progresivamente. Pero su pérdida de visión nunca detuvo a Marla para perseguir sus sueños. Marla ganó 5 medallas de oro en los juegos paralímpicos de 1992 y 1996, y se unió al equipo olímpico de Estados Unidos en el 2000. Ahora es tu oportunidad de conectarte con la atleta olímpica Marla Runyan. Estaremos ofreciendo recompensas especiales a lo largo de nuestra campaña.

Juntos, estamos ayudando a los discapacitados visuales a moverse libremente. Aquí está la forma en que puedes mostrar tu apoyo:


Acerca de Sunu

Nuestra misión es empoderar la movilidad e independencia de las personas con discapacidad visual. Nuestra visión es el crear tecnología wearable que utilice el mejor diseño, que permita y aumente los sentidos en una forma discreta e intuitiva.


Sunu comenzó como un proyecto de servicio social en la escuela Helen Keller de Guadalajara, México. Los niños de la escuela raramente jugaban en el patio de recreo y solo salían una vez a la semana para tener sus clases de movilidad. Ambos inventores, Marco Trujillo y Cuauhtli Padilla crearon el primer prototipo de Sunu con el objetivo de promover el juego de los niños, y algo casi mágico sucedió.  El primer grupo de niños usando la pulsera comenzó a jugar y resolver rápidamente laberintos con obstáculos creados por el equipo. Los padres de familia, niños y maestros inspiraron a Marco y Cuauhtli a llevar este prototipo al siguiente nivel.


El equipo Sunu



Premios y Reconocimientos

Sunu ha sido reconocido por distintos premios de importancia internacional como:

  • Premio de Oro - 2014 MassChallenge, Boston, MA.
  • 2014 Perkins Assistive Technology Award, Boston MA.
  • 2014 Reto Zapopan, Guadalajara Mexico.
  • 2015 LATAM Concordia-Xcala Award


Retos y Desafíos

A pesar de que cada proyecto tiene sus desafíos, nuestro equipo combina experiencia y expertise para minimizar el riesgo. Hemos estado asociados con la empresa de manufactura, Sinec Technologies desde inicios del 2013, donde nos han proveído de un laboratorio y oficinas. Hemos estado desarrollando la manufacturabilidad desde inicios del proyecto, y hemos optimizado y validado nuestra manufactura y procesos de calidad. Estos son algunos puntos clave que hemos logrado y la línea del tiempo que proponemos para entregarte un producto de calidad. Estimamos comenzar la entrega de las primeras 100 unidades a mediados de Mayo del 2016. La entrega continuará durante los meses de Junio-Agosto 2016.


Preguntas Frecuentes

1.¿Cuándo recibiré mi Sunu Band?

Esperamos comenzar con la entrega del primer lote de Sunu Bands el 15 de Mayo del 2016.


2. ¿Cuál es la garantía y política de devolución?

Sunu ofrece un (1) año de garantía sobre defecto de fabricación. Sunu también ofrece 15 días de garantía de satisfacción. Si Sunu no es para ti o no estas satisfecho, simplemente devuelve el producto dentro de un lapso de 15 días a partir de tu compra para recibir un reembolso total. Nuestra garantía y garantía de satisfacción estarán disponibles en nuestro sitio web próximamente.


3. ¿Habrá tutoriales o manuales de usuario?

Sí, un video completo y un tutorial con narración estarán disponibles en línea. Los tutoriales consistirán de videos cortos que cubrirán las habilidades necesarias en orientación y movilidad para usar efectivamente la Sunu Band. Nuestras guías cubrirán también la operación y cuidado básico del dispositivo. Sunu ofrecerá servicio al cliente en línea y nuestro equipo estará disponible para apoyarte en internet, a través de videoconferencias o por teléfono.


4. ¿Tenemos actualmente la manufactura preparada?

Sí, nuestro equipo ha estado trabajando con Sinec Technologies, una empresa de manufactura ubicada en Guadalajara, México desde febrero del 2013. Nuestro equipo ha mantenido el desarrollo, laboratorio de pruebas y oficinas en este lugar desde entonces. Este arreglo único nos permite desarrollar y validar nuestros productos para manufacturabilidad. Sinec Technologies posee la certificación ISO y  tiene experiencia produciendo una variedad de productos tecnológicos vendidos tanto en Estados Unidos como a nivel mundial.


5. ¿Cuánto durará la campaña en Indiegogo?

Nuestra campaña durará 45 días naturales.


6. ¿Donde esta ubicado Sunu o como puedo localizarlos?

Sunu, Inc es una corporación de Delaware, con oficina de operaciones en Boston Massachussets. Puedes localizarnos en:

Sunu Inc.

21 Drydock Ave. 6th

Boston, MA 02210

por email: hello@sunu.io
story_txt:
Has clic aquí para Español


At Sunu we believe that human willpower is capable of overcoming any limitation, so we boost it using the best of technology and design. Our first product, the Sunu Band, is an inclusive smart-bracelet along with an object tracker that empowers mobility and independence for the visually impaired.









Sunu band is the first smart band using ultrasonic technology to sense the user’s surroundings and deliver haptic feedback on his wrist to indicate proximity. Sunu band can also give you the time with its discrete vibrational watch feature and can help you find your missing objects with the Sunu Tag; a tiny beacon like device that can be clipped to any personal object (Sunu Tag can also be tracked from your smartphone in case you don’t have the band).


Our campaign’s mission is to generate impact in the lives of people living with impaired vision. Every time a contributor gets a perk, all the extra funding received will go towards our donation policy; For every $99 dollars collected from contributions, we will donate a Sunu Band to a child (in our organization partners list) living in a developing country. Thanks to our partnership with Sinec Technologies (Manufacturing partner), we are capable of delivering your Perk Rewards regardless if we reach our goal.  




School for blind children in Guadalajara, Mexico




Sunu in the Press


You can find our story published on various outlets in the US and Latin America. Recent interviews include CNN Latino, Ocho TV and the MIT Technology Review. Sunu Band has been featured on the Perkins and the National Federation of the Blind technology blogs.




Why use Sunu Band
With Sunu band you will own your environments. You can detect and locate obstacles up to 13 feet away, find thresholds or openings to walk through, follow or avoid people around you with precision and feel what's around you without physical contact. With Sunu you navigate in a simple, smooth and secure way. 

Sunu band is optimized with two different operation modes, for indoor and outdoor scenarios. The Indoor mode has a shorter range (8 feet) and is enhanced to detect openings and thresholds, like aisles in a supermarket, exits in a building, spaces between people and so on. The outdoor mode has a longer range (13 feet) and covers a wider area allowing you to detect obstacles above the knees up to head level, like trash cans, phone box, hanging tree branches, etc. 
Thanks to its ergonomic design, the Sunu Band can be pointed with minimal movements from your hand, enabling you to feel your surroundings in a very discreet and quick manner. Sunu Band doesn’t interfere with the other senses because it provides vibration feedback, and it's non-obtrusive as you still maintain free use of your hand.

Sunu Band is truly augmentative as it can be used alongside other mobility aids, like the white cane or with a guide dog. Its sonar transducer emits at a frequency that is safe around dogs and other pets. Besides, getting started is very easy, thanks to our skills-based guides, developed in partnership with Orientation and Mobility specialists. 






More features 

Gesture Control - Allows you to quickly manipulate all the band functions with one hand using simple hand gestures. 
Vibration Clock - Keep track of time with Sunu's haptic clock. Vibrations discreetly tell you the time with a simple abacus like system.
Sunu Tag - Find your personal articles with this tiny tracker. Vibrations on the band or your smartphone indicate the Tag’s proximity while an alarm on the Tag helps you to find it quickly.
Smartphone connectivity - customize the settings on the band, set up alarms and sync the time with the connected Sunu App.






What do Testers say?
Sunu We have try the device with over a 100 users, modify its design and features over 10 different times and after all this hard work we are very proud of the product we have come up to. Check out some of the testimonies from our testers.




How does Sunu Band work?


Sunu Band uses an ultrasound transducer as a proximity sensor. The ultrasonic wave emitted from the transducer bounces back from objects that are within the sensor's path and direction. The resulting 'echo' is detected by the same sensor, and then is processed and converted into vibrations pulses. This pulses become more frequent as the obstacle gets closer.

Sunu band also has an embedded 3 axis accelerometer that is sensing inclination to modulate the emitting ultrasonic wave. This allows the device to automatically adjust the range while pointing upwards, so it doesn’t detect obstacles way above head level (like ceiling lamps, fans or the ceiling itself) and only detect obstacles that can be a thread to the user.

How does the Sunu Tag work? 
Sunu Tag is a low-power 'beacon' that can be clipped to any personal belonging such as keys, backpacks, luggage, to keep track of it and locate it in case it gets lost. Sunu Tags can be activated via Bluetooth from the Sunu Band or your smartphone within a 30 feet range of the tagged article. When activated, the phone or the band increasing pulses indicate the Tag’s proximity and the Sunu Tag 'chirps'  allowing the user to readily find the item.
Mobile Enabled - Sunu Tags can be 'paired up' with either a Sunu Band or your smartphone. The Sunu App works for Android and iOS (Soon for Android) and doesn’t need the Sunu Band to work.



Technical Specs 

The Sunu Band technical specifications are:



Weight: 40 grams.


Inputs: two (2) buttons or gestures.


Modes: two (2) - indoor and outdoor.


Range & Resolution (Outdoor): approx. 4.5 meters (14.5 ft.) / 2cm.


Range & Sensitivity (Indoor): approx. 2.0 meters (6.5 ft.) / 2 cm.


Sampling Rate: 30fps.


Sensor Output Power / Sensitivity: 117 dB / -65 db


Battery: 240mAh, rechargeable (1-2 h.), compatible with wireless QI charger.


Battery Life: 14 hours of regular use




The Sunu Tag technical specifications are:



Weight: 10 grams.


Range: approx. ~10 meters (30 ft).


Output Power: approx. 93 dB @ 10 cm.


Battery Life: 44 days (sleep mode), 7 hours (continuous use), avg. 35 days.


Battery: 65mAh, rechargeable (1-2 h), compatible with wireless QI charger. 







Who is Sunu Band for?

Sunu Band is for anyone living with impaired vision or partially sighted who wants to improve their mobility. The smart-bracelet is augmentative, and can work alongside other aids (like the white cane or the guide dog). Sunu Band is recommended for children above the age of six (6), teens and adults. Sunu Band can help people who are: totally blind, have low vision or are partially sighted and experiencing vision loss, due to Macular Degeneration (AMD), Glaucoma, Cataracts, Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP) or by anyone who wnts to improve their awareness.




List of Partner Organizations
Escuela para Niños Ciegos
Instituto Helen Keller de Guadalajara
Massachusetts Association of Parents of the Visually Impaired - MAPVI


Your contribution will help bring Sunu Band and Sunu Tag to the public. With your support we will be able to use the funds raised to achieve the following milestones:


Certifications & Insurance: We will carrying out the necessary laboratory testing to certify Sunu Band and Sunu Tag with the FCC, CE and file the necessary documentation with the FDA. The FDA classifies devices like Sunu Band as a Class I medical device. Though not highly regulated like other device, the FDA requires a simple filing which will be done through legal counsel. The use of funds will be 21%.

Manufacturing & Assembly: We're partnered with Sinec Technologies, a contract manufacturer based in Guadalajara Mexico, where we have a lab and office onsite since the beginning of the project. A portion of the funds raised will allows us to cover the raw materials, tooling and production costs for 500 units. The use of funds will be 43%.

Packaging & Shipping: Will cover the necessary costs of shipping from the manufacturer to our distribution center in Boston. The use of funds will be 11%.

User Guide Materials: Will allow us to include the necessary inserts and materials as part of our user guide. The use of funds will be 12%.
Finally, the campaign service fees will correspond to 13%.





'Move Freely' - is more than just a tagline. It represents our mission to empower independence - to deliver Sunu Band to people living with impaired sight, whether they can afford it, need a little extra help or are living with limited resources. We're partnering with rural schools for blind children and other institutions serving the visually impaired in the developing world . This is where our story began, and for $99, you can gift a Sunu to a  to an organization in our list like the School for Blind Children in Guadalajara, Mexico.




There are various ways in which you can join our mission for as little as $5 to $10. We're excited to offer unique perks at various contribution levels, and we are proudly partnering with Art Lifting - a Boston based startup that empowers disabled and homeless artists through the celebration and sale of their artwork. 
We aim to celebrate inspiring lives and accomplishments from people living with impaired vision. We are very proud to partner with olympic athlete Marla Runyan - world-class American track and field athlete and marathon runner, who is legally blind. From an early age, Marla had Stargardts disease, a macular degeneration that leads to progressive vision loss. Her vision never prevented Marla from pursuing her dreams. Marla won 5 gold medals in the 1992 and 1996 Paralympic games and joined the US Olympic Team in 2000. Now's your chance to connect with US Olympian Marla Runyan. We will be offering special prizes throughout our campaign.


Together, we're helping people move freely. Here is how you can show your support:


Our mission is to empower mobility and independence for the visually impaired. We envision creating wearable technology that employs the best in design, and enables and augments the senses in a way that is discreet and intuitive.



Sunu started out as a community service project at a Helen Keller School for blind children in Guadalajara, Mexico. Children at the school rarely played in the schoolyard and only went out one a week for their mobility lessons. Both inventors, Marco Trujillo and Cuauhtli Padilla brought the first Sunu prototype as a way promote play with the children and something almost magical happened. The first group of kids using the sonar-bracelet began solving makeshift mazes and playing a variety of games. The parents, kids and teachers inspired Marco and Cuauhtli to take this early prototype to the next level. 
  










Special thanks to 


All along our company
journey we have received help from beleivers that have been key to get this far
and to offer this amazing product we feel very proud about. This special gratitude
goes to our early Beta testers, Institutions and folks that helped with their
talent:
Jorge Leal – Housing product design
Liliane Tovar, Alejandra
Sevilla & Debora Moloeznik –
Graphic design and communication strategy
Wonderbaby – Sunu ambassador
NFB – Beta testing and ambassador
Perkins – Beta testing and ambassador



Award-winning Technology 
 Sunu has won various awards for it's technology:  Gold Award - 2014 MassChallenge, Boston, MA. 2014 Perkins Assistive Technology Award, Boston MA. 2014 Retos Zapopan, Guadalajara Mexico.
2015 LATAM Concordia-Xcala Award.


Though every project has its challenges, our team combines experience and expertise to minimize risk. We've been partnered with our OEM manufacturer, Sinec Technologies since early 2013, where they have provide us with a lab and office on site. We have been developing for manufacturability since early on in the project, and have optimized and validated our manufacturing and QA process.


These are some of the milestones we've achieved and the timeline we propose to deliver a quality product to you. We estimate to begin delivery of our first 100 units in mid May 2016. Delivery will continue throughout the month of June-August 2016.










Frequently Asked questions: 1. When will I receive my Sunu Band?
We expect to begin delivery of the first batch of Sunu Bands by May 15th 2016. 
2. What is your warranty and return policy? 
Sunu offers a one (1)-year manufacturer's warranty on its products. Sunu also offers a 15-day satisfaction guarantee. If Sunu band does not work for you or you are not satisfied, simply return the product with 15-days to receive a full refund. Our warranty and satisfaction guarantee will be available on our website soon.
3. Will tutorials or a user guide be available?
Yes, a complete video and spoken tutorial will be available online. The tutorials will consist of short videos covering the important orientation and mobility skills needed to effectively use the Sunu Band smart-bracelet. Our guides will also cover the basic device operation and care. Sunu will also offer online customer support and our team will be available to assist you on the web, through video conference or on the phone. 

4. Do you currently have manufacturing in place?
Yes, our team has been working with Sinec Technologies, a OEM manufacturer based in Guadalajara Mexico since February of 2013. Our team has maintained our development and testing lab and an office space at this location since. This unique arrangement allows Sunu to develop and validate its products for manufacturability. Sinec Technologies is an ISO compliant manufacturer and is an experienced producer of various technology products sold in the USA and worldwide.

5. How long will your Indiegogo campaign run?
Our Indiegogo campaign will run for 30 days. 
6. Where is Sunu based and how can I reach you?
Sunu, Inc is a Delaware C Corp. with base of operations located in Boston Massachusetts. You can reach Sunu at:
Sunu, Inc.
21 Drydock Ave. 6th 
Boston, MA 02210
via email: hello@sunu.io


Español



En Sunu creemos que la fuerza de voluntad es capaz de superar cualquier limitación, es por esto que buscamos impulsarla utilizando lo mejor de la tecnología y el diseño. Nuestro primer producto, Sunu Band, es una pulsera inteligente inclusiva que junto con un localizador de objetos buscan empoderar la movilidad e independencia de las personas con discapacidad visual.





Sunu Band es la primer pulsera inteligente que utiliza tecnología ultrasónica para sensar los alrededores del usuario y entregar retroalimentación háptica en su muñeca para indicar la proximidad. También, puede indicar la hora con su discreto reloj vibratorio y puede ayudar a encontrar objetos perdidos con el Sunu Tag; un pequeño accesorio localizador que puede ser adherido a cualquier objeto personal (El Sunu Tag también puede ser activado desde cualquier celular en el caso de que no se tenga la Sunu Band).


La misión de nuestra campaña es generar un impacto en la vida de personas que viven con discapacidad visual. Cada vez que un una persona hace una contribución, todos los fondos adicionales recibidos se destinarán a nuestra política de donación; Por cada $99 dólares recolectados de las contribuciones, nosotros donaremos una Sunu Band a un niño (de nuestra lista de instituciones asociadas) viviendo en un país en vías de desarrollo. Gracias a nuestra asociación con Sinec Technologies (socio de manufactura), somos capaces de entregar todas las recompensas de las contribuciones sin importar si llegamos a la meta o no.



Escuela para Niños Ceigos de Guadalajara, México







Sunu en la Prensa

Puedes encontrar nuestra historia publicada en diferentes medios de Estados Unidos y Latino América; entrevistas recientes en CNN Latino, Ocho TV y el MIT Technology Review. Sunu Band ha sido destacado y publicado en los blogs de tecnología de Perkins y el National Federation of the Blind.



 ¿Por qué usar Sunu band?

Con Sunu Band serás dueño de tu entorno. Puedes detectar y localizar obstáculos con hasta casi 5 metros de distancia, encontrar aberturas o caminos despejados, seguir o evitar con precisión a la gente que te rodea, y sentir lo que hay a tus alrededores sin tener un contacto físico. Con Sunu puedes navegar de una manera simple, fluida y segura.

Sunu Band está optimizado con dos modos de operación, para escenarios interiores y exteriores. El modo de interiores tiene un rango corto de detección (2.5 mts) y está mejorado para detectar aberturas y huecos, como pasillos en supermercados, salidas en un edificio, espacio entre las personas, entre otras cosas. El modo de exteriores tiene un mayor rango de detección (4.5 metros) y cubre un área más amplia, permitiéndote detectar obstáculos desde el nivel de las rodillas hasta el nivel de la cabeza, como botes de basura, casetas de teléfono, ramas de árboles, etcétera. 
Gracias a su diseño ergonómico, Sunu Band puede ser direccionado con mínimos movimientos de tu muñeca, permitiendote sentir tu entorno de una forma muy discreta y rápida. Sunu Band no interfiere con tus otros sentidos ya que provee una retroalimentación en forma de vibración, y no es invasivo ya que sigues manteniendo libre uso de tu mano. 

Sunu Band simplemente incrementa, ya que puede ser utilizado con otros dispositivos para la movilidad, como el bastón o un perro guía. Su sensor sonar emite sonido a una frecuencia que es segura para los perros u otras mascotas. Además, comenzar a utilizarlo es muy sencillo gracias a nuestros manuales de uso desarrollados con el apoyo de especialistas en Orientación y Movilidad. 





Más Características



Interfaz de una sola mano - te permite manipular rápidamente todas las funciones de la pulsera con movimientos simples y discretos de tu mano.
Reloj discreto - conoce la hora con el reloj vibratorio de Sunu por medio de sistema de pulsos parecidos al sistema del ábaco. 
Sunu Tag - Encuentra tus objetos personales con este pequeño localizador. Vibraciones en la pulsera o en tu smartphone te indican la proximidad del Tag, mientras que una alarma del Tag te ayuda a encontrarlo fácilmente.
Conectividad con tu Celular - personaliza la configuración de la pulsera, programa alarmas y sincroniza la hora con la conexión a la Sunu App.








¿Cómo funciona Sunu band?

Sunu Band usa un transductor de ultrasonido como sensor de proximidad. La onda de ultrasonido emitida desde el transductor rebota de regreso en los objetos que se encuentran en el camino y dirección del sensor. El “eco” generado es detectado por el mismo sensor, y luego procesado y convertido en vibraciones. Estas vibraciones aumentan su frecuencia mientras más cerca esté el obstáculo. 

Sunu band también tiene integrado un acelerómetro de 3 ejes que permite sensar la inclinación de la pulsera y así modular, de forma automática, la onda de ultrasonido. Esto permite que se reduzca el rango automáticamente cuando se apunta hacia arriba para solo detectar obstáculos que puedan ser una amenaza a la cabeza y no obstáculos que estén muy arriba para ser una amenaza (Como lámparas, el techo, etc).



¿Cómo funciona Sunu Tag?
El Sunu Tag es un “localizador” de larga duración que puede ser enganchado a cualquier objeto personal como las llaves, mochilas o  maletas, para localizarlas en caso de que se pierdan. Los Sunu Tags pueden ser activados vía Bluetooth desde la Sunu Band o desde tu celular en un rango de 10 metros. Cuando es activado, el teléfono o la pulsera aumentarán sus vibraciones indicando la proximidad al Tag y el Tag a su vez emitirá una alarma, para encontrarlo fácilmente. 
Compatible con Celulares - Los Sunu Tags pueden ser “sincronizados” con la Sunu Band o con tu Celular. La Sunu App funciona para iOS (próximamente en Android) y no necesita de la Sunu Band para funcionar.





Especificaciones Técnicas 

Las especificaciones técnicas de la Sunu Band son:

Peso: 40 gramos
Interface: dos (2) - botones y gestos
Modos: dos (2) - interiores y exteriores
Rango y Resolución (Exteriores): Aprox. 4.5 metros (14.5 pies)/  2 cm
Rango y Sensibilidad (Exteriores): Aprox. 2.0 metros (6.5 pies)/  2 cm
Frecuencia de muestreo: 30 fps
Potencia de salida del sensor / sensibilidad: 117 dB / -65 db
Batería: 240 mAH, recargable (1-2 h), compatible con cargadores inalámbricos QI
Vida de la batería: 14 horas de uso promedio




Las especificaciones técnicas del Sunu Tag son: 

Peso: 10 gramos
Rango: aprox. ~10 metros (30 pies)
Potencia de salida: aprox. 93 dB @ 10cm
Vida de la batería: 44 días (modo hibernación), 7 horas (uso continuo), promedio 35 días
Batería: 65 mAH, recargable (1-2 hr), compatible con cargador inalámbrico QI





¿Para quién es Sunu band? 

Sunu Band es para cualquier persona que viva con discapacidad visual que quiera mejorar su movilidad. La pulsera puede trabajar junto con otros dispositivos de movilidad (como el bastón o perro guía). Sunu Band es recomendada para niños arriba de seis (6) años, adolescentes y adultos. Sunu Band puede ayudar a las personas que son: totalmente ciegas, tienen baja visión o tienen visión parcial y experimentan pérdida de visión por Degeneración Macular (AMD), Glaucoma, Cataratas, Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), o para cualquier persona que quiera amplificar su percepción del entorno.



Lista de Organizaciones Afiliadas
Escuela para Niños Ciegos
Instituto Helen Keller de Guadalajara
Massachusetts Association of Parents of the Visually Impaired - MAPVI

Con tu apoyo 


Tu contribución ayudará a que Sunu Band salga al mercado. Con tu apoyo seremos capaces de utilizar los fondos obtenidos para lograr las siguientes metas:
Certificaciones y Seguros: Seremos capaces de hacer todos los estudios y pruebas necesarias para certificar a Sunu Band y el Sunu Tag con los requerimientos de la FCC, CE y FDA. La FDA clasifica el dispositivo como dispositivo médico clase I, y aunque no es altamente regulado como otros productos, la FDA requiere que llenemos un formato que será soportado por el consejo legal de un experto. El uso de fondos será de 21%
Ensamblaje y manufactura: Estamos aliados con Sinec Technologies, una empresa de manufactura ubicada en Guadalajara, México, donde además tenemos nuestro laboratorio y oficinas desde el inicio del proyecto. Una porción de los fondos obtenidos nos permitirá cubrir la materia prima, maquinado y costos de producción de 500 unidades. El uso de fondos será del 43%
Empaque y envíos: Cubrirá los costos necesarios de envío desde las instalaciones de manufactura hasta nuestro centro de distribución en Boston y de ahí a los diferentes destinos de los patrocinadores. El uso de fondos será de 11%
Materiales del manual de usuario: Nos permitirá incluir los materiales y acciones necesarias como parte de nuestro manual de usuario. El uso de fondos será del 12%Finalmente, la cuota de los servicios por la campaña corresponderán al 13%.






Recompensas


“Muévete libremente” - es más que un eslogan, representa nuestra misión de empoderar la independencia - de entregar Sunu Band a personas que viven con discapacidad visual, independientemente si pueden comprarla, si necesitan un poco de ayuda o si están viviendo con recursos limitados. Estamos aliándonos con escuelas rurales para niños ciegos y otras instituciones que sirven a los discapacitados visuales en países en desarrollo. Aquí es donde nuestra historia comienza, y por solo $99 dólares puedes regalar una Sunu Band a organizaciones en nuestra lista como La Escuela Para Niños Ciegos en Guadalajara, méxico. 




Hay varias maneras en que puedes unirte a nuestra misión por tan poco como $5 o $10. Estamos entusiasmados de ofrecer regalos únicos por cada nivel de contribución, y orgullosamente estamos aliados con Art Lifting - una startup ubicada en Boston que empodera a artistas discapacitados y sin hogar a través de la celebración y venta de su arte. 
Buscamos celebrar con vidas inspiradoras y con los logros de personas que viven con discapacidad visual. Estamos muy orgullosos de aliarnos con la atleta olímpica Marla Runyan (quien es legalmente ciega) - americana reconocida mundialmente por ser una corredora de pista y maratones. Desde temprana edad, Marla tuvo la enfermedad de Stargardt, una degeneración macular que lleva a la pérdida de visión progresivamente. Pero su pérdida de visión nunca detuvo a Marla para perseguir sus sueños. Marla ganó 5 medallas de oro en los juegos paralímpicos de 1992 y 1996, y se unió al equipo olímpico de Estados Unidos en el 2000. Ahora es tu oportunidad de conectarte con la atleta olímpica Marla Runyan. Estaremos ofreciendo recompensas especiales a lo largo de nuestra campaña.
Juntos, estamos ayudando a los discapacitados visuales a moverse libremente. Aquí está la forma en que puedes mostrar tu apoyo:






Acerca de Sunu
Nuestra misión es empoderar la movilidad e independencia de las personas con discapacidad visual. Nuestra visión es el crear tecnología wearable que utilice el mejor diseño, que permita y aumente los sentidos en una forma discreta e intuitiva.
Sunu comenzó como un proyecto de servicio social en la escuela Helen Keller de Guadalajara, México. Los niños de la escuela raramente jugaban en el patio de recreo y solo salían una vez a la semana para tener sus clases de movilidad. Ambos inventores, Marco Trujillo y Cuauhtli Padilla crearon el primer prototipo de Sunu con el objetivo de promover el juego de los niños, y algo casi mágico sucedió.  El primer grupo de niños usando la pulsera comenzó a jugar y resolver rápidamente laberintos con obstáculos creados por el equipo. Los padres de familia, niños y maestros inspiraron a Marco y Cuauhtli a llevar este prototipo al siguiente nivel.
El equipo Sunu





Premios y Reconocimientos 

Sunu ha sido reconocido por distintos premios de importancia internacional como: 
Premio de Oro - 2014 MassChallenge, Boston, MA.
2014 Perkins Assistive Technology Award, Boston MA.
2014 Reto Zapopan, Guadalajara Mexico.
2015 LATAM Concordia-Xcala Award






Retos y Desafíos A pesar de que cada proyecto tiene sus desafíos, nuestro equipo combina experiencia y expertise para minimizar el riesgo. Hemos estado asociados con la empresa de manufactura, Sinec Technologies desde inicios del 2013, donde nos han proveído de un laboratorio y oficinas. Hemos estado desarrollando la manufacturabilidad desde inicios del proyecto, y hemos optimizado y validado nuestra manufactura y procesos de calidad. Estos son algunos puntos clave que hemos logrado y la línea del tiempo que proponemos para entregarte un producto de calidad. Estimamos comenzar la entrega de las primeras 100 unidades a mediados de Mayo del 2016. La entrega continuará durante los meses de Junio-Agosto 2016.





Preguntas Frecuentes
 
1.¿Cuándo recibiré mi Sunu Band?
Esperamos comenzar con la entrega del primer lote de Sunu Bands el 15 de Mayo del 2016.
2. ¿Cuál es la garantía y política de devolución?
Sunu ofrece un (1) año de garantía sobre defecto de fabricación. Sunu también ofrece 15 días de garantía de satisfacción. Si Sunu no es para ti o no estas satisfecho, simplemente devuelve el producto dentro de un lapso de 15 días a partir de tu compra para recibir un reembolso total. Nuestra garantía y garantía de satisfacción estarán disponibles en nuestro sitio web próximamente.
3. ¿Habrá tutoriales o manuales de usuario?
Sí, un video completo y un tutorial con narración estarán disponibles en línea. Los tutoriales consistirán de videos cortos que cubrirán las habilidades necesarias en orientación y movilidad para usar efectivamente la Sunu Band. Nuestras guías cubrirán también la operación y cuidado básico del dispositivo. Sunu ofrecerá servicio al cliente en línea y nuestro equipo estará disponible para apoyarte en internet, a través de videoconferencias o por teléfono. 
4. ¿Tenemos actualmente la manufactura preparada?
Sí, nuestro equipo ha estado trabajando con Sinec Technologies, una empresa de manufactura ubicada en Guadalajara, México desde febrero del 2013. Nuestro equipo ha mantenido el desarrollo, laboratorio de pruebas y oficinas en este lugar desde entonces. Este arreglo único nos permite desarrollar y validar nuestros productos para manufacturabilidad. Sinec Technologies posee la certificación ISO y  tiene experiencia produciendo una variedad de productos tecnológicos vendidos tanto en Estados Unidos como a nivel mundial. 
5. ¿Cuánto durará la campaña en Indiegogo?
Nuestra campaña durará 45 días naturales.
6. ¿Donde esta ubicado Sunu o como puedo localizarlos?
Sunu, Inc es una corporación de Delaware, con oficina de operaciones en Boston Massachussets. Puedes localizarnos en:
Sunu Inc.
21 Drydock Ave. 6th 
Boston, MA 02210
por email: hello@sunu.io

story:
Summary...
Medical cannabis is coming to Pennsylvania, and Allegheny Botanicals wants to be the premier processor of cannabis in Pennsylvania. Our passion and approach to medical cannabis is different. We are not going to be in the business of making hash oil. We are going to be in the business of supplying beneficial medicine to people in need.

To that end we are pursuing two goals which will differentiate us from other processors we have met in our journeys.

First, we are going to be certified by an independent third party that we are in fact manufacturing a pharmaceutical grade product. This is an expensive and time consuming process, but one that we feel is necessary to ensure that patients are getting the highest quality product. Doctors can be assured that their patients are getting the correct dose of the correct medicine.

Secondly, we are going to tailor the medicine to each individual. Cannabis has many different active ingredients. The ratio of these active ingredients have different effects on different people , symptoms, and diseases. We have devised an environmentally friendly separation technology which will allow us to separate, then reconstitute the components of the cannabis extract in precise ratios. Working with doctors and patients, we will find the ratio of active components that best fits the needs of the patient.

What we need...
We have completed small scale lab testing and developed a process with the associated flow diagram. We need to develop a business plan, but we are unable to do so, until we model the separation process with some specialized (expensive) software. The process modeling will allow us to calculate equipment capacities, through puts, and yields. All of this is information we need.

We also need access to scientific literature. Everyone knows the axiom, "Garbage in, garbage out." The scientific literature will give us the information we need to build the process model. We need to buy a license to a chemical abstract service which will allow us to purchase scientific articles.

OK, what's in in it for you? Well, if you give $250 or more, then we have really cool T-shirts that we can customize with whatever you want, in addition to our name and logo. Your name, a Bob Marley quote. Be the first one on your block to have one. You can also feel good about yourself. Myself? I started this, because I thought it would be cool to make hash oil, then I met some of the kids that would benefit from cannabis. My motivation changed. Any funds not spent will be donated to the Pennsylvania Medical Cannabis Society (www.pamcs.org)
The Impact...
We have spoken about tailoring medication to a patient's specific needs which we feel will lead to better outcomes with fewer unwanted side effects. There is also an economic impact.

We are located in Pittsburgh on The Northside, a collection of neighborhoods some of which are economically challenged. We are committed to locating our production facility, when we get that far, on The Northside, and being an organization that makes a positive impact in the neighborhood. We are also committed to hiring people that have graduated from local job training programs. Medical cannabis is a new industry in Pennsylvania, and we want to make sure that it is an engine for economic development.
Risk...
The legislation that would authorize medical cannabis in the Commonwealth is still in the General Assembly. The Senate has passed a bill, and, in the House, the legislation has a majority of the members as co-sponsors. The governor has said he will sign a bill. There is a risk that the legislation won't pass, however small.

After the legislation passes, there will be a licensing process, and we will need a license. There is a risk we won't get a license to operate. However, we want to have everything in order, as soon as possible. This includes having all of the financing identified which will require a business plan. There's that business plan thing, again.

What else can you do...
If your state has medical marijuana, good for you. Other states don't, and even if medical marijuana is legal in your locale, people still have negative encounters with law enforcement. The Medical Marijuana Growers Association (Link) advocates and educates people on the benefits of medical cannabis. If you live in Pennsylvania, please contact your state legislator. More voices always help.

story:
What is the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto?

Lifestyle mentor and fitness coach, Dai Manuel’s Whole Life Fitness Manifesto is a new kind of fitness book. It’s not just about physical health but Whole-Life Fitness that blends mindfulness and personal development with equipment-free workouts. This sustainable lifestyle extends beyond the book, allowing WholeLifers to connect with like-minded people in a supportive online community.

The Whole Life Fitness Manifesto provides the tools you need to create a “FUN-ctionally fit” lifestyle at any age or level of ability, in 30 minutes a day.

The Whole Life Fitness Power 30 program consists of:

  • 15-minute equipment-free workouts that you can do anywhere
  • Worksheets and diary pages to help you track your progress
  • Photo-illustrated breakdown of more than 30 exercises
  • Mindfulness and meditation tips
  • Customizable workout plans
  • Expert nutritional advice
  • Personal development prompts
  • An opportunity to access a thriving online community – join the tribe!

Learn how to re-program your body, make better choices, release excess weight, and become stronger, healthier and happier for the rest of your life.

Join the thousands of men and women whose lives have been transformed by Dai’s Whole Life Fitness Power 30 program, and let their success stories inspire you. As Dai says, “You might be working out on your own, but you’re never alone!”

It’s time to invest 2% of your day in yourself and adopt the #JustDidIt mentality. 

And, just so you know, 2% of profits from the sale of this book will be donated to charities combating childhood obesity. 

Sneak peek of the 192 page, full color book ...

If you're ready to take charge of your health and support the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto, check out the list of perk opportunities included in this campaign. If you wish to dig deeper into the who, what, why and how, or have time to spare, there's loads of more information included below. If you care to share this will anyone, that would be extra awesome. Thanks in advance!


Why Crowdfunding? And how can you help?

Crowd funding will help determine the demand and assist with sharing Dai's message. 

All contributions will be put toward the printing of more books and help with the creation of the online community. Any surplus will be put toward PR and video documenting the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto movement to inspire more communities around the globe to take control of their health and have fun. 

There's a number of different perk offerings, many which include a copy of the Whole Life Manifesto book and memberships to the online community. Dai has even included a few lifestyle mentoring packages and a key note speaker offering. 

Check out the options and feel free to message Dai directly with any questions or specific requests. Whether you're able to purchase a book in advance or not, it would be extra cool if you shared this with those you care about!



Who is Dai Manuel aka Coach Moose?

Dai Manuel is a proud dad and husband who is perpetually dating his wife. He's also a lifestyle mentor, fitness coach, motivational speaker, former COO of Fitness Town Inc., professional blogger, competitive athlete, and all-around life enhancer. 
          

After personally battling obesity as a teenager, Dai became committed to engaging as many people as possible in living healthier, more active lives. Dai believes that lifelong happiness and well-being must be built on a rock-solid foundation of health, and that a sustainable healthy lifestyle is possible for everyone. Through his award-winning blog The Moose is Loose, and his coaching programs, Dai has helped thousands of people to reach their health and fitness goals. Dai, his wife, Christie, and their daughters, Chardonae and Brielyn, are active and enthusiastic participants in their community in Vancouver, Canada. 

BONUS (at the bottom of this page): Dai invites you to read WHY he's so inspired to lead a life of total awesomeness - and why he wants you to do the same.


What people are saying about Dai Manuel and the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto?

"In addition to being one of the nicest people on planet earth, Dai Manuel has been a thought leader in the health and fitness space for many years.  We are so excited that he is bringing his wealth of knowledge about how to be more awesome at life with his new book."  ~ Juliet & Kelly Starrett, Co-founders of San Francisco Crossfit and Mobility WOD

"Dai’s manifesto is awesome! This book is fun, exciting and most importantly an effective tool that can help make meaningful behaviour changes in our hectic lives. Read it" ~ Peter van Stolk CEO SPUD.ca 

“Whole life fitness is vital, but in our busy world it can be a bit complicated.  Dai simplifies this complex quest in a way that make it achievable and fun for all.” ~ Richard Monette, CEO Active for Life

"Dai Manuel's Whole Life Fitness Manifesto is pure brilliance, and everything that the fitness, health and wellness space NEEDS in a book, in a leader, in a movement. Dai Manuel isn't just lecturing in his book- he is LEADING and LIVING a transformed LIFESTYLE. He walks the walk and makes everyone fully understand that they can do it to: transform their life. There's a big difference between authors that write books about a "program"- they inspire people to WANT to change, but Dai has the ability to enable everyone to FEEL and EMBRACE their potential to make that change a reality. Dai Manuel is to me the definition of FitFluential in every aspect of the word. He is as genuine as they come and has created a treasure of a book here that is inviting to read, and will change lives everywhere. You simply MUST get this book, start following everything this man does, and, you can thank me later for that." ~ Kelly Olexa, CEO, Founder of FitFluential - We are Fitness Found(TM)

"Dai is an ambassador that lives and breathes the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto message. His mantra provides "a less is more" blueprint that jump started my workouts with ideas and a powerful community." ~ Riaz Meghji, Breakfast Television Vancouver Co-Host and Creator of Every Conversation Counts

"Dai is pretty much a long proponent of fitness for the RIGHT reasons. From age 15 onwards he's been determined to not just help himself, but everyone he meets along the way. His passion and love for what he does in infectious and to see his thoughts and ideas on paper for everyone is part of his ultimate goal, to share his knowledge." ~ Drex - Evening Host / News Talk 980 - CKNW

"Every now and then you meet an individual in the health and fitness industry that you absolutely want to support and so it was when I met Dai. Dai is dynamic, knowledgeable and above all- does it for the right reasons. Dai's passion is to help others.live a life full of health.  You have bought this book and clearly made the right decision and now when you heed Dai's wisdom in this book - you have indeed made a smart choice!" ~ Kathy Smart, RNC, RSNA, PTS, HTC (North America's Gluten- Free Expert, Best Selling Author, TV Show Host & CEO of Live The Smart Way) 

“Life and the way we move through it is seemingly moving faster and faster. Time has become the only real commodity worth anything these days. Dai’s take on carving out 30 minutes each day for your body, mind, and spirit is a true guide on how to live each day in this fast paced world.” ~ Richard Pollock, president of Pauling Labs Inc. (makers of Ener-C)


BONUS: A personal message from Coach Moose, "Do you want to live a life of total awesomeness?"

Some years ago, I asked myself that same question. I realized that while I had a lot to be thankful for in my life, I was falling short of my own potential. Don’t get me wrong—I was doing the best I could, and life had been trucking along fine. I had moved to a new city on the West Coast, attended university, started to discover myself, landed a great job, fell in love, traveled a little and started a family. But I never seemed to have time for the things that were most important to me. I was also spending more money than I had.

A balancing act called 'life'

My health and fitness ebbed and flowed throughout my life. When I only had to worry about myself, I could always find time for fitness. But when other people—my family—became a significant part of my life, I felt pulled to prioritize “us” rather than “me,” and my health often suffered as a result. I figured that this was just the way it went; after all, it seemed like everyone else I knew was on the same path. But in the back of my mind, I was always thinking: Is this really how life is supposed to be?

As time went on, I kept trying to balance the priorities in my life, striving to attain “perfection,” but I was constantly disappointed in myself. I was never able to truly balance it all. When I let one part of my life become the shining star, all other aspects of my life would dim in comparison. If I focused on family, my career suffered. When I turned my energies toward my career, in particular when I was building my company, my family felt it, and so did my health. I just never seemed to have enough to make everything work. Do you know the feeling?

Like many people, I found happy distraction in activities that didn’t propel me forward in life—pub nights, boys’ trips, nights out with my colleagues and long days on the golf course. I kept telling myself that tomorrow would be the day to “reset” and get everything in order: Tomorrow is the day to start my new habits. Tomorrow is the start of my path to awesomeness. But you know what? Every day I’d wake up to today and tomorrow would never arrive.

Maybe you can relate. Many of us put all of our obligations— ether it’s work, family, or social life—ahead of our own well-being and personal growth. We’re so busy taking care of what her people need from us that we forget to pay attention to our own needs. The problem with that is that while this might help us to get a lot done, mostly for others, we’re probably not feeling satisfied with our lives. Even worse, if we’re not careful, we can burn out—both mentally and physically. And when that happens, we not only let ourselves down, we also let down who depend on us.

Why create the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto?

My goal in creating the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto is to sweep away the negative energies, accentuate the positive ones and empower you to radiate your own awesomeness, along with the greatness of those around you. In a nutshell, the Whole Life Fitness Manifesto is about putting yourself first, which will ultimately benefit those you care about. We all have people in our lives that matter to us. It’s time we begin to matter to ourselves so that we can enjoy an incredible life with each other. So, welcome to a new kind of fitness book. We’re not just talking about physical fitness here. We’re acknowledging that whole-life awesomeness encompasses fitness of mind, body and spirit. And because this is something that we all deserve, this book is for everyone. Even the most stamina-challenged person can tackle the Whole Life Fitness Power 30 program, which will also test you if you are already pushing your own fitness limits.


Getting a grip on total health and wellness is particularly important now because of disturbing rises in obesity and diabetes. Current health statistics, which you’ll find throughout this book, are not pretty. In fact, they are a sobering wake-up call.

But there is reason for hope. On the other end of the spectrum, there is a booming personal growth movement, in which people are realizing their limitless potential as human beings. Put simply, linking your greater potential to your physical fitness is a powerful combination that can change—and possibly save—your life.

As you’ll see, workouts don’t have to be a chore. Working out is really about enjoying a burst of movement that can function as a reset, break, and check-in with your body throughout the day. It’s about feeling how daily movement can activate all kinds of positive things in your life.

What makes me so certain about all this? 

Let me share a deeply personal story.

When I was a kid, there were two students in my school who were extremely over- weight. I was one of them. As a 91-kg (200-lb) 15-year-old, I had a body mass index (BMI) of over 40; I was, by definition, morbidly obese. But after a big personal break- through shortly after my 15th birthday, I dug deep to make a change and, quite simply, I never looked back. My mental attitude played a pivotal role in making that change. I wanted to be healthy, happy and more satisfied with my life, and I did whatever it took to make that happen.

So what about today?

Today, I am honored to be part of a healthy and beautiful family, with my wife, Christie, and my daughters, Chardonae and Brielyn. I constantly strive to live a life  of which I’m proud. In my professional life, I’ve evolved from a successful fitness equipment entrepreneur to a personal trainer, lifestyle coach, speaker, author and all-around “life enhancer.” I’m honored to have the ability to help people every day— now that’s pretty awesome!

Beyond my family, physical health and career, one of the most important aspects of my well-being is my mental health, or emotional fitness. I continually strive to cultivate a deep sense of purpose in my heart and mind; this is what makes me spring out of bed in the morning. And at the end of each day, I ask myself: Was I the best person I could possibly be today? If I can answer yes more often than not, then I know I’m on the right track.

I know we are all capable of achieving whole life fitness. That is, while I believe that we can work out on our own, we never have to be alone with our fitness and lifestyle goals. Now that you’ve found this book, you have found your community—your tribe. No matter what your current lifestyle, age, gender or personality, you are not alone. We are here to encourage and support each other to be the happiest, healthiest versions of ourselves.

So, hands up if you’re ready for a whole life of awesomeness!

PS - a huge thank you to all those that have supported me and my family on this journey. It's been quite the ride and it's only just beginning. Hoorah!
