story:
Hey, we're live! Check out our 80+ products at societyproducts.co

 

We know not everyone has a Whole Foods near them, or wants to fork over 3x the price just for cleaner ingredients.

We decided that we need to change how we shop for household consumer products. So we launched an online membership marketplace, where everything is natural, and everything is sold at cost.

Become a Society member to shop our healthy, affordable household products, ranging from heavy duty household cleaning, to petcare, to skincare. We launch new products every month, making your wallet happier and your home healthier.

Our current Society members are saving up to 60% each month by purchasing their everyday essentials at prices you just can’t find at retail.

Our mission is to make natural products truly accessible to everyone. By cutting out the middlemen and working closely with manufacturers, we developed our own brand of products that nixed the 1970’s branding, toxic chemical ingredients, and the retail price markup.

Just think of us like your favorite wholesale club, except everything is natural, and you don’t need to buy 10 of something just to save. With your Society membership, you’ll access our members-only at-cost pricing. Oh, and did we mention, shipping is free over $25?

During our Indiegogo campaign, we are offering a lifetime membership. You’ll get instant access to our entire collection of products.

The word around town...

Society’s line of natural products

At Society, above all, we care about the quality of our products, meaning not only cleaner ingredients, but cleaner ingredients that can get the job done.

We went from mixing in our kitchen sinks, to getting our formulations extensively tested in labs, to getting hundreds of consumers to test our products, to even getting the approval of the toughest critics (our moms). We vetted over 500 product labs, worked with third party testing facilities, regulation agencies, and more. Most importantly, we made sure that even our heavy duty problems could have natural solutions that actually work.  At the end of the day, we have natural, healthy products, thoughtfully designed for the modern home.

When you shop Society, you’ll find:

  • Stain removers
  • Castile soaps
  • Carpet cleaners
  • Insect killers
  • Surface cleaners
  • Car cleaners
  • Toothbrush cleaner
  • Bath salts
  • Bug repellent
  • Hand soap
  • Bar soap
  • Body wash
  • Shampoo
  • Moisturizer
  • Deodorant
  • Facial masks
  • Facial serums
  • Muscle salves
  • Travel-size amenities
  • Waterless pet bath
  • Pet potty trainer
  • Pet shampoo
  • Vitamins
  • Supplements

And much more. On top of this, we will be launching new products every month, things like vitamins, anti-aging skincare, essential oils, and more, all coming this year. And of course, everything is healthy, natural, and offered at cost.

We'll be expanding to new categories including bedroom essentials (like linens), and fitness (like protein shakes) — almost anything in your home, we’re on it.

 

We are aiming to have our products packed in bio-plastics that actually decompose and don’t harm marine life and our environment. We also use aerosols filled with air instead of harmful VOC's. On top of all this, we are keeping everything locally made, right here in the USA, to support American jobs and to keep our overall carbon footprint down.

The art behind Society...

We’re working with an incredible team of designers at FAY Design to deliver beautiful, simply-designed products—so that Society doesn’t only do good, but also looks good in your home.

“The concept for Society's packaging system originated from a simple observation—most people hide their home products away and out of sight, in favor of displaying more visually appealing items such as artwork instead.

We were inspired by artists Ellsworth Kelly, Anni & Josef Albers, and Agnes Martin and created the visual language of shapes, bold colors, and patterned arrangements.

We felt there was an opportunity to create beautiful packages that could be displayed proudly in our home or office and that look as simple and pure as the ingredients inside.”

— Aron Fay, FAY Design.

 

Your exclusive offer

As a thank you to our early supporters, we are offering you a deal of a lifetime (literally!). During our Indiegogo campaign only, you can buy a never-ending, lifetime membership for the same cost as our yearly fee. After our campaign, any new members joining will be on a monthly membership fee.

Team

Hi! My name is Jessica and I am a recent UCLA graduate. Together, with my friends from UCLA and Stanford Business School, we decided enough was enough with these obnoxiously designed, toxic products that cluttered our homes. We hated that natural products were more expensive, and most of the time, didn’t do the job. Collectively, we have 15+ years of business experience covering major functions of sales, marketing, and supply chain, alongside progressive R&D and new product development expertise with Fortune 500 firms and successful startups.

Everywhere, people overpay by the thousands to simply stay away from toxic goods. As more and more formulations become cheaper, big corporations buy up new solutions and tuck them away in order to make profit and still market their same synthetic products.

We think that should change, and we’re here to make these products fair and accessible. We spent years formulating in our kitchen sink, getting our products tested with labs and consumers, even bringing on a Chief Woof Officer. And now, we are ready to bring to you Society, with our mission of making products that look good, are good-for-you, and are good for your wallet.

We also have a team of amazing advisors along for the ride —

Thank you!

At Society, we want to make clean, beautiful products affordable and available to everyone. We hope to see you as a member of the Society community!

 

We are obsessed with our products and want you to be too. Here’s more on a few of them - 

Bar Soap

This all-natural bar soap scented with organic Patchouli Oil gently cleanses all skin types with a grounding, balancing, and mood-harmonizing aroma.

Multi-Surface Spray

Cleans surfaces, with zero chemical residue. Tough on spills, soap scum, and cooking splatters.

Multi-Insect Killer

An effective bug-killer, without spraying toxic nasties into the air. Nothing in this spray creates harm to the human body.

Dish Soap

Our grease-fighting, super-concentrated and biodegradable dish soap that you can depend on to remove even the toughest baked-on food.

Carpet Cleaner

A world first! An effective carpet cleaner that lifts deep-down dirt and stains without chemicals. Leaves your carpets good as new—so no need to worry about paws or little hands.

 We know not everyone has a Whole Foods near them, or wants to fork over 3x the price just for cleaner ingredients.We decided that we need to change how we shop for household consumer products. So we launched an online membership marketplace, where everything is natural, and everything is sold at cost.Become a Society member to shop our healthy, affordable household products, ranging from heavy duty household cleaning, to petcare, to skincare. We launch new products every month, making your wallet happier and your home healthier.Our current Society members are saving up to 60% each month by purchasing their everyday essentials at prices you just can’t find at retail.Our mission is to make natural products truly accessible to everyone. By cutting out the middlemen and working closely with manufacturers, we developed our own brand of products that nixed the 1970’s branding, toxic chemical ingredients, and the retail price markup.Just think of us like your favorite wholesale club, except everything is natural, and you don’t need to buy 10 of something just to save. With your Society membership, you’ll access our members-only at-cost pricing. Oh, and did we mention, shipping is free over $25?During our Indiegogo campaign, we are offering a lifetime membership. You’ll get instant access to our entire collection of products. The word around town...Society’s line of natural productsAt Society, above all, we care about the quality of our products, meaning not only cleaner ingredients, but cleaner ingredients that can get the job done.We went from mixing in our kitchen sinks, to getting our formulations extensively tested in labs, to getting hundreds of consumers to test our products, to even getting the approval of the toughest critics (our moms). We vetted over 500 product labs, worked with third party testing facilities, regulation agencies, and more. Most importantly, we made sure that even our heavy duty problems could have natural solutions that actually work.  At the end of the day, we have natural, healthy products, thoughtfully designed for the modern home.When you shop Society, you’ll find:
Stain removers
Castile soaps
Carpet cleaners
Insect killers
Surface cleaners
Car cleaners
Toothbrush cleaner
Bath salts
Bug repellent
Hand soap
Bar soap
Body wash
Shampoo
Moisturizer
Deodorant
Facial masks
Facial serums
Muscle salves
Travel-size amenities
Waterless pet bath
Pet potty trainer
Pet shampoo
Vitamins
Supplements
And much more. On top of this, we will be launching new products every month, things like vitamins, anti-aging skincare, essential oils, and more, all coming this year. And of course, everything is healthy, natural, and offered at cost.We'll be expanding to new categories including bedroom essentials (like linens), and fitness (like protein shakes) — almost anything in your home, we’re on it. We are aiming to have our products packed in bio-plastics that actually decompose and don’t harm marine life and our environment. We also use aerosols filled with air instead of harmful VOC's. On top of all this, we are keeping everything locally made, right here in the USA, to support American jobs and to keep our overall carbon footprint down.
The art behind Society...We’re working with an incredible team of designers at FAY Design to deliver beautiful, simply-designed products—so that Society doesn’t only do good, but also looks good in your home.“The concept for Society's packaging system originated from a simple observation—most people hide their home products away and out of sight, in favor of displaying more visually appealing items such as artwork instead.We were inspired by artists Ellsworth Kelly, Anni & Josef Albers, and Agnes Martin and created the visual language of shapes, bold colors, and patterned arrangements.We felt there was an opportunity to create beautiful packages that could be displayed proudly in our home or office and that look as simple and pure as the ingredients inside.”— Aron Fay, FAY Design. 
Your exclusive offerAs a thank you to our early supporters, we are offering you a deal of a lifetime (literally!). During our Indiegogo campaign only, you can buy a never-ending, lifetime membership for the same cost as our yearly fee. After our campaign, any new members joining will be on a monthly membership fee.
TeamHi! My name is Jessica and I am a recent UCLA graduate. Together, with my friends from UCLA and Stanford Business School, we decided enough was enough with these obnoxiously designed, toxic products that cluttered our homes. We hated that natural products were more expensive, and most of the time, didn’t do the job. Collectively, we have 15+ years of business experience covering major functions of sales, marketing, and supply chain, alongside progressive R&D and new product development expertise with Fortune 500 firms and successful startups.Everywhere, people overpay by the thousands to simply stay away from toxic goods. As more and more formulations become cheaper, big corporations buy up new solutions and tuck them away in order to make profit and still market their same synthetic products.We think that should change, and we’re here to make these products fair and accessible. We spent years formulating in our kitchen sink, getting our products tested with labs and consumers, even bringing on a Chief Woof Officer. And now, we are ready to bring to you Society, with our mission of making products that look good, are good-for-you, and are good for your wallet.We also have a team of amazing advisors along for the ride —
Thank you!At Society, we want to make clean, beautiful products affordable and available to everyone. We hope to see you as a member of the Society community! 
We are obsessed with our products and want you to be too. Here’s more on a few of them - 
Bar SoapThis all-natural bar soap scented with organic Patchouli Oil gently cleanses all skin types with a grounding, balancing, and mood-harmonizing aroma.Multi-Surface SprayCleans surfaces, with zero chemical residue. Tough on spills, soap scum, and cooking splatters.Multi-Insect KillerAn effective bug-killer, without spraying toxic nasties into the air. Nothing in this spray creates harm to the human body.Dish SoapOur grease-fighting, super-concentrated and biodegradable dish soap that you can depend on to remove even the toughest baked-on food.Carpet CleanerA world first! An effective carpet cleaner that lifts deep-down dirt and stains without chemicals. Leaves your carpets good as new—so no need to worry about paws or little hands.

story:
Ensure you're drinking enough water to meet your health, wellness, fitness, and weight loss goals with the world’s most convenient and accurate smart water bottle! AquaGenie’s ingenious design tracks your water consumption, reports it wirelessly to its app or to your Fitbit or Apple Health dashboard, wirelessly recharges, and is durable, washable and easy to use. AquaGenie sets your water consumption goals and lights up to remind you to meet them, even adjusting your goals if your activity or the weather suggests you should drink more.

  

 

  

  

  

 

 

  

 

 

 

 

   

 

No need to check your phone. Just give AquaGenie a shake and the glowing ring shows red-yellow-green to tell you if you’re on track.

 

 

AquaGenie is your daily companion that keeps you on track and fully hydrated, helping you achieve all your health, wellness, fitness and weight loss goals! Attractive, durable, easy to wash and easy to use, your AquaGenie tracks your consumption, reports it to most fitness apps, and goes with you everywhere.

The AquaGenie bottle knows your daily water goal and how much you've had to drink. To keep you on track, when it sees you're behind, a glowing ring at the base of the bottle lights up to remind you to take a sip. It's that simple!

 

Our integrated sensor technology is accurate, reliable and measures at any angle, any time. Take a look at the integrated sensor in action!

 

To recharge, just place it on its included wireless charging pad for an hour and you’re good to go for a week! No wires, no batteries to change, no need to set it still to take a measurement.

AquaGenie goes with you everywhere and easily replaces your old water bottle!

  

 

  

 

The free iOS and Android application make keeping track of your daily water intake easy. The application is the hub for all of the information that helps you better understand your body and hydration levels.

  

The application is interactive and easily lets you see your history from the past days, weeks or months. This information helps you better understand the effects water has on your body, mood, weight and energy. We will also help you meet all your goals by suggesting updated water goals when you are more active or conditions have changed. You can even check your progress without the app. Just give AquaGenie a shake and the glowing ring shows red-yellow-green to tell you if you’re on track. 

 

There are an abundance of fitness and weight loss apps and trackers out there that help you keep tabs on your activity, calories, health and more - we’ve downloaded more than a billion of these apps. Fitbit, Garmin, Apple Health, Samsung S Health, and MyFitnessPal all help us stay fit and on track.

That’s why we wanted to make sure AquaGenie is compatible with the most popular wearables and apps on the market. All you have to do is connect your AquaGenie to your fitness tracking or weight loss app, and our patent-pending technology does the work for you. Never worry about remembering to manually input your data every day again. 

 

 

 

 

 

AquaGenie is the first TRULY wireless and wire free smart water bottle. Other Bluetooth water bottles require you to recharge using an open USB port on the bottle, or use watch batteries that require you to periodically disassemble the bottle, remove and replace with new ones. With AquaGenie, you never need to worry about cords or batteries. Just set AquaGenie on the included wireless charging pad, and in 60 minutes, you’re good for the week!

 

 

When the battery is low, drop it on the wireless charger and the blue glowing ring confirms that it's charging.

 

Since AquaGenie does not have any charging ports, wires or moving parts, going on adventures and washing your AquaGenie is extremely easy.

 

AquaGenie is fully immersible and washable in hot water to allow thorough cleaning with soap without taking any pieces off (unlike first generation smart water bottles.) This will keep your bottle clean and germ-free!

Make sure children and elderly loved ones are staying hydrated! As we get older, our sense of thirst decreases, making the elderly more susceptible to dehydration. And we all know children don't pay attention! With AquaGenie, you can easily keep tabs on their hydration stats and goals through the AquaGenie app and they get reminders through the day to take a sip!

 

 

 

 

 

   

 

 

Bottle Design: How We Made The AquaGenie

Take a deeper look into the “genie’s workshop” to see just how much hard work went into creating the AquaGenie you love! Everyone knows all good products start with a “napkin sketch”. Take a look at some of our initial sketches that show the different styles, sizes and shapes we thought about offering.

After we narrowed down the selection of sketches we liked, we started to work on shapes for the bottle and what type of lid to use. Check out some of the ideas we played around with.

 

Once we had these sketches finalized, we explored volumes and turned the sketches into CAD drawings to understand sizing, details and to learn more about the mechanics of the bottle. Images of this can be seen in update #3.

Once the renderings were all set and approved, we started to print the 3D models and parts, which eventually lead us to the amazing bottle we have today.

Circuit Board Design

Take a look at “the brains of the bottle” below! Here you’ll see how we take AquaGenie way beyond the traditional water bottle that you can get at the store today.

Below you can see how the processing logic will flow on the board and how all the pieces will connect and talk to each other:

Once the circuit boards were fitted to the bottle and printed, the components were placed onto the board and the firmware was written to make it all work together!

 

 

 

 

Take a look at AquaGenie in action!

Prototype Demo 1:

 
Prototype Demo #2:

 

Did you miss our Kickstarter Live sessions? We've pulled together a few highlights into one spot so you don't miss anything! Includes:"shake the bottle to see lights respond," additional bottle color options, and optional accessory hook.

 
In association with Enventys​ Partners.

story:
‘To be or not to be diagnosed with a rare disease’, that’s the question that many patients who suffer from an undiagnosed rare disease ask themselves, or their families, friends and caregivers do.

The problem is that rare diseases present with such an unfamiliar combination of signs and symptoms that for most physicians it makes them very hard to diagnose! Rare diseases are often genetic, debilitating, progressive and life threatening. There are approximately 7,000 rare diseases identified that affect about 350 million people or on average 50,000 patients per rare disease worldwide. Rare diseases affect <1/2000 citizens in Europe and <200.000 citizens in the US. <1% are diagnosed and an even smaller number of sufferers are adequately treated. 75% of the people affected are children. 30% of these children will not live to see their 5th birthday. Patients are often referred to numerous physicians and subjected to multiple, costly and sometimes unnecessary medical tests. There is significant lack of knowledge and awareness about these rare diseases and is the reason that this "Diagnostic Odyssey in Rare Disorders™" continues to exist for more than 30 years. In all fairness, it is impossible for physicians to be an expert in all 7,000 rare diseases. More and more physicians therefore use the internet to search for the missing pieces of the puzzle. The fact that this diagnostic odyssey in rare disorders exists more than 30 years after the passage of the Orphan Drug Act in 1983 illustrates that current online symptom checker portals provide insufficient information that physicians require for differential diagnosis of patients who present with a complex and unfamiliar combination of signs and symptoms.

Picture: The treating physician informed us that her patient has had stiffness of his hands since he was 5 years old. He was seen by an orthopedist at another hospital before visiting with a dermatologist at the second hospital. He was referred to his current treatment center at the age of 8.5 years. At that time, his intellectual quotient was 51. The enzyme assay and molecular analysis confirmed the diagnosis of Mucopolysaccharidosis type II, MPS II or Hunter syndrome. He makes regular follow-up visits to ophthalmologist; ear, nose, and throat (ENT) specialist; cardiologist; and pulmonologist. The patient is now 20 years old and has obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) requiring Continuous Positive Airway Pressure, CPAP, at night. Published with consent from family.

The National Organization for Rare Disorders (NORD) in the United States posted the following question on its Facebook page in 2013:
"How long did it take you or a loved one to get an accurate diagnosis?"

"We were stunned at the response. Within the first few hours, we got 200 replies and 20% of those who responded had waited 10 years or longer to get an accurate diagnosis. A significant number had waited 20, 30, even 40 years. Some wrote that, as adults well into middle age, they finally learned that the disabling symptoms they had experienced all their lives resulted from a disease present at birth."

Mary Dunkle, Vice President Communications at NORD. For the full story please click on: http://blog.rarediseases.org/30-years-after-the-orphan-drug-act-it-still-takes-too-long-for-people-with-rare-diseases-to-get-an-accurate-diagnosis/

Also in 2013, Global Genes - RARE Project, the Genetic Alliance UK, Duke University Medical Center, the University of Chicago, the Salford Royal NHS Foundation, the New York University and the University of York UK conducted a survey amongst patients, caregivers and physicians in the US and UK. The results, included in "Rare Disease Impact Report", were presented at the World Orphan Drug Congress in Washington DC that year.

"On average, it takes 5.6. years in the UK for a patient with a rare disease to receive a proper diagnosis."

"On average, it takes 7.6 years in the US for a patient with a rare disease to receive a proper diagnosis."

One can only speculate about how long this would take in other countries outside of the US and UK.

To see the full report please click on: http://www.shire.com/shireplc/dlibrary/documents/RareDiseaseImpactReportforWeb.pdf



As part of this year's Rare Disease Day celebration, Shire, one of the leading bio-pharmaceutical companies in rare diseases introduced a very creative info-graphic explaining the challenges patients face on their Journey to Diagnosis for Rare Diseases. Please click on: http://html.investis.com/s/shire/shire/index.html.

The good news is that for about 500 of these rare diseases innovative treatments, so called orphan drugs, have been developed and approved for marketing by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and/or the European Medicines Agency (EMA). In 2014 the FDA granted 41 orphan drugs marketing authorization and the EMA approved 10 new orphan drugs. That's about 30% more than in 2013. This primarily is due an increasing interest in rare diseases by the traditional pharmaceutical industry. On top of that there are about 2,000 clinical trials conducted with FDA and/or EMA approved orphan designated investigational drugs for rare diseases/indications for which no specific treatment exists today.

  The bad news is that regardless of how many treatments are available today or will be in the near future, patients who need these new therapies may never benefit from these if they can’t get an accurate diagnosis to begin with!

  The solution that could finally end this "Diagnostic Odyssey in Rare Disorders™" is the development of an innovative, rare disease specific, custom designed, best in class, patent pending, interactive web portal called RareMD™. RareMD supports physicians in their process of differential diagnosis of patients who present with a complex and unfamiliar combination of signs and symptoms.

  What we have developed today is a fully operational "proof of concept" version of RareMD™. This version contains 1,294 signs and symptoms associated with, for the moment 25 rare diseases.
Actually we developed two different portals, one for the use by physicians that include medical terms for all 1,294 signs and symptoms and the other one for the use by general public with lay terms for the same 1,294 signs and symptoms. Each and every sign and symptom is labeled with a specific weight relative to its prevalence/specificity to each rare disease. The weights are assigned by independent consulting physicians, familiar with rare diseases.

The algorithms evaluate and calculate the specifics of selected signs and symptoms that results in a computer-generated list with predicted rare diseases a patient might suffer from will then appear, ranked in order of probability.

By clicking on the name of the rare disease(s) predicted, RareMD™ provides a vast amount of information about that specific rare disease such as, disease description, genetics, inheritance, incidence, testing, treatments, names of hundreds of treating physicians, divided per disease, their hospitals and websites, disease specific scientific publications, references to registry programs and clinical trials and lists with names and websites of local Human Genetic Societies, Societies for the Study of Inborn Errors of Metabolism (SSIEM), laboratories, Rare Disease Organizations, Rare Disease Specific Patient Organizations and World Rare Disease Day Organizations in >100 countries on 6 continents. 

To better understand how the proof of concept version of RareMD™ operates please watch a short video by clicking on http://raremd.exaptive.com/intro.


Picture: Blue Whales or Balaenoptera musculus are found in all oceans and often swim in small groups or alone. Only 8,000 to 12,000 Blue Whales are estimated to be alive today. They are out there somewhere but finding them is not easy. Sightings have become very rare. The same applies for patients who suffer from a rare disease. They live somewhere but because there are so few per disease, identifying and properly diagnosing them has been a challenge for decades. This analogy created the idea to have the tail fin of a whale    as the logo for RareMD™.

  What we need to do next, and what this global crowd funding campaign is all about, is to expand the current content of RareMD™ with 25 rare diseases to the approximately 500 rare diseases for which one or more FDA/EMA approved treatments are available and for which we need your help.

As you can imagine, collecting all the above mentioned information about an additional 475 treatable rare diseases, assigning weights to the thousands of signs and symptoms and validating the expanded content of the portal requires a significant amount of time, experience, expertise and financial resources.

Our goal with this crowd funding campaign is to raise $845,000 in 60 days. That is indeed a significant amount of money. However, bear in mind that each of the 25 rare diseases included in the proof of concept version of RareMD™ has on average about 52 signs and symptoms (ranging from 11 - 122). In addition to conducting research for all signs and symptoms per disease it took physicians with experience in rare disease on average about 4 hours per disease to complete the weight assignment for all signs and symptoms. The same process will apply for the additional 475 rare diseases. This "manual weight assignment component" is exactly what differentiates RareMD™ from all existing symptom checker and disease prediction portals. 66% of the funds needed will be used for data collection of all signs & symptoms, weight assignments & validation of the expanded content by a team of medical/scientific advisers and translation of signs and symptoms into lay-terms. For each rare disease in the proof of concept version we included 19 different sets of data. We will include minimally the same sets of data for the additional 475 rare diseases; 16% of the funds will be used for software architecture adjustments, website & App design; 11% for the global introduction campaign of RareMD™ in 2016; 2% for FDA mHealth regulatory compliance and legal counsel; 5% crowd funding fees. 100% of funds will be used for these activities. This is a very labor intensive undertaking resulting in the best in class rare disease specific portal. Please remember that regardless of how many treatments are available today or will be in the near future, patients who need these new therapies may never benefit from these if they cannot get an accurate diagnosis! 

If we raise more than $845.000 we will use these additional funds to develop and implement some of our future goals. See 'Business Development' below. If we raise less than this amount we will have to adjust the development of the portal accordingly but with the same passion and commitment.

Please contribute to this campaign in whatever amount you desire to support the continuing development and introduction of RareMD™.

  What contributors receive in return is one or more free RareMD™ Apps, depending on the amount contributed. See Perks! 

Access to RareMD™ web portal will be FREE for all users of desktop and laptop computers.

For those who prefer to use their mobile device(s), one can download a RareMD™ App for an annual fee.

We believe that the use of RareMD™ will result in a much faster diagnosis of hundreds if not thousands of patients who suffer from a rare disease around the world.

  Endorsements: We are very pleased, honored and encouraged by the fact that the following renowned clinical experts and key opinion leaders in the global rare disease community have endorsed the development of RareMD™.

* Andrea Epstein, Executive director, Global Genes, Allies in Rare Diseases.“It truly seems that this portal has the potential to be a very valuable resource to physicians in reducing the currently lengthy time it takes to reach a rare disease diagnosis”. Global Genes is a leading rare disease advocacy organization with global reach to the worldwide rare community of patients, caregivers, advocates and clinical partners.

* Jim J. McGill MD, Director, Department of Metabolic Medicine, Royal Children’s Hospital, Queensland, Australia. “An online system accessible by all physicians would be extremely helpful”. Dr. McGill is member of International Board of Advisors of the MPS I registry program.

* Pramod K. Mistry, MD, PhD, FRCP, Professor of medicine, pediatrics and cellular molecular physiology. Department of Internal Medicine, Yale School of Medicine. “This will be an important resource for clinicians and students”. Dr. Mistry is the Director of National Gaucher Disease Treatment Center and authored numerous journal articles, book chapters and reviews on Gaucher disease. He has received several awards for his work on Gaucher disease, including the Alan Gordon Memorial Award, Physician of the year award from Genetic Disease Foundation of New York and Fellowship of the Royal College of Physicians of London.

* Henri A. Termeer, former Chairman, CEO and President of Genzyme Corporation. “This is quite obviously a good and needed initiative!” Widely acknowledged for his contributions to the biotechnology industry and health care field, Henri is active in the areas of humanitarian assistance, policy issues, and innovation in providing access to health care. Under Henri's leadership Genzyme was awarded the National Medal of Technology, the highest level of honor awarded by the President of the United States to America’s leading innovators.

  Beneficiaries:

Patients: The ultimate beneficiaries of a successful campaign that results in the development and introduction of a fully validated RareMD™ portal with 500 treatable rare diseases are first and foremost the patients, and their families. Patients will have a much better chance of being diagnosed and potentially treated with a treatment they thought they would never receive.

Physicians: They will have access to a tool that supports them in the process of differential diagnosis of patients who present with a complex and unfamiliar combination of signs and symptoms.

General public:The general public will have access to an innovative tool that allows anyone to search online for the same medical information physicians have access to but written in lay terms.

Industry: Last but certainly not least, the companies that develop and market these treatments will benefit significantly, basically without conducting any additional marketing efforts. More patients diagnosed who receive treatments with one of their orphan drugs, more revenues/profits will be generated. Many companies reinvest a significant percentage of their net annual profit in R&D to keep their pipelines filled, develop a next generation treatment or novel treatments for other rare diseases. The more profit they generate the higher the budget for R&D.

We believe that the incremental revenues/profit companies generate through the use of RareMD™ will be substantial. For that reason we kindly invite all these companies to donate to this campaign accordingly and become sponsors to make this a sustainable service to the global rare disease community!

"Lets walk the talk together and collectively develop this unique on-line tool and make it available to the world so that all stakeholders involved will benefit from it!

  Campaign activity:
We reached out to hundreds of Rare Disease Organizations in more than 100 countries around the world. However it's impossible for us to know and or contact all rare disease specific patient societies around the world, so please feel free to share this info via Twitter/Facebook and the like with whoever you think might be interested.

  Public support and contributions are crucial:
Please feel free to inform and invite your friends, family, healthcare professionals, members of local or international societies anywhere in the world about our crowdfunding campaign. The ultimate beneficiaries of a successful campaign are first and foremost the patients involved. However, from a financial point of view it is the industry that benefits most. If you know which company manufactures and sells the orphan drug, you, a family member or loved one is treated with, please inform them about this campaign and invite them to make a generous contributions to our campaign.
We only have 60 days to accomplish our financial goal. Every dollar, euro etc., counts and time is of the essence. Please contribute to this campaign in whatever amount and currency you desire and support the developed and introduction of RareMD™. Thank you in advance for your support.

  Business development:
The short and long term goals with RareMD™ are:
1) introduce a fully loaded and validated version of RareMD™ web portal and App with 500 rare diseases
2) add new rare diseases/indications that are currently under clinical evaluation in about 2000 clinical trials,
3) include all approximately 7,000 identified rare diseases
4) make RareMD™ "the portal of choice for the global rare disease community"
5) translate RareMD™ into other languages such as Arabic, Chinese (Mandarin), French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish and Turkish.

  Suggestions: If you have comments, ideas and/or suggestions please feel free to share these by email to info@bioneur.com.

Rare disease specific websites:

There are some really good rare diseases specific websites that provide excellent information about hundreds of rare diseases 'once the diagnosis has been made and know which rare disease to look for': Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center - GARD; Genetics Home Reference, Your Guide to Understanding Genetic Conditions, the National Institute of Health - NIH; National Center for Advancing Transformational Sciences - NCATS, Office of Rare Diseases - ORDR; Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man - OMIM; the National Organization for Rare Disorders - NORD; the Voice of Rare Disease Patients in Europe - EURORDIS and others.

  Risks and challenges:
Obviously, we do not want to over-promise and under-deliver! We know that any  process of up-scaling, in our case from 25 diseases to 500 diseases, comes with certain expected and unexpected challenges. The more diseases added the more complex and important the validation process is going to be. We aspire to have both the RareMD™ web portal and App introduced in 2016. If we raise more than $845.000 we will use these additional funds to develop and implement some of our future goals. See 'Business Development' below. If we raise less than this amount we have to adjust the development of the portal accordingly but with the same passion and commitment.

  Thank you!
We are confident that with your support collectively we can make a difference in the lives of patients who suffer from a rare disease and of that of their families and friends. Thank you.

  Disclaimer.
RareMD™ is not diagnostic, but can be regarded as a “hypothetico-deductive method” in the sense that the suggested candidate diseases can be viewed as predictions that require further disease specific testing to confirm a diagnosis. Establishing a diagnosis remains the full responsibility of the medical professional using RareMD™. All of the above offered is contingent on achieving the campaign goal set and subsequent successful development and introduction of RareMD™.
story_txt:
‘To
be or not to be diagnosed with a rare disease’, that’s
the question that many patients who suffer from an undiagnosed rare disease ask
themselves, or their families, friends and caregivers do. 

The
problem is that rare diseases present with such an unfamiliar
combination of signs and symptoms that for most physicians it makes them very
hard to diagnose! Rare diseases are often genetic, debilitating, progressive
and life threatening. There are approximately 7,000 rare diseases identified
that affect about 350 million people or on average 50,000 patients per rare
disease worldwide. Rare diseases affect <1/2000 citizens in Europe and
<200.000 citizens in the US. <1% are diagnosed and an even smaller number
of sufferers are adequately treated. 75% of the people affected are children.
30% of these children will not live to see their 5th birthday.
Patients are often referred to numerous physicians and subjected to multiple,
costly and sometimes unnecessary medical tests. There is significant lack of
knowledge and awareness about these rare diseases and is the reason that this
"Diagnostic Odyssey in Rare Disorders™" continues to exist for more
than 30 years. In all fairness, it is impossible for physicians to be an expert
in all 7,000 rare diseases. More and more physicians therefore use the internet
to search for the missing pieces of the puzzle. The fact that this diagnostic
odyssey in rare disorders exists more than 30 years after the passage of
the Orphan Drug Act in 1983 illustrates that current online symptom checker
portals provide insufficient information that physicians require for
differential diagnosis of patients who present with a complex and unfamiliar
combination of signs and symptoms.
Picture:
The treating physician informed us that her patient has had stiffness of his
hands since he was 5 years old. He was seen by an orthopedist at another
hospital before visiting with a dermatologist at the second hospital. He was
referred to his current treatment center at the age of 8.5 years. At that time,
his intellectual quotient was 51. The enzyme assay and molecular analysis
confirmed the diagnosis of Mucopolysaccharidosis type II, MPS II or Hunter
syndrome. He makes regular follow-up visits to ophthalmologist; ear, nose, and
throat (ENT) specialist; cardiologist; and pulmonologist. The patient is now 20
years old and has obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) requiring Continuous Positive
Airway Pressure, CPAP, at night. Published with consent from family. 







The
National Organization for Rare Disorders (NORD) in the United States posted the
following question on its Facebook page in 2013: 
"How long did it take you or a loved one to get an accurate
diagnosis?"

"We
were stunned at the response. Within the first few hours, we got 200 replies
and 20% of those who responded had waited 10 years or longer to get an accurate
diagnosis. A significant number had waited 20, 30, even 40 years. Some wrote
that, as adults well into middle age, they finally learned that the disabling
symptoms they had experienced all their lives resulted from a disease present
at birth." 
Mary
Dunkle, Vice President Communications at NORD. For the full story please click
on: http://blog.rarediseases.org/30-years-after-the-orphan-drug-act-it-still-takes-too-long-for-people-with-rare-diseases-to-get-an-accurate-diagnosis/
Also
in 2013, Global Genes - RARE Project, the Genetic Alliance UK, Duke University
Medical Center, the University of Chicago, the Salford Royal NHS Foundation,
the New York University and the University of York UK conducted a survey
amongst patients, caregivers and physicians in the US and UK. The results,
included in "Rare Disease Impact Report", were presented at the World
Orphan Drug Congress in Washington DC that year.








"On
average, it takes 5.6. years in the UK for a patient with a rare disease to
receive a proper diagnosis."



"On average, it takes 7.6 years in the US for a patient
with a rare disease to receive a proper diagnosis."

One
can only speculate about how long this would take in other countries outside of
the US and UK.

To
see the full report please click on:
http://www.shire.com/shireplc/dlibrary/documents/RareDiseaseImpactReportforWeb.pdf





As
part of this year's Rare Disease Day celebration, Shire, one of the leading
bio-pharmaceutical companies in rare diseases introduced a very creative
info-graphic explaining the challenges patients face on their Journey to
Diagnosis for Rare Diseases. Please click on: http://html.investis.com/s/shire/shire/index.html. 
 The
good news is that for about 500 of these rare diseases
innovative treatments, so called orphan drugs, have been developed and approved
for marketing by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and/or the European
Medicines Agency (EMA). In 2014 the FDA granted 41 orphan drugs marketing
authorization and the EMA approved 10 new orphan drugs. That's about 30% more
than in 2013. This primarily is due an increasing interest in rare diseases by
the traditional pharmaceutical industry. On top of that there are about 2,000
clinical trials conducted with FDA and/or EMA approved orphan designated
investigational drugs for rare diseases/indications for which no specific
treatment exists today.
  The bad news is that regardless of how many treatments
are available today or will be in the near future, patients who need these new therapies may never benefit from these if they 
can’t get an accurate diagnosis to begin with!   The solution that could finally end this "Diagnostic Odyssey in Rare Disorders™" is the development of an innovative, rare disease specific, custom designed, best in class, patent pending, interactive web portal called RareMD™. RareMD supports physicians in their process of differential diagnosis of patients who present with a 
complex and unfamiliar combination of signs and symptoms.   What we have developed today is a fully operational "proof of concept" version of RareMD™. This version contains 1,294 signs and symptoms associated with, for the moment 25 rare diseases. Actually we developed two different portals, one for the use by physicians that include medical terms for all 1,294 signs and symptoms and the other one for the use by general public with lay terms for the same 1,294 signs and symptoms. Each and every sign and symptom is labeled with a specific weight relative to its prevalence/specificity to each rare disease. The weights
are assigned by independent consulting physicians, familiar with rare diseases. The algorithms evaluate and calculate the specifics of selected signs and symptoms that results in a computer-generated list with predicted rare diseases a patient might
suffer from will then appear, ranked in order of probability. 

By clicking on the name of the rare disease(s) predicted,
RareMD™ provides a vast amount of information about that specific rare disease such as, disease description, genetics, inheritance, incidence, testing, treatments, names of hundreds of treating physicians, divided per disease,
their hospitals and websites, disease specific scientific publications,
references to registry programs and clinical trials and lists with names and
websites of local Human Genetic Societies, Societies for the Study of Inborn Errors
of Metabolism (SSIEM), laboratories, Rare Disease Organizations, Rare Disease
Specific Patient Organizations and World Rare Disease Day Organizations in >100
countries on 6 continents. 
To better understand how the proof of concept version of RareMD™ operates please watch a short video by clicking on http://raremd.exaptive.com/intro.


Picture: Blue Whales or Balaenoptera musculus are found in
all oceans and often swim in small groups or alone. Only 8,000 to 12,000 Blue
Whales are estimated to be alive today. They are out there somewhere but
finding them is not easy. Sightings have become very rare. The same applies for
patients who suffer from a rare disease. They live somewhere but because there
are so few per disease, identifying and properly diagnosing them has been a challenge for
decades. This analogy created the idea to have the tail fin of a whale    as the logo for RareMD™.


  What we need to do next, and what this global crowd funding campaign is all about, is to expand the current content of RareMD™ with 25 rare diseases to the approximately 500 rare diseases for 
which one or more FDA/EMA approved treatments are available and for which we need your help. 

As you can imagine, collecting all the above mentioned information about an additional 475 treatable rare diseases, assigning weights to the thousands of signs and symptoms and validating the expanded content of the portal requires a significant amount of time, experience, expertise and financial resources. 



Our
goal with this crowd funding campaign is to raise $845,000 in 60 days. That is
indeed a significant amount of money. However, bear in mind that each of the 25
rare diseases included in the proof of concept version of RareMD™ has on average about
52 signs and symptoms (ranging from 11 - 122). In addition to conducting
research for all signs and symptoms per disease it took physicians with
experience in rare disease on average about 4 hours per disease to complete the
weight assignment for all signs and symptoms. The same process will apply for
the additional 475 rare diseases. This "manual weight assignment component"
is exactly what differentiates RareMD™ from all existing symptom checker and
disease prediction portals. 66% of the funds needed will be used for data
collection of all signs & symptoms, weight assignments & validation of
the expanded content by a team of medical/scientific advisers and translation
of signs and symptoms into lay-terms. For each rare disease in the proof of
concept version we included 19 different sets of data. We will include
minimally the same sets of data for the additional 475 rare diseases; 16% of
the funds will be used for software architecture adjustments, website & App
design; 11% for the global introduction campaign of RareMD™ in 2016; 2% for FDA
mHealth regulatory compliance and legal counsel; 5% crowd funding fees. 100% of
funds will be used for these activities. This is a very labor intensive
undertaking resulting in the best in class rare disease specific portal. Please
remember that regardless of how many treatments are available today or will be
in the near future, patients who need these new therapies may never benefit
from these if they cannot get an accurate diagnosis! 
If
we raise more than $845.000 we will use these additional funds to develop and
implement some of our future goals. See 'Business Development' below. If we
raise less than this amount we will have to adjust the development of the
portal accordingly but with the same passion and commitment.
Please
contribute to this campaign in whatever amount you desire to support the continuing
development and introduction of RareMD™.


  What contributors receive in return is one or more free RareMD™ Apps, depending on the amount contributed. See Perks! 
Access to RareMD™ web portal will be FREE for all users of desktop and laptop computers. 

For those who prefer to use their mobile device(s), one can download a RareMD™ App for an annual fee. 
We believe that the use of RareMD™ will result in a much faster diagnosis of hundreds if not thousands of patients who suffer from a rare disease around the world. 
  Endorsements: We are very pleased, honored and encouraged by the fact that the
 following renowned clinical experts and key opinion leaders in the global rare disease community have 
endorsed the development of RareMD™. 




* Andrea Epstein, Executive director, Global Genes, Allies
in Rare Diseases.“It truly seems that this portal has the potential to be a
very valuable resource to physicians in reducing the currently lengthy time it
takes to reach a rare disease diagnosis”. Global Genes is a leading rare disease advocacy organization with global reach to the worldwide rare community of patients, caregivers, advocates and clinical partners. 
* Jim J. McGill MD, Director, Department of Metabolic
Medicine, Royal Children’s Hospital, Queensland, Australia. “An online system
accessible by all physicians would be extremely helpful”. Dr. McGill is member of International Board of Advisors of the MPS I registry program. 
* Pramod K. Mistry, MD, PhD, FRCP, Professor of medicine,
pediatrics and cellular molecular physiology. Department of Internal
Medicine, Yale School of Medicine. “This will be an important resource for
clinicians and students”. Dr. Mistry is the Director of National
 Gaucher Disease Treatment Center and authored numerous
 journal articles, book chapters and reviews on Gaucher disease. He has 
received several awards for his work on Gaucher disease, including the 
Alan Gordon Memorial Award, Physician of the year award from Genetic 
Disease Foundation of New York and Fellowship of the Royal College of 
Physicians of London.
      


* Henri A. Termeer, former Chairman, CEO and President of
Genzyme Corporation. “This is quite obviously a good and needed initiative!” Widely acknowledged for his contributions to the biotechnology industry 
and health care field, Henri is active in the areas of humanitarian 
assistance, policy issues, and innovation in providing access to health 
care. Under Henri's leadership Genzyme was awarded the National Medal of Technology, the highest level of honor awarded by the President of the United States to America’s leading innovators.

  Beneficiaries:

Patients:
The ultimate beneficiaries of a successful campaign that
results in the development and introduction of a fully validated RareMD™ portal
with 500 treatable rare diseases are first and foremost the patients, and
their families. Patients will have a much better chance of being diagnosed
and potentially treated with a treatment they thought they would never receive.
Physicians:
They will have access to a tool that supports them in the process of
differential diagnosis of patients who present with a complex and unfamiliar
combination of signs and symptoms.
General
public:The general
public will have access to an innovative tool that allows anyone to search
online for the same medical information physicians have access to but written
in lay terms.
Industry:
Last but certainly not least, the companies that develop and market these
treatments will benefit significantly, basically without conducting any
additional marketing efforts. More patients diagnosed who receive treatments
with one of their orphan drugs, more revenues/profits will be generated. Many
companies reinvest a significant percentage of their net annual profit in
R&D to keep their pipelines filled, develop a next generation treatment or
novel treatments for other rare diseases. The more profit they generate the
higher the budget for R&D.
We
believe that the incremental revenues/profit companies generate through the use
of RareMD™ will be substantial. For that reason we kindly invite all these
companies to donate to this campaign accordingly and become sponsors to make
this a sustainable service to the global rare disease community!
"Lets
walk the talk together and collectively develop this unique on-line tool and
make it available to the world so that all stakeholders involved will benefit
from it!

  Campaign activity:We reached out to hundreds of Rare Disease Organizations in more than 100 countries around the world. However it's impossible for us to know and or contact all rare disease specific patient societies around the world, so please feel free to share this info via Twitter/Facebook and the like with whoever you think might be interested.   Public support and contributions are crucial:Please
 feel free to inform and invite your friends, family, healthcare 
professionals, members of local or international societies anywhere in the
 world about our crowdfunding campaign. The ultimate beneficiaries of a 
successful campaign are first and foremost the patients involved. 
However, from a financial point of view it is the industry that benefits
 most. If you know which company manufactures and sells the orphan drug,
 you, a family member or loved one is treated with, please inform them 
about this campaign and invite them to make a generous contributions to our 
campaign. We only have 60 days to accomplish our financial
 goal. Every dollar, euro etc., counts and time is of the essence. 
Please contribute to this campaign in whatever amount and currency you 
desire and support the developed and introduction of RareMD™. Thank you 
in advance for your support.  Business development:The short and long term goals with RareMD™ are:1) introduce a fully loaded and validated version of RareMD™ web portal and App with 500 rare diseases 2) add new rare diseases/indications that are currently under clinical evaluation in about 2000 clinical trials, 3) include all approximately 7,000 identified rare diseases 4) make RareMD™  "the portal of choice for the global rare disease community"5) translate RareMD™ into other languages such as Arabic, Chinese
 (Mandarin), French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, 
Portuguese, Russian, Spanish and Turkish.  Suggestions: If you have comments, ideas and/or suggestions please feel free to share these by email to info@bioneur.com.
 Rare disease specific websites: There are some really good rare diseases specific 
websites that provide excellent information about hundreds of rare 
diseases 'once the diagnosis has been made and know which rare disease to look for': Genetic and Rare Diseases Information
Center - GARD; Genetics Home Reference, Your Guide to
Understanding Genetic Conditions, the National Institute of Health - NIH; National Center for Advancing
Transformational Sciences - NCATS, Office of Rare Diseases - ORDR; Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man -
OMIM; the National Organization for Rare
Disorders - NORD; the Voice of Rare Disease Patients in
Europe - EURORDIS and others.
  Risks and challenges:Obviously,
 we do not want to over-promise and under-deliver! We know that any  
process of up-scaling, in our case from 25 diseases to 500 diseases, 
comes with certain expected and unexpected challenges. The more 
diseases added the more complex and important the validation process is 
going to be. We aspire to have both the RareMD™ web portal and App introduced in 2016. If we raise more than $845.000 we will use these additional
 funds to develop and implement some of our future goals. See 'Business Development' below. If we raise less than this amount we have to adjust the development of the portal accordingly but with the same passion and commitment.
  Thank you!We are confident that with your support collectively we can make a difference in the lives of patients who suffer from a rare disease and of that of their families and friends. Thank you.  Disclaimer.RareMD™
 is not diagnostic, but can be regarded as a “hypothetico-deductive 
method” in the sense that the suggested candidate diseases can be viewed
 as predictions that require further disease specific testing to confirm
 a diagnosis. Establishing a diagnosis remains the full responsibility 
of the medical professional using RareMD™. All of the above offered is 
contingent on achieving the campaign goal set and subsequent successful 
development and introduction of RareMD™.

story:
The elderly have a hard time keeping up with rapid technology changes.  They may become confused with too many options, too many web sites, and in understanding what is safe for them to look at.  As computers and tablets get more advanced, and screen resolutions get higher, the text gets smaller and harder to read.  DadPad gives an older user a simple interface, big text, and the security of knowing that the content they see comes from their loved ones – your family.


DadPad Features




We have come a long, ways, but there is a lot left to do!

For Phase 1 of DadPad, we have the web site that allows content management completed.  We have the iPad interface coded, and it is in test now.  Our marketing site is up and running.  We have made remarkable strides in getting ready to go to market.

We are within 2 weeks of Beta test now, where we hope to have between 50 and 100 customers use DadPad and give us feedback.  We will be making adjustments during the month of beta testing, and expect to be ready for the general market by the end of August, 2015.

What we need is money to do all this.  Our developers have been working part time for us.  I need to take them full time.  Quickly.

Currently, our development staff consists of this:

·  Brent (the founder):  Product design, team management, and test.

·  Jakob (the UI genius):  User interface, graphic arts, and visual design.

·  Alex (the programmer): Ruby on Rails and iOS development.

While we can do a lot, there is a lot more that we need.  Here are some of the positions I need to fill:

·  iOS Developer for DadPad Administrator App

·  Android Developers for DadPad Android app, and Android Administrator App

·  iOS and Android Developer for Communicator App

·  Product Tester for mobile devices

·  Product Tester for Web interfaces

·  Product Champion and Marketing for strategic sales

·  Customer Support personnel

I’m asking for $100,000.00, because that lets me hire the staff we need, and keep them employed pending revenue generation.  As Phase 2 ramps up, I see this as being more like a 25 person firm, up from our current 1 full time equivalent (I am uncompensated, and my other employees are part time). 

I also expect, by late this year, to need to take office space, primarily for customer support and business support staff.  I fully expect to have the software engineers and testers work remotely, and will also have support staff work remotely as they are trained.  We won’t do that until revenues from the product support having such a facility.  Until then, I will have people train at my house, and then work remotely as needed.

As a side note, having been in IT as long as I have, I have come to the conclusion that NOONE needs to go into an office and work.  Big companies like IBM, Oracle, and others have huge remote work forces and they are doing extremely well.  So, let’s cut traffic, cut carbon, and let people enjoy those extra hours a day they spend commuting just by letting them work from home, shall we?


Starting a business is a lot of things.  It is so fun it is scary!  It is also so scary it is scary.

This isn’t my first business.  In the early part of last decade, I started a business called dbDoctor that did predictive analysis of database systems.  That is geek speak for telling you a database would crash before it happened.  I raised a lot of venture capital, hired a phenomenal CEO to replace me as the leader of the company, and we employed 26 people for 3 years.  I learned more from my CEO, Vandy, than I ever could have believed.  He was an outstanding mentor, and I will always look up to that man.

After the events of 9/11, the market contracted, and our Venture Capitalists made a decision to shut us down.  It was the right decision, and I learned a lot from that too.

It isn’t easy losing something that you put your heart and soul into.  Honestly, the impact to your family is just as bad as the impact to your business.  But you do, indeed, learn a lot.

What this means for me is I understand how precious cash is, and how important cash flow is to a small company.  Profit is an accounting term.  Cash is king.

I also understand how to empower and motivate people to work hard, and have the highest possible quality work.  Quality, not quantity, is the foundation of a successful business.

However, there are always risks involved with any new thing you do.  Here are a few of the risks we face:

1)  We are defining a new market.  Very few companies cater to the elderly outside of insurance programs and medical firms.  Having a technology company with the elderly in mind is fresh, and a steep curve for adoption.

2)  We won’t be selling to the people who use the product.  DadPad requires that someone help the end user, by setting up content and staying informed about what their Recipient wants to see and do. 

3)  Our market is vast.  There are 21 million people in the US between the ages of 70 and 85.  How do you market to that age group?  How do we penetrate that market?  Lot of work to do here.

4)  An iPad is expensive, with new models starting at about 400 dollars.  This is a significant barrier to entry.  Moving to Android will help bring prices down considerably.

5)  It takes time.  People have to be willing to commit some up front time to add content to a device, and then be willing to update with new content periodically.  That can be tough for someone with a busy schedule.

I’m prepared to meet those risks.  I’ve already begun conversations with several seniors organizations, and will be meeting with more.  For marketing, several large organizations are already in place, and we can buy ad space through those companies.  And as far as getting Android running, well, that is why we are here!


At first, I was thinking about Alzheimer’s patients as the people who would use DadPad.  But it didn’t take long before I realized that many of the elderly that live here in the US have similar problems.  Technology changes so fast that they have a hard time keeping up.  And even as simple as we consider an iPad or Android tablet to be, it is really tough for the elderly to use them.  Tablets have very small fonts, lots of buttons, and lots of motions needed to use them.  Swiping, pinching, twisting… I can do this, and you probably can as well.  But can you imagine trying to talk to someone who is not good with technology and telling them what you are trying to get them to do?  ‘Just pinch the screen and it will get smaller, Grandma.’

DadPad’s impact is simple:  We help the elderly or those with cognitive disorders stay connected and engaged. 

If you look at our current population, it is aging fast.  Our young people using electronic communications to chat with someone in the same room!  The old are, quite frankly, left out.  It’s very sad.

Take a look some time in a nursing home, or in an area that is mostly older people.  They move slow.  They sleep a lot.  They just aren’t engaged.  The reason?  They can’t understand technology.

With DadPad, the older person comes alive.  They smile more.  They are more expressive talking.  They are more engaged in life. 

We want to have as many people as possible helping our elderly to stay engaged, fulfilled, and to feel less sad and alone.

DadPad Branded Schwag


Perks at a Glance


Contributors Page

All  contributors to DadPad will get an entry on the DadPad Contributors Page on our main site.  This page is a list of everyone who helps us make DadPad a reality.

Clicking on any name brings up a window on your browser that looks like this:

You can add a picture of yourself, up to 3 pictures of your family members that you thought DadPad would help, and a write-up of why DadPad is important to you.

The Contributors page will stay up forever.  It is our tribute to you, our supporters, for making DadPad a reality.


"I Helped Build This" Badge


Perk Descriptions

$5 Perks

Thank you so much for making DadPad a success!  For your help, you will receive the ability to add your page to our Contributors list.  You’ll also get a virtual high five, and all campaign updates.

$25 Perks

Your contribution is helping us so much!  We would love to offer you 3 months of DadPad service for a single iPad just as soon as we release to the general public. That’s a $51 value!  Of course, you will also get an entry on the Contributors page.

$50 Perks

You rock!  You get 6 months of DadPad service for 1 iPad, a $102 value!  We are also including a DadPad coffee mug, and a laser-cut DadPad keychain for you.  And, there is the Contributors page, so everyone knows you helped!

$100 Perks

OK, you are just unbelievable!  Thanks so much for making this happen.  Here is what we are happy to do for you:  You get a year of DadPad service for free, for 1 iPad.  That is a $204 perk!  You also get the Contributors page, and a Stainless Tumbler with the DadPad logo.  But here is something Really cool:  On the iPad users page, we have a special panel where a picture of you will appear, with the words ‘I Helped Build DadPad!’.  Every time your loved one starts DadPad, they can see you picture, and a note saying you helped to build our service.  That way, they remember you every time they use the app!

$250 Perks

Thank you SO much!  Of course we will offer you the contributors page, where you can share your story.  We would also like to offer you 2 years of DadPad service, for up to 2 iPads.  At our normal prices, that is a $648 value by itself!  You will also get the badge on the iPad showing your loved ones you helped to build DadPad.  And, we have a special t-shirt in design just for you, with the DadPad logo, and a special message about how you helped build DadPad.  We’d also love for you to have the DadPad Stainless Tumbler to display proudly on your desk, or to take with you in your car.

$500.00 Perks

What can we say?  You have DadPad for life.  Up to 5 Recipients, as long as you need it.  We would also like to offer an debossed leather padfolio with the DadPad logo for your help.  And of course, you will be on the contributors page and get the badge in the application for your help.

$1000 Perks

Boy, do we have a surprise for you!  Yes, you get unlimited DadPad for life.  Up to 10 recipients, whenever you need it.  It’s yours.  And the badge on the app, the contributors page, the DadPad logo Stainless Tumbler, a polo shirt, and a padfolio.  But here is the fun part:  You get to help us test new features!  As we come out with new releases, you will get to be a part of our Beta Test community.  Think about it:  you will have access to new features before anyone else knows they exist.  Special phone meetings to talk about how things work.  And we will make our developers and support staff available to you to help sort out bugs.  This is your chance to be part of the final development process!  This is limited to 100 individuals.

$2000 Perks

You have chosen to take a vested interest in DadPad.  Clearly, you are someone who wants to help those who have problems with technology to stay connected and fulfilled.  We would love to have you serve on our Advisory Board.  The Advisory Board will be limited to 50 individuals.  We will have monthly calls to talk about the new ideas you have for features for our products, as well as keep you informed of our current direction, product development cycles, and upcoming releases.  Of course, you will also be entitled to everything we offer at the $1000.00 level, including the contributors page, Beta Test programs, ‘I Helped Build This’ badge, the Stainless Tumbler, a polo shirt, and a padfolio.  DadPad is free for life, for anyone you choose.  But most importantly, your ideas and feedback help to shape the product to help millions of people get re-connected.


We would love to have you be a member of the DadPad team by becoming a contributor!  Your support will let us carry DadPad forward.

However, we understand that not everyone wants to contribute, and many don’t have the means to do so.

If you feel what we are doing is worthy, and you think people should know about it, would you help us spread the word?

You can use the Sharing tools right here on the IndieGoGo page.  Or, feel free to Like and Share our Facebook page below:

Our Facebook page is https://www.facebook.com/MyDadPad.

Our Youtube site is

Please, SHARE it on Facebook.  TWEET it on Twitter.  Pin it.  Post it.  Email it. 

Whatever you can do to get the word out gets us one step closer to getting DadPad into the hands of those people who raised us, taught us, and made us who we are today. 

Let’s support our elderly!

computers and tablets get more advanced, and screen resolutions get
