For
Phase 1 of DadPad, we have the web site that allows content management completed.  We have the iPad interface coded, and it is
in test now.  Our marketing site is up
and running.  We have made remarkable
strides in getting ready to go to market.
We
are within 2 weeks of Beta test now, where we hope to have between 50 and 100
customers use DadPad and give us feedback. 
We will be making adjustments during the month of beta testing, and expect
to be ready for the general market by the end of August, 2015.
What
we need is money to do all this.  Our
developers have been working part time for us. 
I need to take them full time. 
Quickly.
Currently,
our development staff consists of this:
· 
Brent
(the founder):  Product design, team
management, and test.
· 
Jakob
(the UI genius):  User interface, graphic
arts, and visual design.
· 
Alex
(the programmer): Ruby on Rails and iOS development.
While
we can do a lot, there is a lot more that we need.  Here are some of the positions I need to
fill:
· 
iOS
Developer for DadPad Administrator App
· 
Android
Developers for DadPad Android app, and Android Administrator App
· 
iOS
and Android Developer for Communicator App
· 
Product
Tester for mobile devices
· 
Product
Tester for Web interfaces
· 
Product
Champion and Marketing for strategic sales
· 
Customer
Support personnel
I’m
asking for $100,000.00, because that lets me hire the staff we need, and keep
them employed pending revenue generation. 
As Phase 2 ramps up, I see this as being more like a 25 person firm, up
from our current 1 full time equivalent (I am uncompensated, and my other
employees are part time).  
I
also expect, by late this year, to need to take office space, primarily for
customer support and business support staff. 
I fully expect to have the software engineers and testers work remotely,
and will also have support staff work remotely as they are trained.  We won’t do that until revenues from the
product support having such a facility. 
Until then, I will have people train at my house, and then work remotely
as needed.
As
a side note, having been in IT as long as I have, I have come to the conclusion
that NOONE needs to go into an office and work. 
Big companies like IBM, Oracle, and others have huge remote work forces
and they are doing extremely well.  So,
let’s cut traffic, cut carbon, and let people enjoy those extra hours a day
they spend commuting just by letting them work from home, shall we?

Starting
a business is a lot of things.  It is so
fun it is scary!  It is also so scary it
is scary.
This
isn’t my first business.  In the early
part of last decade, I started a business called dbDoctor that did predictive
analysis of database systems.  That is
geek speak for telling you a database would crash before it happened.  I raised a lot of venture capital, hired a phenomenal
CEO to replace me as the leader of the company, and we employed 26 people for 3
years.  I learned more from my CEO,
Vandy, than I ever could have believed.  He
was an outstanding mentor, and I will always look up to that man.
After
the events of 9/11, the market contracted, and our Venture Capitalists made a
decision to shut us down.  It was the
right decision, and I learned a lot from that too.
It
isn’t easy losing something that you put your heart and soul into.  Honestly, the impact to your family is just
as bad as the impact to your business. 
But you do, indeed, learn a lot.
What
this means for me is I understand how precious cash is, and how important cash
flow is to a small company.  Profit is an
accounting term.  Cash is king.
I
also understand how to empower and motivate people to work hard, and have the
highest possible quality work.  Quality,
not quantity, is the foundation of a successful business.
However,
there are always risks involved with any new thing you do.  Here are a few of the risks we face:
1) 
We
are defining a new market.  Very few
companies cater to the elderly outside of insurance programs and medical
firms.  Having a technology company with
the elderly in mind is fresh, and a steep curve for adoption.
2) 
We
won’t be selling to the people who use the product.  DadPad requires that someone help the end
user, by setting up content and staying informed about what their Recipient
wants to see and do.  
3) 
Our
market is vast.  There are 21 million
people in the US between the ages of 70 and 85. 
How do you market to that age group? 
How do we penetrate that market? 
Lot of work to do here.
4) 
An
iPad is expensive, with new models starting at about 400 dollars.  This is a significant barrier to entry.  Moving to Android will help bring prices down
considerably.
5) 
It
takes time.  People have to be willing to
commit some up front time to add content to a device, and then be willing to
update with new content periodically. 
That can be tough for someone with a busy schedule.
I’m
prepared to meet those risks.  I’ve
already begun conversations with several seniors organizations, and will be
meeting with more.  For marketing,
several large organizations are already in place, and we can buy ad space
through those companies.  And as far as
getting Android running, well, that is why we are here!

At
first, I was thinking about Alzheimer’s patients as the people who would use
DadPad.  But it didn’t take long before I
realized that many of the elderly that live here in the US have similar
problems.  Technology changes so fast
that they have a hard time keeping up. 
And even as simple as we consider an iPad or Android tablet to be, it is
really tough for the elderly to use them. 
Tablets have very small fonts, lots of buttons, and lots of motions
needed to use them.  Swiping, pinching,
twisting… I can do this, and you probably can as well.  But can you imagine trying to talk to someone
who is not good with technology and telling them what you are trying to get
them to do?  ‘Just pinch the screen and
it will get smaller, Grandma.’
DadPad’s
impact is simple:  We help the elderly or
those with cognitive disorders stay connected and engaged.  
If
you look at our current population, it is aging fast.  Our young people using electronic
communications to chat with someone in the same room!  The old are, quite frankly, left out.  It’s very sad.
Take
a look some time in a nursing home, or in an area that is mostly older
people.  They move slow.  They sleep a lot.  They just aren’t engaged.  The reason? 
They can’t understand technology.
With
DadPad, the older person comes alive. 
They smile more.  They are more
expressive talking.  They are more
engaged in life.  
We
want to have as many people as possible helping our elderly to stay engaged,
fulfilled, and to feel less sad and alone.
DadPad Branded Schwag
Perks at a GlanceContributors Page
All  contributors to DadPad will get an entry on
the DadPad Contributors Page on our main site. 
This page is a list of everyone who helps us make DadPad a reality.
Clicking
on any name brings up a window on your browser that looks like this:You
can add a picture of yourself, up to 3 pictures of your family members that you
thought DadPad would help, and a write-up of why DadPad is important to you. 
The
Contributors page will stay up forever. 
It is our tribute to you, our supporters, for making DadPad a reality."I Helped Build This" Badge

Perk Descriptions$5
Perks
Thank
you so much for making DadPad a success! 
For your help, you will receive the ability to add your page to our
Contributors list.  You’ll also get a
virtual high five, and all campaign updates.
$25
Perks
Your
contribution is helping us so much!  We
would love to offer you 3 months of DadPad service for a single iPad just as
soon as we release to the general public. That’s a $51 value!  Of course, you will also get an entry on the
Contributors page.
$50
Perks
You
rock!  You get 6 months of DadPad service
for 1 iPad, a $102 value!  We are also
including a DadPad coffee mug, and a laser-cut DadPad keychain for you.  And, there is the Contributors page, so
everyone knows you helped!
$100
Perks
OK,
you are just unbelievable!  Thanks so
much for making this happen.  Here is
what we are happy to do for you:  You get
a year of DadPad service for free, for 1 iPad. 
That is a $204 perk!  You also get
the Contributors page, and a Stainless Tumbler with the DadPad
logo.  But here is something Really
cool:  On the iPad users page, we have a
special panel where a picture of you will appear, with the words ‘I Helped
Build DadPad!’.  Every time your loved
one starts DadPad, they can see you picture, and a note saying you helped to
build our service.  That way, they
remember you every time they use the app!
$250
Perks
Thank
you SO much!  Of course we will offer you
the contributors page, where you can share your story.  We would also like to offer you 2 years of
DadPad service, for up to 2 iPads.  At
our normal prices, that is a $648 value by itself!  You will also get the badge on the iPad
showing your loved ones you helped to build DadPad.  And, we have a special t-shirt in design just
for you, with the DadPad logo, and a special message about how you helped build
DadPad.  We’d also love for you to have
the DadPad Stainless Tumbler to display proudly on your desk, or to take with
you in your car.$500.00
Perks
What
can we say?  You have DadPad for
life.  Up to 5 Recipients, as long as you
need it.  We would also like to offer an debossed leather padfolio with the DadPad logo for your help.  And of course, you will be on the
contributors page and get the badge in the application for your help.
$1000
Perks
Boy,
do we have a surprise for you!  Yes, you
get unlimited DadPad for life.  Up to 10
recipients, whenever you need it.  It’s
yours.  And the badge on the app, the
contributors page, the DadPad logo Stainless Tumbler, a polo shirt, and a padfolio.  But here is the fun part:  You get to help us test new features!  As we come out with new releases, you will
get to be a part of our Beta Test community. 
Think about it:  you will have
access to new features before anyone else knows they exist.  Special phone meetings to talk about how
things work.  And we will make our
developers and support staff available to you to help sort out bugs.  This is your chance to be part of the final
development process!  This is limited to
100 individuals.
$2000
Perks
You
have chosen to take a vested interest in DadPad.  Clearly, you are someone who wants to help those
who have problems with technology to stay connected and fulfilled.  We would love to have you serve on our Advisory
Board.  The Advisory Board will be
limited to 50 individuals.  We will have
monthly calls to talk about the new ideas you have for features for our
products, as well as keep you informed of our current direction, product
development cycles, and upcoming releases. 
Of course, you will also be entitled to everything we offer at the
$1000.00 level, including the contributors page, Beta Test programs, ‘I Helped
Build This’ badge, the Stainless Tumbler, a polo shirt, and a padfolio.  DadPad is free for life, for anyone you
choose.  But most importantly, your ideas
and feedback help to shape the product to help millions of people get
re-connected.

We
would love to have you be a member of the DadPad team by becoming a contributor!  Your support will let us carry DadPad
forward.
However,
we understand that not everyone wants to contribute, and many don’t have the
means to do so.
If
you feel what we are doing is worthy, and you think people should know about
it, would you help us spread the word?
You
can use the Sharing tools right here on the IndieGoGo page.  Or, feel free to Like and Share our Facebook
page below:
Our
Facebook page is https://www.facebook.com/MyDadPad.Our Youtube site is 
Please,
SHARE it on Facebook.  TWEET it on
Twitter.  Pin it.  Post it. 
Email it.  
Whatever
you can do to get the word out gets us one step closer to getting DadPad into
the hands of those people who raised us, taught us, and made us who we are
today.  
Let’s
support our elderly!

story:
"Massage Therapy For The Real World"

I am raising money for the start up cost of opening a Therapeutic Massage studio.

Raised By Wolves bodywork is for regular people who need bodywork but don't have the time for the 'spa' experience. Think of Raised By Wolves bodywork as the 'anti-spa'. (not that there's anything wrong with that...:)

RBWb has 15 years of full-time experience working with athletes, performers and regular working people who experience pain, discomfort & stress from their daily activities.

For the past year I have been working out of my home office which has been wonderful!  I'm thankful that business has been booming, so much so that it's time to expand and bring on a team of talented and like-minded massage therapists. The new office is in a great location in Society Hill Philadelphia, only minutes from my current location.

The funds will be used for one month security and first and last months rent and furnishings.

story:
Short Summary

* We can issue charitable receipts for over $20

Spaces dedicated to youth empowerment are becoming fewer and fewer in this country. As youth, we face an unpredictable and scary future characterized by climate chaos and extreme inequality.

While Conscious Minds Camp will not solve these challenges, it will equip participants with the critical and creative thinking and resources they need to address them in a way that inspires hope and action.

This year 38 youth from across Ontario will come together to develop and test innovating programming in the following Core Programming Areas:

Food Security                                                            Climate Change Resilience

Nature Awareness and Self-Reflection             Intercultural Learning

Art and Social Change                                            Applied Human Rights

Direct Democracy Skills                                         Reconciliation and Healing

Organizers:

CMC was started by the LIFT Youth Project in 2013. We are a diverse team of young individuals with a longing for positive social and environmental change. We are students, community workers, support workers, and 9-to-5ers. LIFT is a human rights education and resource center based in St. James Town, Toronto.

The LIFT Youth Project is partnered with the Center for Social Justice. CSJ conducts research, education and advocacy on issues of equality and democracy.

Campers:

Age Range:

Seeds - 13-15 yrs old

Shoots - 16-18 yrs old

Roots - 19-29 yrs old * mentor seeds and shoots

We already have a full 38 signed up, with more and more showing interest every day. So far, participants are coming from Roseneath, Toronto, Kitchener, Mississauga, Scarborough, Algonquin, and Alderville. While we invite youth from all socioeconomic backgrounds, we prioritize spots for low-income, native, and newcomer youth.

Other Partners: Cobourg Scout Reserve

Supporters: Ubuntu Development Association, Nogojiwanong Youth Solidarity Initiative, St. James Town Community Corner After School Program 


The Impact

Youth participants will take away:
  • Leadership Skills
  • Knowledge on their human rights and how to insert them
  • Strategies for healthy living and self-care
  • Outdoor and nature skills; re-skilling
  • Critical and Creative Thinking techniques
  • Insight and Goals on building Climate Change Resilience
  • Incredible friendships and connections
We are proud to be under the guidance of LIFT, an organization that has a track record of incubating meaningful youth programs in the areas of food security and green building, empowerment through the arts, and democracy and human rights training. 


What We Need

* If you are interested in making an in-kind donation, for example tents, sleeping bags, art supplies, etc., please email us at youthproject@lift.to

The Camp:

Transportation - $3,000

Food and Water - $3,000

Site Rental - $1,500

Camping Supplies - $1,750

Workshop and Arts Supplies - $750

Solar Panel Workshop - $750

Field Trips - $500

Honorarium for Elders and Experts - $1,750

Cook - $1,000

Honorarium for Core Organizers - $3,500

Participant Honorarium** - $3,000

Total: $20,500

Administration and Processing Fees

Indiegogo Fee - 9%

Trustee Fee (processing payments, sending out charitable receipts) - 10%

Capital for Rewards - $500

Total: $4,395

** We believe that everyone's time is valuable. Youth attending this summer's camp will be dedicating themselves to the development and testing of camp programming. This work for a better world deserves to be honoured. 


Fundraising Challenge


We have raised $5,000 so far, and as long as we raise another $10,000, we will be able to make this camp happen! The budget we present to you here will make the camp an outstanding experience and we hope you will help us raise the full $25,000.

We recognize that youth-led social justice spaces are not (yet!) valued in society the way they should be, and it may be difficult to reach our full goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to make an in kind donation like camping gear or books or art supplies please email us at: youthproject@lift.to 

Please share our campaign with your friends, family, colleagues, fans, mentors, etc. We need your help to get the word out! 

www.consciousmindscamp.org

story:
My name is Yeraldina and I am trying to start a home care business for the elderly and disabled  in the heart of Indiana. By opening this agency I will help families keep their loved ones in the comfort of their home. The services provided would allow the patient to feel free and independent.  

I need your help in setting up and getting the agency up and running. I need to buy equipment and medical supplies. The funds will go towards the purchase of medical supplies such as, stethoscopes, gauze, thermometers and uniforms for the caregivers. I have already invested money and time in obtaining proper licensure and permits in order to operate.

 You can also help by SIMPLY spreading the word! Share our website. www.excellenthomecare.net. This will raise awareness that we are in business and ready to serve the community. Thank you in advance for your help.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit this page.

I met Michail at his second birthday, in the hospital. I came to visit a friend and I was lost into Michail’s wonderful eyes and positive light.  I am doing all I can to support him and his family and I need your help!

Michail is a happy 3 years old boy from Ukraine. He was diagnosed with Metastatic Neuroblastoma on 28.10.2014. I am raising money to save his life and together with the organization “Whispers of the Heart - Friends of Rachashei Lev".

Whispers of the Heart is a 501c3 nonprofit registered organization that was established in 1989 and has been a leading group in the enhancement of cancer-stricken children and their families in USA, Israel and England.

Michail’s parents, which don’t have other children, and with the help of Whispers of the Heart Team, decided to bring him to Israel one year ago. Quality of hospitals and medical treatments in Ukraine don’t leave children with cancer many chances of being cured. Michail is hospitalized at the Tel-Hashomer in the pediatric Oncology Department, The Edmund and Lily Safra Children Hospital since 28.10.2014. His treatment is expected to last for two years and he started chemotherapy on 05.11.2014.

He is finishing the 8 courses of chemotherapy and then would need to continue with surgery, BMT and radiation followed by IL 2 ab and 13 cis retinoic acid.

This fundraiser was set up by me, and spontaneously, to raise as much money as possible to keep covering Michail’s medical expenses and ease the financial burden on his family that can't afford to pay for the surgery and chemotherapy.

At this stage we have estimation of how much the medical expense will be, but anything we raise will help enormously towards the final bill.

Estimation Costs:

  • Assessments $20000
  • Chemotherapy Treatment for 8 Cycles $80000
  • Consultations/ other medical services and hospitalization $85000
  • Oncologic Surgery $60000
  • Autologous Stem Cells Transplantation $85000

If you would like to make a donation it would be greatly appreciated. If you can’t donate, words of encouragement are very much welcomed!

Please feel free to share this link with your friends, family, colleagues, philanthropic organizations, associations that support cancer patients or anyone you think would like to donate. Feel free to contact me in private as well.

Let’s save Michail life, all Together!

Thank you.

Amedeo

story:
Welcome to Shake-A-Leg Miami! 

Shake-A-Leg Miami, a not for-profit 501 c 3 organization, partnered with the City of Miami, was created to provide a year-round venue for water sports programs for people with disabilities in an inclusive community setting. Offering the first universally accessible boating center in South Florida, Shake-A-Leg Miami has become an international hub where people with disabilities come together to learn, make friends, and have fun.

We, at Shake-A-Leg Miami, are a group of people who are committed to improving the quality of life of people with disabilities through bringing together the power of community and the water. 

Everyone with a disability should have an opportunity to improve their Health, Wellness and Quality of Life.

We have a vision to bring a full array of wellness services to the Shake-A-Leg Miami project by building a new wellness center. This wellness center will provide year-round physical conditioning, education, Pilates, yoga, and other services to make its water-centric activities available to all bodies. People with disabilities need a place to exercise both their minds and bodies in an integrated setting. 

We are proud to announce that we have received cash and in-kind contributions of $70,000 to launch our campaign.

The first phase of Shake-A-Leg Miami's expansion project is to raise funds to equip the new spaces with Pilates equipment, yoga accessories, customized rowing ergo-meters and a Life Fitness Synergy 360 customizable, multipurpose training hub. With your help, this project will become reality!

How to Get Involved

You can become a donor today!

You may become a donor at the different levels listed on this page. Our goal is to raise $150,000. We have secured $70,000 of in-kind and cash donations, leaving us with $80,000 to raise.  Please join us, below is the breakdown of our project:

Pilates Studio Equipment from Balance Body: $35,000

Life Fitness Synergy 360 Equipment and accessories: $30,000

Ergo-meters: $10,000

Room makeover: $25,000

Rowing Shells: $50,000

Total: $150,000

Our Future Programs

·  Adaptive Physical Fitness programs will be implemented in collaboration with Polestar Pilates, Miami Dade County Public Schools, City of Miami Parks, and Baptist Health Systems.

·  Specific activities will include: yoga, dance, therapeutic message, weights training, sports specific training, aerobics, and Pilates. 

·  Adaptive Aquatic Sports and Recreation programs will introduce sailing, kayaking, rowing, swimming, and an array of other water-sports to youth and adults with disabilities.

·  Health and Wellness Education programs will empower youth and adults with disabilities to manage their health, wellness and nutrition. 

·  Educational programs will include topics such as Integrating Physical Activity Into Daily Lifestyle, Anxiety Reduction and Stress Management.
story_txt:
Welcome to Shake-A-Leg Miami! 
Shake-A-Leg Miami, a not for-profit 501 c 3 organization, partnered with the City of Miami, was created to provide a year-round venue for water sports programs for people with disabilities in an inclusive community setting. Offering the first universally accessible boating center in South Florida, Shake-A-Leg Miami has become an international hub where people with disabilities come together to learn, make friends, and have fun.

We, at Shake-A-Leg Miami, are a group of people who are committed to improving the quality of life of people with disabilities through bringing together the power of community and the water. 

Everyone with a disability should have an opportunity to improve their Health, Wellness and Quality of Life.


We have a vision to bring a full array of wellness services to the Shake-A-Leg Miami project by building a new wellness center. This wellness center will provide year-round physical conditioning, education, Pilates, yoga, and other services to make its water-centric activities available to all bodies. People with disabilities need a place to exercise both their minds and bodies in an integrated setting. 
We are proud to announce that we have received cash and in-kind contributions of $70,000 to launch our campaign.



The
first phase of Shake-A-Leg Miami's expansion project is to raise funds to equip the
new spaces with Pilates equipment, yoga accessories, customized rowing ergo-meters and a Life Fitness Synergy 360 customizable, multipurpose training
hub. With your help, this project will become reality!

How
to Get Involved
You
can become a donor today! 
You
may become a donor at the different levels listed on this page. Our goal is to raise $150,000. We have secured $70,000 of in-kind and cash donations, leaving us with $80,000 to raise.  Please join us, below is the breakdown of our project:
Pilates
Studio Equipment from Balance Body: $35,000
Life
Fitness Synergy 360 Equipment and accessories: $30,000
Ergo-meters:
$10,000
Room
makeover: $25,000
Rowing Shells: $50,000
Total:
$150,000

with Polestar Pilates, Miami Dade County Public Schools, City of Miami Parks, and Baptist Health Systems.

activities will include: yoga, dance, therapeutic message, weights training,

story:
About this project

We are creating the fitness app of the next generation! Calistix is a virtual personal trainer that offers a huge variety of sports activities: more than 100 exercises, indoors and outdoors, with or without equipment, for any fitness level from beginners to competitive athletes. It is a true all-in-one app with three different options - endurance, body workout and cross sports. The innovative ghost mode let’s you enter in virtual competitions with friends. Extras include a heart rate sensor, a pedometer, a BMI & WHR Calculator and standardized fitness tests. What’s best: Calistix is 100% free of charge and requires no registration.

Help us to make it happen - be part of our fitness revolution!

  • become and stay fit and healthy,
  • benefit from the sport scientific know-how of an experienced personal trainer,
  • save the cost of a gym membership,
  • exercise where- and whenever you like,
  • choose between a variety of sports for a versatile training,
  • alternate between full-body and split workouts, with or without equipment,
  • track all of your sporting activities in detailed statistics.


Bored of running alone? Up the fun with a virtual competition! Race against friend or your own previous results. The “ghost mode” lets you keep an eye on your competitor: Are you lagging behind? Step up your pace to catch up with your ghost-rival! Speed up some more to pass and finish first!


Download Calistix Personal Trainer

We want to motivate as many people as possible to exercise regularly; we want to inspire them to live an active life and give them a tool - a first-class personal trainer - to guide them on that journey.

In the long term, we want to build a sports community and develop joint projects, such as an open Calistix exercise collection and an open fitness portal where users can share their experiences.

In short, we want to make the world a bit healthier and happier through fitness. We are deeply convinced that we can only achieve this with an app that is free of charge, requires no registration and will (successively) be available on almost all platforms.


In the past, we have successfully developed fitness apps and sold them in the app store - the way many start-ups do. Now we want to do something completely different: We want to create a first-class fitness app that is 100% free of charge, requires no registration and yet offers more than the current market leaders!

This is not business as usual - this is a true idealist endeavor and because of this, we need YOUR help!

We have already invested a lot of $$$ and many working hours in this project. We are determined to contribute our joint expertise and creativity. Please support us with a pledge and/or by spreading the word - here on Indiegogo and elsewhere!


Risks & Challenges

App development is our passion: We are a team of seasoned experts and have successfully launched 9 apps in the last 2 years. We know what we’re doing - and we also know that each project has its risks.

We want to deliver top quality and would rather delay the release than hand over a less-than-perfect app!

For Calistix, we have scheduled plenty of buffer time to absorb delays that may occur throughout the process: Team members might catch the flu right before a deadline, an unusually persistent bug might require extra night-shifts… We’ve got a long list of foreseeable risks that we are prepared for, but we also know that unexpected events may arise and force us to delay the release dates laid out above.

We assure you that we’ll do our best to handle each and every challenge we’ll meet along the way - and we’ll keep you informed of any unavoidable delays as soon as we learn about them!

story:
Our Goal Is To Improve The Quality of Sleep in Lasting and Meaningful Ways.

Introducing The Plex Sleep Scanner, by Somnology.

A Sleep Tracking Wearable Device
  • Uses medical-grade sensors that go beyond capturing sleep behaviors, to monitor breathing patterns, pulse, and oxygen levels during sleep.
  • Plex users receive a comprehensive snapshot of their sleep and breathing patterns which can then be shared with their sleep physician.
  • Brings real-time information to users and their doctors about diagnostic possibilities underlying their sleep issues.

Our mission is to help as many people with sleep problems as possible, for the lowest possible cost. Despite efforts to improve healthcare coverage, many people still do not have access to the care they need to make positive changes in their lives. We believe personal tracking devices have tremendous potential but need to do more than provide reams of useless, and potentially inaccurate, data. 

The Plex Sleep Screener uses medical-grade sensors to accurately measure the user’s breathing patterns, movement, body position, heart rate, and oxygen levels, then sends the date to our secure servers for processing. Through the integrated app (MobileSleepDoc Pro) and the Plex Website, we provide the user with a report of our findings. The simple report shows a severity indicator, whereas the extended report shows the user details of clinically validated sleep disturbance indices.

This information can be used to make significant lifestyle changes, to share with your doctor for further testing and discussion, and to track the progress of a current sleep treatment program. For example, users who are under treatment already for obstructive sleep apnea can us the Plex Sleep Scanner to monitor their progress and treatment efficacy.


Use Plex Sleep Scanner with MobileSleepDoc Pro App

MobileSleepDoc is a mobile app created by sleep experts designed to help people who have trouble sleeping. It has many features and resources to help people who have issues with sleep, including questionnaires that screen for possible sleep disorders and two therapies for insomnia. It also allows you to store information about your sleep habits, called sleep logs, and gives you feedback, in the form of graphs, on whether you're making progress in addressing your sleep issues. It is meant to be a tool that people can use to help themselves, but it is also recommended that people use the app in conjunction with advice and guidance from their doctors. 

The Plex Sleep Scanner will integrate with the free MobileSleepDoc app so users can monitor their sleep reports right from their phone. 

Learn More About MobileSleepDoc Here.


What We Need & What You Get

We want to provide you with this opportunity to help fund and support this important project and allow you to be among the first to experience this life changing product. Please review the perks to see how your contribution can help lead you to better sleep and a healthier life. We value your feedback and hope you can provide us with your reviews of the Plex and MobileSleepDoc Pro App once you receive your personal sleep monitoring system.


The Impact

More than 40 million Americans have trouble getting a good night’s sleep, according the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Many choose the pharmacological route, leading to 58.5 million prescriptions issues in 2012, up 10% from 2007, according to IMS Health – a healthcare information firm.

Benefits of a good night's sleep:

According to the American Academy of Sleep Medicine, several studies conducted in recent years point to the following benefits of getting a regular good night’s sleep:

  • Men treating their sleep apnea with CPAP see improvement in their sexual function and satisfaction.

  • Better sleep will literally help you feel better. A recent study showed a link between more sleep and decreased sensitivity to pain.

  • Men with obstructive sleep apnea can reduce their blood pressure with treatment of the apnea.

  • Sleep-deprived teens may have increased resistance to insulin.

The Plex can help users reach their full healthy sleep potential!

Reasons why monitoring your sleep patterns is important (and these are just a handful!):

  1. We don't sleep the same way every night, so a single snapshot of your sleep may miss important information.
  2. If you were trying a program such as weight loss or side-sleeping, you could track improvements in your sleep patterns.
  3. If you decided to keep a regular schedule and make other changes in your bedtime routine, you could track your improvement in sleep efficiency and continuity.
  4. If your health status changed or you were started on new medications, you could monitor yourself for changes in sleep patterns.
  5. If you were already on a program for sleep such as CPAP or a dental device, you could check for stability over time.

Funding Allocation and Budget:

  • Plex manufacturing and design refinements 80%
  • Software engineering: user portal, server, and hardware integration 20%

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know anyone suffering from sleep issues, we want to urge you to please let them know about this new innovative way to improve their sleep and enhance their lives. 

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word
  • Email a link to this campaign to your friends, family members, co-workers, and doctors.

About Somnology

 = the scientific study of sleep

Somnology, Inc. is a business whose products focus on the monitoring of your sleep habits, in order for you to better understand your sleep patterns, and then make the necessary changes in order to optimize your sleep.

Mission Statement: Somnology, Inc. is dedicated to creating mobile, interactive solutions that empower you to get the best night’s sleep for your health and optimum performance.

Somnology, Inc. offers a family of devices, mobile and desktop applications, and clinical services all designed to achieve our mission in an integrated fashion.

Key points:

  1. Somnology products are developed by a practicing sleep specialist.
  2. The PlexTM Sleep Scanner uses medical-grade sensors.
  3. Data collected by the Plex Sleep Scanner are analyzed using proprietary algorithms to give users real answers about their sleep behaviors.
  4. The PlexTM Sleep Scanner is the only wearable device geared for people with both trouble sleeping as well as snoring and possible sleep apnea.
  5. Somnology products are designed for those seeking new information about their sleep, as well as for those who are already under treatment for a sleep problem.

Who We Are

Dr. Melissa Lim

Dr. Lim the is the Chief Medical Officer and Co-Founder of Somnology, Inc. She is a board-certified sleep specialist with her own busy private practice in Redwood City, CA. She is the Medical Director of Redwood Pulmonary Medical Associates and Redwood Sleep Center, Inc. She is the clinical architect of the internet-based sleep center management software now hosted in many sleep labs across the globe, called Sleep Workflow. She attended Ohio State University College of Medicine, completed her internship and residency at Boston City Hospital/Boston University, and conducted her fellowship training at Johns Hopkins Hospitals and the University of California, San Francisco. Realizing the magnitude of sleep problems worldwide, she created the first version of MobileSleepDoc Pro mobile app in 2012 as a tool to help not only her own patients, but for anyone with a smartphone who has trouble sleeping. A brand new version of the app was released in 2014, with continuous upgrades in store. After completing the design of the PlexTM Sleep Scanner wearable device in 2015, she joined forces with business leader Patrick Yam to create Somnology, Inc.

Patrick J. Yam

Patrick Yam is the CEO and Co-Founder of Somnology, Inc. He joined co-founder Dr. Melissa Lim in early 2015 to build a premier diagnostic medical device enterprise assisting a global population afflicted with sleep disorders. Prior to teaming with Dr. Lim he was the CEO of Sensei Partners LLC, a Menlo Park, CA based private investment firm. His 25+ year career includes responsibilities as a macro economist, financial and technology executive, investment banker and advisor, and Institutional Investor with significant experience in company-building—his main passion. He has been a senior advisor to two sovereign nations on innovation and, entrepreneurship. A professional speaker and published author, he teaches and lectures on entrepreneurship at Santa Clara University’s Leavey School of Business, where he is a Regent. Previously, he served as the first Dean’s Executive Professor of Entrepreneurship and was a former faculty member of the Venture Capital Institute. He is associated with the University of California, Santa Barbara, where, as a UC Trustee, he was a member of the investment committee as well as a senior director of the Economic Forecast Project and a senior adviser to Beacon Economics, a national economic consulting firm. He has been responsible as the Chief Executive Officer building and operating enterprises in the investment, financial and medical sectors. He received his MBA with distinction from Santa Clara University.

Dean Miller

Dean Miller is the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of Somnology, Inc. Dean has over 30 years’ experience in medical device development, and has led many successful projects and engineering teams throughout his career. He was the VP of Research and Development at Circadian, Inc., and the CTO of Decanus, LLC in Menlo Park, CA. Remarkably facile in understanding the intricacies of diverse engineering fields, Dean has provided expertise to multiple medical device manufacturers as an independent consultant. We are thrilled he has joined the executive team at Somnology, Inc. to oversee the development, regulatory pathway, and refinement of the PlexTM Sleep Scanner and our family of mobile sleep products.

story:
STIGMA KILLS: There we said it. Simple, aggressive, blunt and to the point. Hundreds of people, each and every month, will take their own lives while struggling with PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) and they do so quite simply because people treat them like "they are crazy" if they raise their hands and ask for support.

Why do I care? "In 2011/2012 four friends/acquaintances took their own lives. All were combat Marines, all were civilians for less than a year and all struggled with PTSD and transition to civilian life in general. Oh, and all four were under the age of 28. Their deaths hit me between the eyes, not so much that they were no longer with us, but more that they had survived multiple combat tours, but could not overcome the challenge of civilian life with PTSD. Being a British veteran who has struggled with my own PTSD, (I didn't even realize that until recently) and as someone who is lucky enough to call this great nation home, I felt that something had to be done. And here we are, 4 years later." - RJC 

PS This weekend we lost one of our own - RIP Art.

                                           

Why should you care? On one side - veterans and civilians alike, are trying to cope with PTSD. They are doing so despondent, self-medicated and alone, and all too often they end up killing themselves. On the other side - care givers with alternative treatment protocols, adaptive sports, healing camps, educational resources, buddy systems, and those who have learned to cope, are standing by to help...

                                               

The reality is, that these two demographics could not be further apart, and as long as the stigma associated with PTSD prevents those struggling with it from seeking help, we will continue to bury them.           

Unlike other life threatening challenges, (Cancer, ALS, Autism, Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s etc.) we don’t need to spend decades of time or billions of dollars to change the PTSD narrative. We can do it now for pennies on the dollar by focusing on prevention through education, while using today's technology, instead of waiting until more intensive treatments and emergency measures are needed.

These deaths,thousands each and every year, are for the most part, totally preventable if we can simply, and honestly, begin a dialogue with those who struggle with PTSD.

                    

What can we do about it? If given the opportunity, by those who struggle with PTSD, we have the ability to offer them a myriad of proven treatments and alternatives to today's "fix" of choice - prescription drugs. From alternative treatment protocols, adaptive sports, buddy and mentorship programs, the VA's Peer Support Counselors and Vet 2 Vet programs, there are many options.


What we will do with your seed money and funds to come.

1. Continue to develop the program, process and strategic plan

2. Apply for more (4 to date) national/regional foundation grants as a 501(C)(3)

3. Develop an Application Program Interface (API) to connect with the multi-million dollar Unite US community platform 

                                                                    

4. Manage national outreach and registration process for care givers as in anyone who provides non-pharmacological support for those struggling with PTSD

5. Begin a national outreach program to invite those struggling with PTSD to register onto our Unite US platform. Outreach through sports, media, TV, anywhere they live and play 

6. Connect those struggling with PTSD to those most qualified to advise, support, engage, mentor and teach them about the challenges of dealing with PTSD 

7. Design and develop a smart app. to provide instant access to support and information about PTSD. Positive push marketing – event updates – crisis line – text and social media connection to peers and support.

Note: Registration equates to non-invasive, highly confidential, identification of everyone involved in the "PTSD World". Veteran or Civilian. Struggling or Coping. Client or Care Giver. Worried about someone or have already lost someone. For us to be successful everyone must have a voice.

                                        

Picture a virtual community where those struggling with PTSD have unfettered access to educational support and direct links to those who can help them cope. In turn, picture a forum where those who understand PTSD and know how to help those who struggle with it, get to apply their skills and prevent yet another senseless suicide. It’s really not rocket science, we just need to use today’s technology a lot more effectively than we do to make it happen.

Our Measurements of success in 2015:

National web/cloud based PTS Community populated with 5000 unique registrations from people struggling with PTSD combined with proactive connections to appropriate support options. 250/750 care giver registrations from those most qualified to provide support, and educational services to those struggling with PTSD.

So please help us make 2015 the year we shift perceptions of PTSD from something to be ashamed of, to something we understand, accept and treat. Together, in 2015, we can #CarrytheChallenge and ensure #ZeroStigma for PTSD.

For more information, access to our case for support or program specific questions please REGISTER and join our PTSD centric community at:

                              www.CarryTheChallenge.org/Registration              

Ways You Can Help, in addition to “perking” today…

Educate yourself about PTSD, push back when people who struggle with PTSD are labeled crazy or angry.

Identify someone that you know who is struggling with PTSD. Let them know that asking for support is a sign of strength, not an inability to cope. Have them register

Encourage everyone to join our PTSD specific community. A community who will no longer tolerate suicide as an alternative to support. 

Advocate for those without a voice. Tell lawmakers, law enforcement, government representatives, medical professionals and leaders of industry that more understanding is a priority now. Individuals struggling with PTSD are relevant and should be embraced, not shunned or ignored.

Ways To Take Action Today...

Speak your support. Share the message: PTSD is a normal reaction to an abnormal situation. #CarrytheChallenge until we reach #ZeroStigma.

Wear your support. Wear the Bracelet or Carry the Coin – stimulate a conversation with a stranger about PTSD. 

Share Your Support. Share your support via social media. You’re on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn, so are we. Lets’ get the word out. #CarrytheChallenge #ZeroStigma #EndtheStigma  #SaveLives

Give Your Support. We simply can’t do it without you. Your donation today will help us increase our outreach and positively affect the lives of thousands who are struggling with a very understandable challenge.  

Challenge Yourself. Show your solidarity, stand out from the crowd and make a difference: Create your own project to #CarrytheChallenge

                       

                  Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress;                                                                  working together is success." Henry Ford

Thank you, thank you, for your time AND SUPPORT.

                            This initiative is managed by Veterans 360 Inc.                                                                            A San Diego based 501(C) (3) # 45-3713823
story_txt:
STIGMA
KILLS: There
we said it. Simple, aggressive, blunt and to the point. Hundreds of people,
each and every month, will take their own lives while struggling with PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) and
they do so quite simply because people treat them like "they are
crazy" if they raise their hands and ask for support.Why do I care? "In 2011/2012 four friends/acquaintances took their own lives. All were combat Marines, all were civilians for less than a year and all struggled with PTSD and transition to civilian life in general. Oh, and all four were under the age of 28. Their deaths hit me between the eyes, not so much that they were no longer with us, but more that they had survived multiple combat tours, but could not overcome the challenge of civilian life with PTSD. Being a British veteran who has struggled with my own PTSD, (I didn't even realize that until recently) and as someone who is lucky enough to call this great nation home, I felt that something had to be done. And here we are, 4 years later." - RJC PS This weekend we lost one of our own - RIP Art.                                           Why should you care? On one side -
veterans and civilians alike, are trying to cope with PTSD. They are doing so despondent, self-medicated and alone, and all too often they end up killing
themselves. On the other side - care givers with alternative treatment
protocols, adaptive sports, healing camps, educational resources, buddy systems,
and those who have learned to cope, are standing by to help...
                                               
The reality is, that these two
demographics could not be further apart, and as long as the stigma associated
with PTSD prevents those struggling with it from seeking help, we will continue
to bury them.           Unlike
other life threatening challenges,
(Cancer, ALS, Autism, Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s etc.) we don’t need to spend
decades of time or billions of dollars to change the PTSD narrative. We can do
it now for pennies on the dollar by focusing on prevention through education, while using today's technology, instead of waiting until more intensive treatments and emergency measures are
needed.These
deaths,thousands
each and every year, are for the most part, totally preventable if we can simply, and honestly,
begin a dialogue with those who struggle with PTSD.                    What can we do about it? If given the opportunity, by those who struggle with PTSD, we have the ability to offer them a myriad of proven treatments and alternatives to today's "fix" of choice - prescription drugs. From alternative treatment protocols, adaptive sports, buddy and mentorship programs, the VA's Peer Support Counselors and Vet 2 Vet programs, there are many options.What we will do with your seed money and funds to come.1. Continue to
develop the program, process and strategic plan
2. Apply for
more (4 to date) national/regional foundation grants as a 501(C)(3)
3. Develop an
Application Program Interface (API) to connect with the multi-million dollar Unite US
community platform                                                                     4. Manage national outreach and registration process for care givers as in anyone who provides non-pharmacological
support for those struggling with PTSD
5. Begin a national outreach
program to invite those struggling with PTSD to register onto our Unite US
platform. Outreach through sports, media, TV, anywhere they live and play 
6. Connect those struggling with PTSD to those most qualified to advise,
support, engage, mentor and teach them about the challenges of dealing with
PTSD 
7. Design and
develop a smart app. to provide instant access to support and information about
PTSD. Positive push marketing – event updates – crisis line – text and social
media connection to peers and support.
Note: Registration
equates to non-invasive, highly confidential, identification of everyone
involved in the "PTSD World". Veteran or Civilian. Struggling or
Coping. Client or Care Giver. Worried about someone or have already lost
someone. For us to be successful everyone must have a voice.                                        Picture a virtual community where those struggling with PTSD have
unfettered access to educational support and direct links to those who can help
them cope. In turn, picture a forum where those who understand PTSD and know how
to help those who struggle with it, get to apply their skills and prevent yet
another senseless suicide. It’s really not rocket science, we just need to use
today’s technology a lot more effectively than we do to make it happen.
Our Measurements of success in 2015:
National web/cloud based PTS Community populated with 5000 unique
registrations from people struggling with PTSD combined with proactive
connections to appropriate support options. 250/750 care
giver registrations from those most qualified to provide support, and
educational services to those struggling with PTSD.
So please help us make 2015 the year we shift perceptions of PTSD from
something to be ashamed of, to something we understand, accept and treat.
Together, in 2015, we can #CarrytheChallenge and ensure #ZeroStigma for PTSD.For more information, access to our case for
support or program specific questions please REGISTER and join our PTSD centric
community at:
                              www.CarryTheChallenge.org/Registration              Ways You Can Help, in addition to “perking” today…
Educate yourself about PTSD, push back when
people who struggle with PTSD are labeled crazy or angry.
Identify someone
that you know who is struggling with PTSD. Let them know that asking for support
is a sign of strength, not an inability to cope. Have them
register
Encourage everyone
to join our PTSD specific community. A community who will no longer tolerate
suicide as an alternative to support. 
Advocate for those without a voice. Tell
lawmakers, law enforcement, government representatives, medical professionals
and leaders of industry that more understanding is a priority now. Individuals struggling with PTSD are relevant and
should be embraced, not shunned or ignored.Ways To Take Action
Today...

your support. Share the message: PTSD is a normal reaction to an
abnormal situation. #CarrytheChallenge until we reach #ZeroStigma.
Wear

Bracelet or Carry the Coin – stimulate a conversation with a stranger about
PTSD. 
Share

Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn, so are we. Lets’ get the word out.
#CarrytheChallenge #ZeroStigma #EndtheStigma  #SaveLives
Give

today will help us increase our outreach and positively affect the lives of
thousands who are struggling with a very understandable challenge.  
Challenge
Yourself. Show your
solidarity, stand out from the crowd and make a difference: Create your own
project to #CarrytheChallenge                                         Coming
together is a beginning; keeping together is progress;                                                                  working together is
success." Henry FordThank you, thank you, for your time

story:
Foundation for 20 Bed Hospital in Bovarthana Billage in Coochbehari District,  WB, India

Situation Analysis:

Based on our study of the communities and the requests we received from the community organizations and the leadership, this community does not have a qualitative healthcare facility. There are several villages in this part of the world where people are driven by despair and sickness. Most of them are the victims of malnutrition. Many of them do not have any regular income; they live in the remote villages away from the mainstream of life. They depend upon the poor cultivation for their livelihood. There is no conveyance to reach certain areas; we have to walk miles to reach such areas to help them. During the monsoon, the people suffer with various diseases. Malaria, mostly Falciparum malaria, acute diarrhea, jaundice are the terrific killers of many people. Many die without proper medical assistance. These people are struggling for survival. It is a heart-breaking scene to witness that the relatives stand helpless with deep sigh while their dear ones die like flies.

The area where we would like to establish the hospital is surrounded by remote villages where poor & needy communities leading a hard life without having any proper medical facilities. 

Why Need this:

There are several villages in this part of our country where people have various sicknesses. Most of them are victims of malnutrition. Malaria, mostly Falciparum malaria and jaundice are the terrific killers of many people. Many die without any medical assistance even today. Many of them do not have any regular income; they live in the remote villages away from the mainstream of life. There is no proper conveyance to reach such areas. These people are struggling for survival. It is a heart-breaking scene to witness that the beloved ones stand helpless with deep sigh while their dear ones die like flies. We are unable to sort out this mess due to the lack of many things, but our doctors and health workers do their level best to reach out and help a few victims out of the dangerous condition. It is our prayer to God to enable us to do our maximum to treat them and bring them to the love and peace of our Savior. We are trying to obey the heart-beats of Jesus; once He told “I was hungry but you didn't give me food, I was sick but you didn't care me.

We are concentrating on the people groups living in the forest villages without any medical care. They lead a pitiable life; we can watch human beings live below the standard of animals. It is our humble request to your good selves, to introduce us to your friends or known medical organizations to contribute medicines, second hand clothing, and whatever ways someone help us to carry on with our vision in this particular field.

The above mentioned communities have a very high rate of communicable diseases. Governmental or non-governmental agencies have not met the healthcare needs of the communities. New Hope to the World having manifold philanthropic activities throughout India and its neighboring countries Bangladesh, Nepal and Bhutan. NHW have determined to take over this project by Faith to help these needy people groups.

We are specifically concentrating on the health-care of people groups living in Mathabanga, Sitalkuchi, Sitai & Dinhata blocks of Coochbehar district where no multi-specialty health care unit exists.

Our Objectives:

NHW’s objective in establishing healthcare facilities :

  • Out-Patient Treatment Center.

  • Trauma Center with Diagnostic equipment

  • Inpatient facility with Modern Medical treatment capabilities.

  • Preventive Medicines.

  • Hygienic Training for the general public.

  • Family Counseling.

  • De addiction Centers

  • Alcohol Counseling

  • HIV/AIDS Awareness Programs

Level of service delivery:

District/SD/RH/BPHC/PHC/SC/GP/others:

The level of delivery will start from village level to block level irrespective of race, creed, religion and economic status.

We have been informed that there is not any Multi-Specialty Hospital within a radius of 50 kilometers of Proposed Project. Most of the people in these areas are poor and needy so they can’t afford to go to the far away better hospitals.

Units::

  • General Health care

  • Hygienic Training & Counseling Center

  • In Patient Unit

  • Out Patient Unit

  • Causality

  • Medical Wards

  • Minor OT & Local anesthesia Unit

  • Psychiatric Department

  • Physiotherapy

  • Ultrasonography

  • Endoscopy

  • ECG Room

  • X-ray (300 Ma Unit-digital)

  • Dietary D.P.T.

  • Pharmacy

  • Linen Department

  • Counter –Admit and Discharging.

  • Reception/Registration

  • Laboratory

  • Nurses’ Room

  • Doctors’ Room

  • Waiting Hall

  • Prayer Room

Schedule Completion:

The construction of primary buildings with the installation of the Equipment - November 2015 to May 2016 (depends upon the Government Health department’s timely cooperation, the Purchase & the installation of the equipment.) Hopefully the health-care unit could commence from June 2016

Monitoring indicators to measure process and outcome:

  • Acquiring of Land – Done

  • Develop the land- On progress

  • Property wall- temporary wall has done

  • Water, sewer and electric underground lines- after construction of the building

  • Outpatient facility construction- yet to be done

  • Inpatient facility & cafeteria construction-yet to done

  • Living quarters construction- will be done very soon

  • Counseling centers- After Project Completion

  • Fitness center- After Project Completion

  • Chapel- After Project Completion

story:
Healing Touch Massage

In this day and age so many people need positive touch in their lives, and they aren't able to get it. Whether the limitations is because of funds, availability, or accessibility, I want to find was to take massage to the people who need it.

What We Need & What You Get

 I am trying to raise $5000 to get this business started. The money will go to initial start-up costs (a portable tent, massage table, chair and other necessities to make this campaign possible.)
Each contributor will receive a handmade postcard thanking you for your donation! 

The Impact

 People are stressed. Suicide rates are up, divorce rates are up, and depression is thriving. Massage can make a huge impact on these issues, as well as helping people relieve muscle pains, and aid in sport injury recovery.
Massage not only helps people physically, it provides a safe and nurturing space for emotion and spiritual development. Along with massage I do energy work and try to teach my clients about proper nutrition and exercise.  

Risks & Challenges

 I have always struggled with financial security, and your help in achieving this goal is so encouraging. I know that I am meant to help people heal through touch and unconditional love, but overcoming the financial obstacle to make it happen is the hardest part.

If you can't donate, please share my campaign so that others know about it and perhaps they can help me achieve my goal.


Aloha and thank you for your help and support!!!

story:
What We Are All About

GOLF is my passion. It is my goal to see more women and girls be exposed to the game of golf.  

In order to see my passion materialize, I have established The Maulana Dotch Golf Classic, a one-day golf tournament hosted Friday, April 21, 2017, at the Cedar Crest Golf Course in Dallas, Texas. This tournament is an opportunity to raise funds for Scholarship money for graduating seniors from the Cedar Crest junior program and the Center of Empowerment. 

As the 1st African American woman in Texas and 2nd African American woman in America to earn my Class A, PGA Membership and become a certified LPGA Teaching Professional, I strive to be an example for girls to fulfill their dreams as a golfer and/or PGA or LPGA Member. 

As the Head Golf Professional at Cedar Crest Golf Course, my goal is to bring golfers and golf enthusiast together to support this effort with the common bond of golf.  The field will be completely comprised of men and women from all backgrounds, industries and all skill levels of golf.  The Maulana Dotch Golf Classic invites everyone to a day of fun, networking and raising funds for this worthy cause.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help!

This is a great opportunity for you to support an exceptionally worthy cause.  I would invite you to be stakeholders in this community where young lives are challenge daily.  Your sponsorship of this program offers them an opportunity to participate in golf and opens doors beyond measure. 

For a $100 donation you will receive the same Swag Bag the golf participating will get. This bag will be full of goodies and gift from our sponsor. 

 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Help us by getting the word out and telling your friends and family to donate
      • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media sites

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, I'm Chetan Shivram and the founder of MOMOTRON. My passion for food and entrepreneurship led me to start off on a journey with small steps and gradually evolved into a thriving business. What started off as an idea, today, has become a reality with MOMOTRON having 4 retail outlets and the sole supplier of dumplings to all top notch resorts and residential schools in the Niligiris. Dumplings are also known as momos, hence the name MOMOTRON.
  • So why did we choose dumplings? Not many short eats or fast foods can actually be called healthy. Dumplings the world over are considered healthy specially because they are steamed. We are an established outfit and realize the health benefits of dumplings and we decided to make it available not to just the people in the locality but to people from all over the world. 
  • As we mentioned earlier, we supply to the top notch schools in the Niligiries, school that can afford to give their residential kids fresh steamed chicken and vegetable dumplings as a snack. On the other hand, there are a lot of schools that cannot afford these healthy bites, so with your contribution we could supply the less fortunate children at schools dumplings free of cost.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We want to start small as this is our first campaign and we have sent a goal of 5000 dollars and based on the perks, every contributor will be contributing to one plate (6 dumplings) that we will be donating to one of the under privilege  schools. We have identified 3 schools that have an average strength of 300 children each.  So our target is to have each child  get one plate of dumplings. Like these schools there are several other schools that cannot afford a healthy bite, The reason we choose these schools was because they are well below the poverty line and offers free education.
  • Well, lets get to the exciting part - the perks:
  • $5 gives you a photograph (postcard) of a child relishing a plate of dumpling that you have contributed towards with a personalized note of appreciation from the child.
  • $10 gives you an e-recipe book of how to make over 20 varieties of dumplings along with the previous perk.
  • $15 gives you a dumpling maker mould along with the previous perks.
  • $25 gives you an all-purpose steamer attachment to steam your dumplings along with your previous perks
  • $50 gives you 3 all- purpose steamer attachments and the previous perks.
  • $100 gives you a certificate from the school, 6 all-purpose steamer attachments, 6 dumpling maker moulds and 6 post cards.
  • $250-This is just a donation and you don't want anything in return. Let 50 kids enjoy a plate of dumplings each in your name.

Here is a chance to get to make and eat some of the healthiest food around town,  while  helping the less fortunate

Do forget...what goes around, comes around!!!! in India it is called KARMA

And for every contribution we receive from this campaign, we will match the same from our side. For example, for every plate of dumplings you donate we donate the same. By doing so, this helps, by distributing twice the quantity and helps to feed many more children.

Risks & Challenges

What if we do not achieve our goal??
Don't break a sweat, at the end of 60 day, we at Momotron, regardless of the contributions will still do our bit and give the under privileged a chance to eat healthy.
We will update the site with photographs when we go live with the project.

Other Ways You Can Help?

October 15, 2015 is when we will  freshly steam dumplings and distribute it to the under privileged children,  if any of you happen to be in the Niligiris during the promotion we could always use a helping hand.

We want to start small as this is our first campaign and we have sent a goal of 5000 dollars and based on the perks, every contributor will be contributing to one plate (6 dumplings) that we will be donating to one of the under privilege  schools. We have identified 3 schools that have an average strength of 300 children each.  So our target is to have each child  get one plate of dumplings. Like these schools there are several other schools that cannot afford a healthy bite, The reason we choose these schools was because they are well below the poverty line and offers free education.
Well, lets get to the exciting part - the perks:
$5 gives you a photograph (postcard) of a child relishing a plate of dumpling that you have contributed towards with a personalized note of appreciation from the child.
$10 gives you an e-recipe book of how to make over 20 varieties of dumplings along with the previous perk.
$15 gives you a dumpling maker mould along with the previous perks.
$25 gives you an all-purpose steamer attachment to steam your dumplings along with your previous perks
$50 gives you 3 all- purpose steamer attachments and the previous perks.
$100 gives you a certificate from the school, 6 all-purpose steamer attachments, 6 dumpling maker moulds and 6 post cards.
$250-This is just a donation and you don't want anything in return. Let 50 kids enjoy a plate of dumplings each in your name.    Here is a chance to get to make and eat some of the healthiest food around town,  while  helping the less fortunate
Do forget...what goes around, comes around!!!! in India it is called KARMA
And for every contribution we receive from this campaign, we will match the same from our side. For example, for every plate of dumplings you donate we donate the same. By doing so, this helps, by distributing twice the quantity and helps to feed many more children.
Risks & Challenges

What if we do not achieve our goal??
Don't break a sweat, at the end of 60 day, we at Momotron, regardless of the contributions will still do our bit and give the under privileged a chance to eat healthy.
We will update the site with photographs when we go live with the project.
 Other Ways You Can Help?
October 15, 2015 is when we will  freshly steam dumplings and distribute it to the under privileged children,  if any of you happen to be in the Niligiris during the promotion we could always use a helping hand.

story:
WHAT WE DO:

For 6 years Volunteers Without Limits has served the San Felipe community and currently serves 26 disabled children and 11 disabled adults. We are the only organization in the community that provides much needed services for the families. There are no government support programs. We provide diapers, Ensure, food, wheelchairs, walkers, crutches, canes and help with medications, Dr. visits, lab tests, therapies, and transportation to exams 2 hours away. There is no childcare available for a single mom with a disabled child so working is extremely difficult provided they can even find work. If a mom is employed the average wage would be approximately $75 per week.  Some anti-convulsion medications are as high as $200 per month. They NEED our help.

THE INSPIRATION BEHIND VOLUNTEERS WITHOUT LIMITS

Paty Orozco (our President) had a dream a month before her daughter was born. In her dream she was surrounded by people with disabilities and she was helping them. The dream upset her a lot. Paty did not have much exposure to people with disabilities and she didn’t know what to make of the dream. A month later her beautiful daughter Lupita was born. Lupita is diagnosed with Cerebral Palsy and Hydrocephalus.

Paty quickly learned there was no help for families with disabilities so she decided to help her daughter and other families with disabled children in any way she could. She started out with her friends selling tamales and sodas on street corners to raise money.

Volunteers Without Limits also operates a small thrift store which offers very inexpensive clothes and household items to those that can afford them. For those that cannot afford them, we provide clothes, shoes, jackets, blankets, fans, beds and/or whatever we can to help those in need in the  community. 



KO HAMBRE (Knock Out Hunger) - Volunteers Without Limits also hosts the KO Hambre program and currently cooks and delivers food to approximately 100 homebound people each day Mon-Fri and serve about 10-12 people off the street. For most, this is their only meal of the day. We deliver to the elderly, disabled, sick, and single mothers with small children. It is our version of Meals on Wheels. Down here it is different than in the states. We don't have companies and grocery stores etc. that donate food. We have to purchase our food from a wholesale distributor. The KO was chosen in memory of Kuchy Sanchez and Olivia Valdez who tirelessly helped so many people in the community.

 




Please visit our galleries here, on our FB page and our website to see more of what we do!

Volunteers Without Limits

is seeking $48,800

$1500 x 12 months = $18,000 to be used to continue to buy food and deliver 26,000 meals to the homebound.

$900 x 12 months = $10,800 = 1 year of operational costs (rent, electric, gas, phone, water, propane)

$10,000 to purchase a dependable, reliable and more efficient enclosed delivery vehicle. This will help ensure the quality and safety of the food and will also help us to pick up donated items and provide other transportation.

$10,000 for kitchen equipment (range, exhaust hood, freezer, work tables and shelving)


                                                                      OUR HISTORY


VSL/VWL is a Mexico registered Asociacion Civil (non-profit) located in San Felipe, Baja California, Mexico. We originally started in 2009 as Paso a Pasito (an organization to help disabled children and their families) and took over the San Felipe Food Bank A.C.  and brought both organizations together to form Voluntarios Sin Limites. Volunteers Without Limits has a Mexican President - Paty Orozco and a Mexican board. There are several Americans and Canadians that are mentors, facilitators, and volunteers and are heavily involved in the organization.

Our organization is volunteer and donation based. We have no administrative salaries and our operational costs (rent, electric, propane, gas, phone etc) is paid for out of donations we receive. Our operational costs are approximately $900 per month. 

San Felipe is a small fishing village located two hours south of the California border. In 2003-2008 San Felipe was becoming a booming tourist and development area. In 2008 when the economic problems hit in the U.S., we got hit hard in San Felipe. Tourism and development virtually stopped and a lot of people were left with little or no work. Even with work, the minimum wage in Mexico is less than $6 a day.

This year, in order to save the Vaquita (the worlds smallest porpoise) from extinction, the government has implemented a 2 year fishing ban in the area (only place the Vaquita exists in the world) which left more than 1000 families without work. Some were compensated by the government but there are still about 600 families affected!

 

THE IMPACT OF YOUR DONATIONS ON THE COMMUNITY!

As I mentioned above, our community is hurting. The elderly and disabled are really forgotten. In a lot of cases the meal that we provide will be the only food they have to eat that day. We currently have a waiting list for people who need food but we just do not have the funds to provide them with meals.

Having the kitchen equipment will give us the ability to provide even more meals as we grow and give us the ability to prepare the meals safely and efficiently.

Our current delivery vehicle is a 1990 1 ton Toyota flatbed dually. It has seen better days. This summer it has been 110 degrees with high humidity at different times and we are driving around for 3 hours with food bouncing around in the back of the truck. We need to eliminate the health risks of that. Plus, having a van will give us the ability to pick up donations in the U.S when necessary. We currently have diapers, wheelchairs, food, clothes etc. in different places and we need to be able to go get them or we lose them.

Someone wise once said “Feed the hungry, clothe the poor and visit the sick”! We are here to serve!


OUR FUTURE VISION:

  1. Create childcare and job opportunities for the parents of disabled children

  2. We currently had the equipment donated to open a juice/smoothie bar to help us become more self-supporting and sustainable. We hope to get to a point where we can provide fresh juices to the elderly and disabled to provide a better nutritional option than chemically laden nutritional drinks.

  3. Create a community garden large enough to provide food for the kitchen, the juice bar and to teach the community sustainable gardening skills.

  4. Create a safe house for new mothers with disabled children to provide support to help with the challenging first year.

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO VISIT OUR CAMPAIGN. PLEASE SHARE IT WITH ANYONE AND EVERYONE YOU CAN. WE NEVER KNOW WHO IS GOING TO BE ABLE TO HELP! THANK YOU AGAIN IN ADVANCE!

story:
A high-level donor has offered to match all donations received during our campaign! Read the boxes to the right for examples of what your donation can help us achieve together.*

Dental Care for Every Person In Central and South America:

When dentists examined six-year-old Maria’s mouth, they found cavities in almost all of her teeth. She was in so much pain that eating was difficult. Sadly, Maria’s situation is common to many children living in Central and South American countries.

Like Nicaragua, for instance, where 85% of kids between the ages of two and five suffer from permanent tooth damage, and 88% are at risk of losing their first molar as early as age eight.

Lack of dental care in Nicaragua is more than a toothache for most. Losing permanent teeth lowers children's’ self-esteem and their chances of finding employment. Most employers won’t hire people with nontraditional smiles for public-facing careers.



Which is a problem since nearly 48% of Nicaraguans have never seen a dentist.

But thanks to Engineering Smiles, hope is on the horizon.

Engineering Smiles has the solution:


We are a passionate team of five undergraduate engineering and architecture design students at Arizona State University that’s designing and building a low-cost, state-of-the-art mobile dental clinic.

We plan to donate the clinic to IMAHelps so that the nonprofit can expand its dental care services to Nicaragua. Our plan will enable volunteers to see more patients like Maria and provide a higher level of care to countless others just like her.

The clinic will be based at UNICA, a private dental school in Managua, Nicaragua, where it will be used to train the next generation of dental students who will embark on future IMAHelps missions and provide dental services to Nicaragua’s poor.

Will you help us put our plan into action?

We have reached the most critical stage of our project: design finalization and fundraising. In order to complete our tireless work and deliver the dental clinic on time for the IMAHelps mission to Matagalpa, Nicaragua in July 2016, we need your help!

Currently, we are collecting material donations of dental equipment and interior furnishings. We need you to help us buy the trailer and collect in-kind donations.

By donating, you’ll help us bring our mobile dental clinic to Nicaragua in time for next summer’s mission and help give the people of Nicaragua - namely children - the dental care they so desperately need.

A high-level donor has offered to match all donations we receive during our campaign. Read the boxes to the right for examples of what your donation can help us achieve together.*

Change the lives of those in need, donate today to save a smile!

*Your gift in support of the Engineering Smiles project will be considered a charitable contribution and qualifies for significant tax advantages. All funds will be deposited with IMAHelps (Reference: Engineering Smiles), a 501(c)3 I.R.S. non-profit organization/ Tax I.D. 83-0349334.


Be sure to follow us on facebook: www,facebook,com/engineeringsmiles
Check out our website for more info: www.engineeringsmiles.org

**Photos by Mailyn Chung
