story:
KITE 4 WATER

The Kite 4 Water team is taking the first step for the kiteboarding industry to bring clean water access to people all around the world.  

Our mission is simple: bring clean water access to every single person that needs it.  Our campaign involves identifying communities world-wide that need clean water, traveling to these regions that are in need, connecting with community leaders to distribute water filters, and educating the communities on filter uses and functionality.  We will also be documenting every trip to share each community's story and the life-changing impact that these filters have.

Donations & sponsorships go directly to purchase & distribution of filters. 



Clean water project: NEPAL UPDATE

Our clean water ambassador Khris Loux is currently in Nepal building septic tanks, toilets, clean water filtration systems, and helping to educated people on proper hygiene in the aftermath of natural disasters.

  • 1) The government pumps water but does NOT purify, so the water is not safe. (This is why our filter systems are so important.)

    2) The earthquake destroyed or severely damaged 600k homes and 5k public buildings.

    3) Displaced people are living under tarps, in man-made temporary housing and have no toilets or running water.

    4) The result is open defecation which leaches into the ground water creating high probabilities of outbreak of disease.

    5) Prior to the earthquake 10,500+ children where dying EVERY YEAR from diarrhea, caused by contaminated water.  (Preventable with the filtration systems.) The risk of this number greatly increasing this year is very real.

    7) Compounding the problem is the blockaded of fuel by India two months ago. (India is reacting to Nepal's recent Constitution.)

    8) Fact from Nepal Progress Report: 50% of population, 16m people, practices open defecation, 80% of communicable diseases are a result of contaminated water.

    9) We are working on a project to install 700 toilets in the next 90 days (the national goal is 148,000 toilets per year).

    10) Installing toilets AND providing purified water is a two prong solution... Remove the disease carrying waste from the water supply and provide filtered water to wash hands and drink.

    11) The third prong is education as we build there toilets... Only 30% of the population washed hands after defication and only 12% use soap.

Over 600 toilets have been built already. We can go back to this installed base immediately to install water filters.

It's difficult to describe how life saving these filters are... Anything you can get will save lives, NOW.  


There are so many seemingly unsolvable problems in the world, but clean water is not one of them. More on our project at www.kite4water.org


Photos from Nepal.


We have been working with other organizations that have already brought millions clean water access (YES millions)  in just the past few years, using the same techniques that we are implementing.  

Each filter brings 100 people clean water for 5+ years.  This means that on a single trip we need to transfer only two hundred filters to bring over 20,000 people clean water access.  

Our first goal is to get clean water access to 1,000,000 people and rally the entire industry to take advanced portable water filtration systems when traveling. We can do this in 2016, with your help!

SAWYER FILTERS
Other NGOs have distributed clean water for 8,000,000 people and counting.
We were inspired by Sawyer filters and the organizations they work with.  These are small teams of amazing individuals bringing millions of people around the world access to clean water in only a few short years.  

We are the first group to replicate what they have started, and we will not be the last. 

As we begin our work in Central America this winter, we will make powerful video documentaries that will inspire thousands of traveling kiteboarders and surfers to join the cause. 

Every location we travel to, we will also be meeting with kiteboarding and surfing schools to help us promote this amazing cause and expand our network, making it easier for travelers to distribute the clean water systems. 

 Co-Founders of Kite4Water.org, Scott Gordon and Jeff Kafka, have traveled the world surfing and kiteboarding their entire lives, and now want to use those skills and network of locals in each region of the world to raise money and awareness to bring millions of people clean water. 

1 filtration system is only $50, and brings 100 people clean water everyday for FIVE YEARS or more.  That's 50 cents to bring 1 person clean water for 5 years+. 

These advanced filters have a removal rate of 99.99999% for bacteria which cause Cholera, Botulism,Typhoid, Ameobic Dysentery, E. Coli, Coliform Bacteia, Streptococus, Salmonella, and much more. 

Children and elderly are the most susceptible to these illnesses. 

760,000 children under the age of 5 died last year due to Diarrheal infections, and almost all of them could have been prevented. This is senseless death.  Millions of people travel the globe for pleasure, and they could be helping to provide clean water access to communities in need (from the WHO website).



RAISING MONEY

Donate filters
They best way to help our project is to donate a filter or ten! 
For every filter donated, you are brining 100 people clean water for five years+.
Every single donation makes a difference, for every 50 cents, 1 person will receive clean water for 5 years+. 

We will e-mail you a gift certificate immediately upon your donation/ purchase (before the fundraiser ends).

You can donate in someone else's name if you want to give this as a gift for the holidays!


Apparel
Proceeds go to purchase filtration systems and support our upcoming trips. 
Help us spread this amazing cause, wear your limited edition T-shirt or sweatshirt with pride. 




Kiteboarding excursions
We want to inspire you to contribute to the communities that we all enjoy traveling to. 
The goal is to take as many water filtration systems as possible to the remote areas of the world + we kitesurf while we bring people the basic necessities for life. 

Never before in history has someone sold kiteboarding camps & lessons to raise money for water filters.  We don't only want to take these trips, we want to inspire others in the industry to do the same. 

If we don't reach our goal, it just means we don't take as many filters on each trip.  We are going on these trips no matter what!

Kiteboarding lessons
We will use kiteboarding lesson in the San Francisco area to raise money and also awareness to this great cause.  

Through our kiteboarding schools we will offer DISCOUNTED lessons AND donate a filter for every lesson sold.  Early bird specials will be limited so get yours today before they run out! 


IMPACT & DOCUMENTARIES 

Not only are we going to take filtration systems on every trip, we are also going to make a documentary of the trip and film everything from delivering the filters, surfing, and kiteboarding.  
The idea is inspire people to travel with purpose, and change their mindset about how they travel. You don't have to drop everything and join the peace corps, do what you love and help along the way. This is people helping people.
We are going to take the kiteboarding industry by storm, and show people how they CAN make a difference!

Imagine if we inspire 1000 kiteboarders & surfers to take only 5 water filters to Central America (or anywhere in the world for that matter) in 2016.  That is clean water for 500,000 people!  This is a tangible goal.

Another long-term goal is to network Kiteboarding schools and leaders in the industry all over the world to join this powerful initiative. 


CAN'T DONATE? 

If you can't financially help our cause, then at least share it with someone who might be able to. 

You might be one click away from educating someone close to you or saving someone's life if they decide to support our cause.


STORIES
RISKS & CHALLENGES

Our biggest challenge is to find leaders in each community, and empower them to educate their community, help distribute the filters to those that need them most, and maintain the filter systems.

The goal is to enter and exit communities mindfully, respect their culture, and help where it is needed.  We want to listen to the people in each community, not push something that people don't want or need.

“Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.” -RFK



Technology that is changing the world

1 filter = clean water for 100 people for 5 years

This is as simple as it gets. There is no more digging wells if there is a water source, no constructing sand filters and no more chemicals to purify water. People are able to construct and adapt their filter in literally minutes to any buckets you can find almost anywhere in the world. 

  1. Obtain a clean bucket or plastic container
  2. Use the hole cutter to drill a hole 1.5 inches from the bottom of the bucket (you can do this by hand).
  3. Screw the connector, hose and filter onto the bucket.
  4. Fill the bucket with water from any source, lower the filter head below the water line, and let gravity do the rest.

Filtration Rates

At 0.1 micron absolute, it is impossible for any bacteria, protozoa or cysts to pass through the filter. 

The technology was derived from kidney dialysis, Sawyer worked with a fiber manufacturer to actually adapt the hollow fiber membrane technology for water filtration. In order to improve both the filtration rates and longevity of the filter, they needed something even more precise and durable. The fiber composition had to deliver exactly 0.1 micron filtration 100% of the time to ensure no bacteria would get through, and the membranes had to be sturdy enough to withstand backwashing which allows the filter to be cleaning and reused.  This is how these filtration systems last for 5 years+. 

Fast Flow

Since there is such a high flow rate, the need to store water is eliminated, which reduces the chances of water being contaminated after it is filtered. The only energy required for the system to function is GRAVITY. The flow rate of a filter is determined by a combination of:

  • Head pressure (The distance from the top of the water to the filter)
  • Altitude (The higher the altitude, the slower the flow rate)
  • How clean the filter is
  • The filter itself (there are slight variations between filters)

Longest Lasting Filter

When the filter starts to slow down, you simply back wash it with clean water using the syringe provided in the kit OR a plastic bottle. Since the filters can repeatedly be back-washed and re-used, they have an extremely long life. The ease of operating this system makes it self-sustainable and dependable.

Sanitation

These filters and purifiers are so efficient and accessible that people will not only use the water for drinking, but also for cleaning, bathing, cooking, watering plants and more. 

Natural Disasters

The bucket system is a perfect tool for aid in natural disasters. This system would eliminate the need to ship bottled water, and will last long after disaster relief has run out. 

Community filters are $50 (not including shipping) and will provide enough clean water for 100 people per day. If maintained properly, they will last for many years.
story_txt:
KITE
4 WATER

The
Kite 4 Water team is taking the first step for the kiteboarding
industry to bring clean water access to people all around the world.
 

Our
mission is simple: bring clean water access to every single
person that needs it.  Our campaign involves identifying
communities world-wide that need clean water, traveling to these
regions that are in need, connecting with community leaders to
distribute water filters, and educating the communities on filter
uses and functionality.  We will also be documenting every
trip to share each community's story and the life-changing impact
that these filters have.
Donations & sponsorships go directly to purchase & distribution of filters. 






Clean
water project: NEPAL UPDATE

Our
clean water ambassador Khris Loux is currently in Nepal building
septic tanks, toilets, clean water filtration systems, and helping to
educated people on proper hygiene in the aftermath of natural
disasters.



	1)
	The government pumps water but does NOT purify, so the water is not
	safe. (This is why our filter systems are so important.)

	2)
	The earthquake destroyed or severely damaged 600k homes and 5k
	public buildings.

	3)
	Displaced people are living under tarps, in man-made temporary
	housing and have no toilets or running water.

	4)
	The result is open defecation which leaches into the ground water
	creating high probabilities of outbreak of disease.

	5)
	Prior to the earthquake 10,500+ children where dying EVERY YEAR from
	diarrhea, caused by contaminated water.  (Preventable with the
	filtration systems.) The risk of this number greatly increasing
	this year is very real.

	7)
	Compounding the problem is the blockaded of fuel by India two months
	ago. (India is reacting to Nepal's recent Constitution.)

	8)
	Fact from Nepal Progress Report: 50% of population, 16m people,
	practices open defecation, 80% of communicable diseases are a result
	of contaminated water.

	9)
	We are working on a project to install 700 toilets in the next 90
	days (the national goal is 148,000 toilets per year).

	10)
	Installing toilets AND providing purified water is a two prong
	solution... Remove the disease carrying waste from the water supply
	and provide filtered water to wash hands and drink.

	11)
	The third prong is education as we build there toilets... Only 30%
	of the population washed hands after defication and only 12% use
	soap. 
	





Over
600 toilets have been built already. We can go back to this installed
base immediately to install water filters. 


It's
difficult to describe how life saving these filters are... Anything
you can get will save lives, NOW.  

There are so many seemingly unsolvable problems in the world, but clean water is not one of them. More on our project at www.kite4water.org

Photos from Nepal.








We have been working with other organizations that have already brought millions clean water access (YES millions)  in just the past few years, using the same techniques that we are implementing.  
Each filter brings 100 people clean water for 5+ years.  This means that on a single trip we need to transfer only two hundred filters to bring over 20,000 people clean water access.  


Our first goal is to get clean water access to 1,000,000 people and rally the entire industry to take advanced portable water filtration systems when traveling. We can do this in 2016, with your help!



SAWYER FILTERS

Other NGOs have distributed clean water for 8,000,000 people and counting.

We were inspired by Sawyer filters and the organizations they work with.  These are small teams of amazing individuals bringing millions of people around the world access to clean water in only a few short years.  



We are the first group to replicate what they have started, and we will not be the last. 


As we begin our work in Central America this winter, we will make powerful video documentaries that will inspire thousands of traveling kiteboarders and surfers to join the cause. 
Every location we travel to, we will also be meeting with kiteboarding and surfing schools to help us promote this amazing cause and expand our network, making it easier for travelers to distribute the clean water systems. 

Co-Founders of Kite4Water.org, Scott Gordon and Jeff Kafka, have traveled the world surfing and kiteboarding their entire lives, and now want to use those skills and network of locals in each region of the world to raise money and awareness to bring millions of people clean water. 


1 filtration system is only $50, and brings 100 people clean water everyday for FIVE YEARS or more.  That's 50 cents to bring 1 person clean water for 5 years+. These advanced filters have a removal rate of 99.99999% for bacteria which cause Cholera, Botulism,Typhoid, Ameobic Dysentery, E. Coli, Coliform Bacteia, Streptococus, Salmonella, and much more. 
Children and elderly are the most susceptible to these illnesses. 
760,000 children under the age of 5 died last year due to Diarrheal infections, and almost all of them could have been prevented. This is senseless death.  Millions of people travel the globe for pleasure, and they could be helping to provide clean water access to communities in need (from the WHO website).RAISING MONEYDonate filtersThey best way to help our project is to donate a filter or ten! 

For every filter donated, you are brining 100 people clean water for five years+.
Every single donation makes a difference, for every 50 cents, 1 person will receive clean water for 5 years+. We will e-mail you a gift certificate immediately upon your donation/ purchase (before the fundraiser ends).
You can donate in someone else's name if you want to give this as a gift for the holidays!


ApparelProceeds go to purchase filtration systems and support our upcoming trips. Help us spread this amazing cause, wear your limited edition T-shirt or sweatshirt with pride. 



Kiteboarding excursionsWe want to inspire you to contribute to the communities that we all enjoy traveling to. 

The goal is to take as many water filtration systems as possible to the remote areas of the world + we kitesurf while we bring people the basic necessities for life. Never before in history has someone sold kiteboarding camps & lessons to raise money for water filters.  We don't only want to take these trips, we want to inspire others in the industry to do the same. If we don't reach our goal, it just means we don't take as many filters on each trip.  We are going on these trips no matter what!Kiteboarding lessonsWe will use kiteboarding lesson in the San Francisco area to raise money and also awareness to this great cause.  Through our kiteboarding schools we will offer DISCOUNTED lessons AND donate a filter for every lesson sold.  Early bird specials will be limited so get yours today before they run out! 

IMPACT & DOCUMENTARIES Not only are we going to take filtration systems on every trip, we are also going to make a documentary of the trip and film everything from delivering the filters, surfing, and kiteboarding.  

The idea is inspire people to travel with purpose, and change their mindset about how they travel. You don't have to drop everything and join the peace corps, do what you love and help along the way. This is people helping people.
We are going to take the kiteboarding industry by storm, and show people how they CAN make a difference!
Imagine if we inspire 1000 kiteboarders & surfers to take only 5 water filters to Central America (or anywhere in the world for that matter) in 2016.  That is clean water for 500,000 people!  This is a tangible goal.Another long-term goal is to network Kiteboarding schools and leaders in the industry all over the world to join this powerful initiative. 
CAN'T DONATE? 
If you can't financially help our cause, then at least share it with someone who might be able to. 
You might be one click away from educating someone close to you or saving someone's life if they decide to support our cause.STORIES


RISKS & CHALLENGESOur biggest challenge is to find leaders in each community, and empower them to educate their community, help distribute the filters to those that need them most, and maintain the filter systems.The goal is to enter and exit communities mindfully, respect their culture, and help where it is needed.  We want to listen to the people in each community, not push something that people don't want or need.

“Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.” -RFK
Technology that is changing the world
1 filter = clean water for 100 people for 5 years
This is as simple as it gets. There is no more digging wells if there is a water source, no constructing sand filters and no more chemicals to purify water. People are able to construct and adapt their filter in literally minutes to any buckets you can find almost anywhere in the world. 

Obtain a clean bucket or plastic container
Use the hole cutter to drill a hole 1.5 inches from the bottom of the bucket (you can do this by hand).
Screw the connector, hose and filter onto the bucket.
Fill the bucket with water from any source, lower the filter head below the water line, and let gravity do the rest.


Filtration Rates
At 0.1 micron absolute, it is impossible for any bacteria, protozoa or cysts to pass through the filter. 
The technology was derived from kidney dialysis, Sawyer worked with a fiber manufacturer to actually adapt the hollow fiber membrane technology for water filtration. In order to improve both the filtration rates and longevity of the filter, they needed something even more precise and durable. The fiber composition had to deliver exactly 0.1 micron filtration 100% of the time to ensure no bacteria would get through, and the membranes had to be sturdy enough to withstand backwashing which allows the filter to be cleaning and reused.  This is how these filtration systems last for 5 years+. 
Fast Flow
Since there is such a high flow rate, the need to store water is eliminated, which reduces the chances of water being contaminated after it is filtered. The only energy required for the system to function is GRAVITY. The flow rate of a filter is determined by a combination of:

Head pressure (The distance from the top of the water to the filter)
Altitude (The higher the altitude, the slower the flow rate)
How clean the filter is
The filter itself (there are slight variations between filters)

Longest Lasting Filter
When the filter starts to slow down, you simply back wash it with clean water using the syringe provided in the kit OR a plastic bottle. Since the filters can repeatedly be back-washed and re-used, they have an extremely long life. The ease of operating this system makes it self-sustainable and dependable.
Sanitation
These filters and purifiers are so efficient and accessible that people will not only use the water for drinking, but also for cleaning, bathing, cooking, watering plants and more. 
Natural Disasters
The bucket system is a perfect tool for aid in natural disasters. This system would eliminate the need to ship bottled water, and will last long after disaster relief has run out. 
Community filters are $50 (not including shipping) and will provide enough clean water for 100 people per day. If maintained properly, they will last for many years.

story:
MY STORY...

I am a figurative artist and a former athlete who has become a sports performance trainer for the last 25 plus years. My clients range from high schoolers to collegiates to the members of the NFL, MLB, NBA and even the Olympics. I also have experience as a designer, in retail sales, team management, product tester, R&D, and for a wearable computer company (Xybernaut), where I conceived, designed, sourced and manufactured products from conception to completion using both domestic and foreign manufacturing companies. www.thecorefacility.com is how to find out more about who I am.

WHY EVO? AND WHO IS IT FOR?

Because there is an easier and better way to develop superior athletic strength, speed, performance and a healthier and stronger overall body without adding more time in the Gym. This garment was designed primarily for the athlete and to address the overdevelopment of certain areas of the body due to improper training or unrecognized imbalances. It was designed to mitigate injury by addressing parts of the body that are missed or cannot be adequately developed unless the individual is in the motion of their activity. The EVO suit is akin to training in an atmosphere with higher gravity but a gravity that can be increased ever so slightly so that the body and most importantly, the connective tissues can grow without compounding damage. It mimics body development the way we were meant to gain strength or lose weight, Incrementally. This development is accomplished gradually by ounces, which eventually turn to pounds. The best thing about the EVO garment is that an athlete can wear this garment while doing the sport or activity they play and have no restrictions in movement! This ability allows for TRUE functional and SPORT SPECIFIC muscle and connective tissue development! The EVO weighted compression suit, this is the answer to better performance!  

Though it's initial design was based on increasing the functional development of the athlete, people of ALL ages from the athlete to the fitness enthusiast to the everyday man and woman to grandma and granddad can benefit from the EVO. It's for everyone who wants to get healthier, stronger, faster, fitter, or to just lose some weight in less time and without so much strain on the joints. With the EVO compression wear and its graduated weight cells, its antibacterial and UV protecting fabric that wicks away sweat, it  will allow all of your everyday movements to burn more calories and work the entire body throughout the day. You can wear it under your clothes and gain strength and lose weight as you go through your daily routine. It's a game-changer!

It's great for our senior generation, to aid in building muscle as they walk, shop or do any activity. Every step you take becomes a workout. The fitness enthusiast or the amature or professional athlete can actually grow faster and stronger while doing the sport or activity they love.

EVO also has HEALTH and recovery related properties. EVO is a true compression garment that aids in alleviating fatigue. An added bonus to this invention is that the cells can be heated or cooled and re-inserted into the garment to cool or heat an area after training. (I am currently looking into providing separate cells for this purpose so they can be ready directly after training)

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELPS

Your support enables us to find the right manufacturers with the ability needed to bring this product to market and into your hands. Components such as the weight cells, the gloves, socks and head wear must also be produced to fully compliment the project. There are many parts to the EVO bodywear and sourcing each component takes time and funding. You will be providing the means to creating the final look and feel of the fabric and it's cell placements. Your support will aid in realizing production capacity, help ascertain and reduce lead times and fund the overall development of this new revolutionary product.  

Your contribution is greatly appreciated and I look forward to showing you how amazing this product truly is.

EXCLUSIVE EVO T-SHIRT PERK

FRONT

BACK

BRACELET


TIMELINE to EVO

  • 2008- IDEA (Life got crazy)
  • -
  • 2012 - Poor man's patent 
  • -
  • 2013 -Testing of the first prototype - Conventional tights with typical weighted metal plates - Not good enough, too thin and loose.
  • -
  • Late 2013 - Found true compression tights and the right fabric. - Heck of a time finding anyone to sew zippers into this thing! - No one capable of sewing in sleeve pockets or anything else.
  • -
  • Early 2014 - Testing continues on compression tights with a new revolutionary idea, use lighter, flexible weighted cells that increase by ounces - Found another option on how to adhere the weights to the fabric so they stay where they should for testing.
  • -
  • 2014 - Registered provisional patent - Continue to look for capable manufacturers - All potential companies with possible facilities to make the garment are over capacity with orders or cannot do the project because of it's "difficulty" - Found possible sources but i must visit the factories to make sure they can do this - funds run out. 
  • - 
  • Early 2015- found out about crowdfunding - Getting things together.
  • -
  • July- August 2015 - Crowdfunding Launch :)
  • -
  • September- October 2015 - Visit and finalize relationships with manufacturers and get the completed first product/version in hand for last testing phase. 
  • -
  • October - November 2015 - First sample testing complete and logistics of delivery and packaging are ready for full scale production.
  • -
  • January 2016 - Manufacture 
  • -
  • February - March 2016 - First deliveries :)

PATENTED TECH

One of the biggest problems projects face is project-killing IP issues. That's why EVO has already filed a provisional patent.

       

Some prototype testing

As you can see in these photos and video’s, working prototypes have been tested for flexibility and ease of natural movement. You can be sure that when you receive EVO, it will perform!

DELIVERY.

No one wants to wait longer than they have to. Which is why FED-EX and or UPS will be our prefered delivery methods, so your perks get to you on time.

KEEPING YOU IN THE LOOP.

I appreciate the community's involvement in this project and as a backer, you'll be informed of every step of our journey—from manufacturing to fulfillment—through social media, and my Indiegogo campaign page. And as always, feel free to ask anything by email at thecorefacility@gmail.com

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The inherent risks related to large-scale production of a new patented product of this type, are significantly reduced because of our products proven and tested base layer which is a compression garment. All components to EVO are existing components, they are being arranged and adjusted in a manner never done before. I am confident that it's all fully attainable. After all, I put it together myself without the skills of the professionals who do this daily. Though I am providing a brand new innovation in strength development, I am extremely optimistic that with your support and patience, I can deliver a product which will provide a new experience for all Indiegogo backers!

WHY THE NAME EVO?

The EVO is an abbreviation of both Evolution and Revolution, because EVO is both revolutionary in its concept and is an evolution of the current weighted garments. Also, EVO will evolve to more functional garments throughout the coming years.


IS EVO WASHABLE?

The EVO is Machine safe and washes with your current workout garments (just remove the weights).  

HOW MANY WEIGHTED CELLS DO I GET?

Each EVO comes with 20 lbs of weighted cells. Each cell is linked to form a chain of 12. Extra cells can be ordered in increments of 20 lbs.

IS THERE AN AGE LIMIT?

EVO is for ALL ages! The precaution is that the use of the weighted cells must be graduated slowly. It's perfect for any age group - children, parents, grandparents, amature athlete, Professional athlete, weight loss, muscle gain, anyone. (initial EVO'S will be made at our already prescribed adult sizes)

WHAT ARE THE SIZES?

The EVO comes in sizes based on measurements of an individual's calf, thigh, Hip, forearm, bicep, chest.  This is because the fit must be like a second skin so the weighted cells stay where they must for comfort and optimal performance. Sizes are XS, S, M, L, XL, 2XL. (we will be looking to assess the viability of making custom sizes because we know that as a people, we come in many sizes)

WHAT ARE THE COLORS?

Currently EVO will only be available in black. Keep an eye out for new EVO styles following our Indiegogo campaign.

WHAT ACTIVITIES CAN EVO BE USED FOR?

The EVO was designed to be suitable for ANY activity. For all levels of fitness! From the professionals to the novice, Whether it be swimming, tennis, golf, football, yoga, walking, basketball, TRIATHLETE, Ballet, swimming, track and field, or ANYTHING else involving moving! EVO is perfect for your lifestyle no matter the style.  


CAN I USE OTHER TYPES OF WEIGHTS WITH EVO?

I do not recommend using different weighted components. The performance and functionality of the EVO suit may suffer and so may your joints and connective tissues.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

Just because you are unable to contribute doesn’t mean you can't help! Share our campaign on Facebook and tweet it out on Twitter. Let your family and friends know about EVO. The more people know, the quicker this product can get to you.

Please use any of the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all there is to it. Let's all finally get fit by living as we already do.

story:
This is Remi, my type 1 baby.

We were fortunate enough to be able to get her meter and pump on or own after 5 years of effort and saving money.  Seeing mom and dad struggle to get her medical supplies (that insurance will not cover)  she had a great idea. Let's create a place where people can donate, and we can buy the supplies that kids need. She is an amazing 8 year old girl! So with her idea in mind I have created this page to allow for donations that will be used for insulin pumps, and continuous glucose monitors. 

These are vital tools for any diabetic, and any parents taking care of a juvenile with diabetes. Every donation will make a difference no matter how small or large, even 1 dollar from several people ads up fast.  She would be glowing to know that she helped even one person get their blood sugar under control, or helped a family get much needed rest. For every $5000.00 raised we can afford a pump, a CGM, and the necessary training to use these tools. A continuous glucose monitor allows a parent to monitor their child remotely, without poking their finger 10+times a day. The pump allows for insulin delivery without the use of syringes, so no more bruised arms, legs, and bellies.

 It also has alarms which can be set to notify you of low or high blood sugar levels. This is extremely helpful, especially in the middle of the night. 

 I KNOW that the sleepless parents and diabetic children out there can have a better quality of life with these tools from my own experience   Thank you for taking a moment to read this.

story:
Hello,

Meet Jacqueline Means. Jacqueline volunteers at a great place called Neighborhood House which helps parents in her community by providing affordable and funded after school care and homework help. Jacqueline gets involved by teaching chess and helping with homework, but since cheering is her life, she couldn't avoid sharing her enthusiasm with younger girls in her neighborhood. Not only is she on the cheer squad at her school, she has been a competitive cheerleader since the age of three years old. After all that practice and dedication, she has some major moves and some of the girls in her community wanted to learn them. She begin teaching routines to some of the girls for fun. More girls joined. The project has now became an informal cheer team with Jacqueline as the captain. What started out as a little fun time after homework, has become a group of girls with some mad cheering skills. The girls have gotten so good that they want to share their cheering skills with others. 





We want to purchase uniforms for the girls, and then hit the road to visit retirement homes, veteran's hospitals, and Ronald McDonald House to do some real “Cheering-Up” for folks in need of a smile. After the girls get some practice cheering-up folks, the goal is to also participate in competitive exhibition cheering. There are a total of 14 girls on the “Cheer-Up” Team. Each girl will need $100 which will pay for a full uniform, and cheer bows, the balance will go towards Indiegogo fees and paying for transportation costs. 

These girls are low income and unfortunately they do not have the money to go out and purchase items needed for the team. Your donation would help make their dream of having new uniforms a reality! We appreciate any amount that you are able to give and look forward to the day when we can send participant's pictures of the girls wearing their new uniforms!


                                  


Other Ways You Can Help

No amount is too small! We really appreciate any support.  If you are unable to donate at this time, you can also just share the page so others can donate.

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Hello,Meet Jacqueline Means. Jacqueline volunteers at a great place called Neighborhood House which helps parents in her community by providing affordable and funded after school care and homework help. Jacqueline gets involved by teaching chess and helping with homework, but since cheering is her life, she couldn't avoid sharing her enthusiasm with younger girls in her neighborhood. Not only is she on the cheer squad at her school, she has been a competitive cheerleader since the age of three years old. After all that practice and dedication, she has some major moves and some of the girls in her community wanted to learn them. She begin teaching routines to some of the girls for fun. More girls joined. The project has now became an informal cheer team with Jacqueline as the captain. What started out as a little fun time after homework, has become a group of  girls with some mad cheering skills. The girls have gotten so good that they want to share their cheering skills with others. We want to purchase uniforms for the girls, and then hit the road to visit retirement homes, veteran's hospitals, and Ronald McDonald House to do some real “Cheering-Up” for folks in need of a smile. After the girls get some practice cheering-up folks, the goal is to also participate in competitive exhibition cheering. There are a total of 14 girls on the “Cheer-Up” Team. Each girl will need $100 which will pay for a full uniform, and cheer bows, the balance will go towards Indiegogo fees and paying for transportation costs. 
These girls are low income and unfortunately they do not have the money to go out and purchase items needed for the team. Your donation would help make their dream of having new uniforms a reality! We appreciate any amount that you are able to give and look forward to the day when we can send participant's pictures of the girls wearing their new uniforms!
                                  
Other Ways You Can Help
No amount is too small! We really appreciate any support.  If you are unable to donate at this time, you can also just share the page so others can donate. 
Thank you for your support!
